Tara was growing testy as the hours rolled by. Here she was, waisting precious time on a creature who could have very well been a figment of imagination. It was insanity! How could she have possibly believed that she saw,... well... what she saw? ...It was insane. But there was no doubt no matter how hard she thought back to that moment. She had definitely seen a person out here the size of an insect. And thanks to her blundering, she had frightened the poor thing away! She flipped the next page of her novel over with a sharp flick of her wrist, not even reading the final sentence, just interested in expressing her annoyance with her hands.

She hadnt been able to stand herself for the past few hours. Waves upon waves of self-negative thoughts flooded her brain as she cursed herself for completely ruining the experience of a lifetime. The little man... woman... she wasnt able to tell which it was due to the short amount of time she had eyes on it, but she could only feel terrible for scaring it off. All that could be done now was to wait and hope it would return. Afterall, Tara had only just arrived here. There was still a few days before she would have to go back home.

---
112131111411121111.title: If you cant trust Tara, who can you trust?

choices: Your right arm is snapped
You`re bruised but otherwise alright
A flawless victory! Not one scratch
1121311114111211111.content:
For the entire walk, your nerves were at the boiling point. Why,oh why, did your teeny little brain think this was a good idea!? Crossing an open patch of dirt, surrounded on all sides by thick grass that could be concealing god knows what, just so you can take the unnecessary risk on approaching a giant woman you really didn't know anything for certain about her character!? So what if she was an academic like you, or that you seemed to share interests in nature, or that whenever you looked at her you felt a sense of warmness and ease, or that she was absolutely stunning...

You drove your boot into the dirt, sending pebble sized grains of sand exploding out from the ground as they were kicked away.

"Dammit! Get your head straight you idiot!", you shouted to yourself, immediately regretting what you just did.

The moment after your little emotional outburst, you took notice of the sound a rustling withing the forest of grass far on your right. Whatever it was, it was fairly large; large enough to trample blades of grass under its weight. The telling sign that Trevorina had come back once again for her mortal enemy. Quickly, blades of grass split from each other as Trevorina breaches from their ranks and repeats the same old song and dance from the many times before; a high chattering sound and a mad dash towards you. It was routine at this point, but that hardly made it any easier to defend yourself against her in a drawn out fight. You had to give it to the beast, she was quite the unpredictable fighter once she got blood thirsty enough in the heat of battle! You unsheathe your spear and ready yourself for her first attack, which always came as a frenzy of gnashing fangs as she attempted to take a bite out of you! A quick duck and roll to her side, leaves her exposed for you to ram your spear into her side, leaving a fresh new scar to join its twins on her body. The proud monster squeals in pain, as it raises its legs into the air and brings them down with enough force to skewer you. You push yourself out of the way of each strike, before quickly transitioning back on your feet and begin batting the attacks aside with your spear! It performs its spider version of rearing in an attempt to intimidate and you answer with a stance that would impress a novice ancient Spartan. You both exchange roars of fury before the next wave of attacks begin!

---

Tara rolled the sleeves of her shirt up with a sigh, and checked the time on her para-cord watch.

8:25 PM

Soon enough that sun was going to be heading out for the night and leaving this place in darkness... not to mention chilly. It was getting to the point where Tara would be inclined to follow its lead and head to bed herself. She did have a schedule to keep after all, and that included getting up early in the morning to take photo's of the plant life covered in the glistening morning dew, and get other menial tasks out of the way before conducting more research for her paper. She closed her book and tossed it behind her into her tent. For the next few minutes, her full focus was going to be keeping an eye out for her little friend. She leaned back into her chair, arms crossed over her chest, and a determined look on her face as she squinted her eyes down at the ground ahead of her and slowly scanned for any sign of movement. It didn't take long before a familiar scene came into her view. A barren patch of dirt, devoid of any grass or fauna of any kind, was serving as the battleground for a deathmatch between two shapes that she couldn't discern at this distance, but had detected a hint of familiarity at them.

Tara's eyes widened with joyful hope as she leaned in closer from her chair, before rising up and taking two gentle steps towards the action below her.

---

At this point in the fight...
1121311114111211111.title: Trevorina! My old nemesis!

choices: She delicately picks you up.
She swiftly tosses you into a bug box.
She lays prone and attempts to communicate.
11213111141112111111.content:
Once again you feel, rather than witness, the immense beings approach. However, you are not in good enough shape to waste your attention. Upon Trevorina’s last charge she had paused, reared up, and grappled your spear with her remaining appendage.You didn't notice she used her middle right front to add to the effort while her middle front left began basically punching you. This was new, she was learning to hunt tiny humans. Blow upon blow and finally your suit isn't enough as the next one causes your arm to go up at an odd angle, dislocating it. You scream in pain, jumping back. Trevorina does not immediately pursue, reveling in your pain it seems.

You don’t have anything left. Your spear would do little with one arm, you were exhausted, and your arm burned in pain. This was it, natural selection had finally caught up to you. Your work, your life, all for nothing. And all you’d end up as is dinner for a hungry spider. Truly nothing.

The shadow, the displacement of air. It was still alien to you, but you understood its significance. Looking up, away from the monster before you, you see what is infinitely more frightening. The woman has an angry sneer on her face and well beneath that is lowering her immense sandal clad foot onto your area. It seems the nature lover is willing to crush the spider to save her unique find, you. Still, you cant help but tremble as the dirt covered sandal falls closer and closer.

Trevorina seems to realize the danger, but to late. She darts forward, seems she wants to take you with her. But her frightening visage is replace by a black soled sandal, and the not insignificant big toe upon it. Trevorina was no more. You were safe. Maybe...The toe shifts lightly as the woman adjusts her balance. You felt like kissing your savior, but your exhaustion, and the spider guts, prevent that.

You fall to your back and stare up the woman’s seemingly endless leg, passing over every feature until you reach her face. It looks sad that she had done what she did, but also full of concern and curiosity to you. There was no escaping this time. You had ceded complete control to this woman who you knew nothing about other than she seemed to appreciate nature. What does she do?
11213111141112111111.title: Your right arm is snapped

choices: Stay with Tara for the night
Ask that she bring you to your shelter
Insist that your fine on your own
112131111411121111111.content:
You had to give it to ol' Trevorina, she got you good in the end. It almost upset you that after all this time, she would die as insignificant a death as literally being stepped on like a bug. Perhaps, it was the fact that she was the one constant being that you could rely on to provide sheer excitement or that she was just simply always there, but a part of you had grown... attached to the wolf spider. At least enough that you felt her death should have come by your hands in the heat of a fight. You would have to give her the respects she deserved later, because right now, you were having a hard enough time just remaining conscious through the agony that throbbed in your arm. As you lay there on your back, your eyes getting heavy, you watch as Tara, face full of distress and concern, knelt down on one knee before you, her hands hovering high above your puny little broken body, as if she was afraid to touch and hurt you. It was relieving to see if you were being honest.

Through the fuzziness in your head, you hear the woman begin to speak in her powerful voice, as she places a massive hand in the dirt beside you and leans in closer down to you.

"Hey.", she speaks delicately and urgently at the same time, most likely aware of how intimidating a giant must be to someone like you, and not wanting to cause you any more stress. "Excuse me, are... are you okay?"

It was hard not to chuckle. The relief you felt was almost as much as the pain you were in. You flop your undamaged arm onto your chest, and search with it for your suits speaker function, eventually blindly stumbling upon it and switching it on. The speaker hums with static and noise, but aside from a small bit of damage caused by the late Trevorina, it was still in good enough shape to amplify your voice clearly enough to be understood.

---

Tara could hardly believe it, even as she knelt over what was now more clear to her than ever, a tiny man! Or at least she was almost sure it was a man, due to the fact she couldn't make out any telling features due to it being the size of an ant and covered in spider guts. Nonetheless, she knew she didn't just imagine it! But what should have been one of the most exciting moments of her life, became filled with anxiety and fear, when Tara had to rescue him from the poor little wolf spider she was forced to crush beneath her foot. And now, the little person was on his back and hardly moving, was she to late? Just then, the sounds of nature were interrupted by a low sound that sounded... technological? Tara's gaze left the tiny wounded man as she lifted her head and looked around the area for any indication that somebody else was nearby, when it almost immediately occurred to her, the sound was coming from right below her,... from him.

"My arm... please, I... think its broken."

Tara's breath hitched. He actually answered her, actually confided in the fact that he was completely helpless. Her nerves were wracked, she knew how to treat broken bones, but performing that treatment on someone who's body wasn't even as thick as her pinky finger?... Not so much. There was a med-kit she kept in her bag in her tent that she could use, but she would have to move him there. It was usually taboo to move anyone with broken bones when you didn't have to, but Tara felt uncomfortable working on him out here where other bugs could make a move at him when she left to retrieve the kit. With her mind made up, she once again leaned down closer to him.

"Okay, um... I need to move you into my tent okay? I have a medical kit. Can you stand?"

---

You tried to do what she asked,... after all, your legs were fine as far as you knew, but for some reason, your energy was exhausted.

"No.", you replied with an unsteady voice.

The woman winced after hearing your answer.

"Okay, ... then bear with me, I'm going to have to pick you up."

You felt the dirt shift as she lifted her hand from the ground beside you. Carefully, she began to scoop you into her palm, as she did her best to push beneath the dirt with her open hand right next to your uninjured side, and prod you with the tip of her index finger, gently pushing you into her hand. With you now rested right in the center of her palm, she stood to her full height, causing you to belch slightly as a wave of vertigo from the sudden change in altitude dulled your senses. Composing yourself, you pressed the side of your face against the warm flesh beneath you, feeling the movement and steadiness of her body as she hurried to her tent. For the entirety of your time as a miniature survivor, this was the most surreal moment you have experienced thus far. Your body and mind was used to the bizarre new landscapes, the physically exerting challenges and other experiences that could only be had as a being of diminutive proportions. However, where you were now, would have a place in your memory for the rest of your life. At this moment, you felt safe. more than you had ever felt before. As you laid there on your back, looking up at the woman whose only concern is you, seeing the worry in her face, feeling the warmth of her body,... you couldn't help but almost forget the anguish pulsing through your arm.

When you reached the tent, she gently slipped you off her hand, placing you on top of her pillow. She then rushed over to her bag, pulled out her med-kit and started rummaging through for gauze, and disinfectant, then from a pocket in her bag, she pulled out cuticle scissors. Firstly, she approached you with the tiny pair of scissors, which despite your confidence in her best intentions... did jack your heart rate up a bit. However, with calm and steady hands like a surgeon, she carefully cut up the length of your sleeve to expose your injured arm. Thankfully, there was no protrusion from bones, so the break was clean. You watched as she inspected your arm with her magnifying glass, then the stress leave her face.

"Okay,.. okay, your fine. The bone isn't puncturing your arm at all. I see some deep bruising but nothing that points to damaged blood vessels. I think you'll be fine after some ice and rest.", she then turned once again, this time to her cooler, where she took out an ice cube and smashed bits off it with the blunt end of her pocket knife. With another small piece of ripped gauze, she fashioned a small sling, deposited a couple of tiny ice pieces into the pouch of the sling, tied it off, and placed it under your arm and over your shoulder as accurately as she could. The sting of the ice washed away your drowsiness enough that you could move without feeling like your limbs were dead weight. With the job done, the woman relaxed, sitting cross legged next to her pillow where you were currently resting. She reached over for her water bottle, dabbed the rolled up edge of a tissue in the clear liquid, then began to softly dab at your face and body, cleaning it of dirt and spider gore.

"So...", she said with an exhale. "How are you feeling?"

"I'm better. Thank you."

"I'm Tara by the way."

"Richard."

There was an awkward pause for about five seconds, before Tara began with her line of questioning.

"What are you?"

"Excuse me?"

"Sorry, I mean... are you human or... something else? I wasn't sure before but now that I can see you, you look like a regular man."

"Well, I am a regular man... its a long story."

"What are you doing out here?"

"Same as you I think... to an extent. Studying nature, testing myself, y`know?"

"Hm, sure... you're pretty good at giving answers close to the chest huh?", she said with a smile.

You laughed. "Yeah, heh, I'm sorry I guess I'm just a little exhausted."

"I understand.... Listen, I don't want to be forward but, do you need a place to rest?"
112131111411121111111.title: Tara delicately picks you up.

choices: the next morning
you wake up in the middle of night
something wakes you up
1121311114111211111111.content:
"I uh, I wouldn't want to impose.", you found yourself saying. Though realistically, how much could a bug sized man be a burden to such a giantess.

"No of course not. Its no trouble. It'd be my pleasure!"

You smiled at her. It didn't go unnoticed by you how lucky you were to have such a kind hearted person as your temporary neighbor. Even though the only reason you entered into no mans land in the first place was to get to her, you held no resentment. You made the choice to go out there, so there was no one to blame but yourself. Now that you were thinking of that place though, you were reminded of the unfinished business that was left behind.

"Tell you what, I'll make a deal with you. I'll stay the night, but there's something you could help me with first."

"Oh, sure, okay. What do you need?"

---

It at first, seemed like a strange request, but upon hearing Richards story and the connection he had felt with arachnid, Tars's guilt over crushing the little girl into pulp doubled in her heart. Being an animal lover, Tara had never killed another living creature before... of course she couldn't blame herself if she unknowingly stepped on herds of ants, or slapped away mosquitoes or fly's here and there, but she didn't have the malice inside her to go out of her way to end the life of a living thing. Her only solace was the fact that her intervening saved someones life, and for that, she could forgive herself.

"Hey Tara, don't forget about whats under your sandal too.", Richard called up from her hand, which was clothed in a lime green rubber gardening glove of a set she had brought with her in case she needed to handle poisonous plants.

She had been busy looking down at the mess of corpse she left in the dirt. A gooey puddle of crushed body parts and protruding limbs, when Richard reminded her that the rest may have been plastered to the sole of her sandal this whole time. She slowly knelt down, and allowed Richard to step off her hand onto the dirt, as she removed her sandal. She balanced on one foot as she flipped the sandal over and inspected the bottom, instantly seeing the dried remains of an organ or two lodged between the treads. She carefully picked them away with her gloved hand over top Trevorina's body, until the organs dropped down to be reunited with their host with two soft thuds. Tara then slipped her sandal back on her foot, making a mental note to wash it later.

She looked down at Richard, who was standing still as a statue next to the wolf spider.

"Richard.", Tara spoke with deep sincerity. "I'm sorry."

He looked way up at her face, seeing the hint of empathy in her expression. "No,... no, don't be sorry Tara. Its okay. You saved my life! Dont worry. Its not as if I loved Trevorina, I just feel she deserves some respect. She was out here surviving same as me.", he said in an attempt to console the gentle giantess. Relief washed over his face as he watched a sweet smile shape her lips. "Well, lets not delay this any more. Tara? If you please?"

With a soft giggle, Tara got to work digging a small hole with her covered hand. It only took about two scoops into the dirt before the hole was deep enough to fit two wolf spiders. He gave a final look into Trevorinas eyes, which miraculously, were all still attached to a head that was in good enough shape. Most likely due to the fact that most of Tara's weight was closer to her heel rather than her toes. With a departing mock salute of respect, Tara cupped her hand around the dead spider, and pushed it along the dirt and into the hole, before finally burying it. The two of them stayed still in silence for a moment, Tara back on her knee and Richard standing with his arm in a sling, reminiscing about all the 'good' times he and that spider had together,... trying to kill each other and all that.

After the moment was finished, he caught Tara looking down at him with a soft expression of admiration on her face.

"Richard. That was very kind of you.", she said gently.

His cheeks flushed. Richard was thankful he was to small for her to notice.

"Yeah well, I like to think she would have done the same for me.", he joked, prompting a laugh from Tara.

It was getting dark now. Tara checked her watch.

"9:30. What do you say we get you that rest now, hm?"

In a day filled with bad decisions, that was the best one he heard. He agreed, and Tara scooped him back up into her hand before going back into her tent and setting him on top of the cooler next to her sleeping bag. She asked him to wait there and she returned with a folded piece of cloth along with a smaller separate piece, which you assumed correctly was to be your bed and blanket for the night. A significant downgrade from what you had at home but it would suffice. She set the sleeping space up next to you and excused herself, telling you she would just be outside changing. It didn't take long after you settled into your bed, for her to re-enter the tent, day clothes bundled under her arm, and her now dressed in grey cotton shorts and a black long sleeved top. She carried about her business, settling herself into her sleeping bag as you watched her. She truly was a beautiful woman.

"Tara?", she stopped in a sitting position, and looked at you. "I just wanted to say... I'm glad we met each other."

She smiled a gentle smile. "Me too, Richard. Goodnight."

"Goodnight."

With that, Tara switched off the lamp, and darkness filled the tent.
1121311114111211111111.title: Adios, old girl

choices: You heal, and reunite with the giantess tomorrow
Grow back to normal, don't give up your leverage!
You hide in your shelter and hope she forgets!
1121311114111211111112.content:
You stared up in to her immense face. How was this conversation so normal, yet so weird. She gazed down on you with all the concern in the world. "Actually, could you take me to my shelter?" Her eyes light up, a bit surprised at your request. You almost felt bad, she'd done so much for you. "I...I have tools there to make sure I'm healed...not that you haven't done a great job!" You briefly hug your arm, it hurts but the giantess has done a remarkable job for something so small, you return your attention upwards, towards her great face, she could easily refuse your request. Her green eyes seem to stare holes through you. You can tell even with this level of difference, she doesn't want to lose sight of you again, she wants to learn more, and she more than has the power to do so. But you also judged something else correctly, shes kind.

A frown crosses her mouth. She clearly wanted to learn more about you. "Look, I've been having fits since this afternoon, I thought you were a figment of my imagination. Like I literally thought I was going crazy." You can't help but hear her words, they thunder down on you after all. Despite the clear difference, you do feel a bit bad that she's felt crazy all day. But this has to happen. "I need to go back to my shelter. Its the only way I can heal properly." You pause for a second, looking up at eyes filled with curiosity, but also concern. This is the ultimate test. "Please..." You are so entranced by the face above you, you almost miss the frown, but it's several car lengths long and impossible to miss. "okay" how could something so immense whisper? "I just...would you please come out tomorrow? I want to know you, if you're ok with that?" You nod, you'd like to know her better, then realizing there's no way she sees your simple head movements, "Yes, I'd love to talk tomorrow." Her smile eclipses the sky and you are happy just because she is. "ummm, where is your home by the way?" You point in the direction of the tree, she looks up and begins pacing that way, your furniture is probably all askew you fear, as her footfalls approach the base of the tree.

"'Here?" She states, as you crawl to the edge of her hand. she has located the small cylinder that is your home. "Yes!" you wave your good arm, she saw that. As delicately as a 1300 foot person can, she set her hand down next to your home for the last 4 months. This was surreal, you'd never expected this scenario. You climb down her middle finger, just next to the entrance. Her hand retracts, and you stare up at the titanic beauty you now knew as Tara. She was crouched over your form, over your world... but as past experience noted that was not enough. You were overwhelmed by her presence, and hell you wanted to tell her. But you couldn't and a part of you felt stupid to do so anyway. You waved your good arm again. She understood as you opened the door, all under her watchful eye. You turn and look up at her one least time. You couldn't leave it here. She gazes down at you as you use your boot to carve a message into the ground. It took several moments, the whole time you felt her intense gaze, not her fault you were so small, you figured. You finished the message, and she peered in closer, bringing her face uncomfortably close to the ground. You almost ran for the shelter. But it retracted, a huge smile on her face. "Tomorrow then!" She proclaimed. You had written tomorrow, Now you were committed to it. After all, she knew exactly where you lived...

Rising back to her full terrifying height, the giantess smiles down at you. Then turning, she proceeds back to her tent. The journey only seconds for her, her massive hips swaying...NO You gotta heal. Hell, maybe you should return to normal size. What to do?
1121311114111211111112.title: Ask that she bring you to your shelter

choices: Nothing, the sleeping pills knocked you out hard.
You fully suited up and ready to answer all questions.
Another battle! The ants have attacked your home!
11213111141112111111121.content:
The thudding lessens as Tara reaches her tent, casting one last look at your home before entering it. You almost wave, but you know there’s no way she can see you at this distance. She’s just looking in your area. You sigh and enter the shelter.

The next hour is fairly taxing. You open the medical bag up, filled with all kinds of tools and drugs you hoped you'd never need. You find an arm sling and force you injured arm in. It burns like a mother-. You then pop a couple of pills. You'll be feeling much happier in a couple of hours. Finishing the last bandages you finally sit in your chair and lean back. Dozens of scattered thoughts flicker through your head. You finally settle on the loudest. What the hell had happened today? You had met this person, whose pinkie finger was wider than you were tall, completely unprepared, made a hell of alot of bad decisions, and nearly been eaten then crushed like poor big Trevorina. And tomorrow, man what would that hold?

So far Tara had been nothing but kind and gentle, but once you spilled your secrets, who knows? Living out here, you made all the decisions, took all the risks, now she’d be the one in charge. Hopefully she’d understand the value of your work, and not recognize this for what you worried, a well organized mid life crisis. You were already worried what she thought of you! You begin to think back to those beautiful green eyes bigger than cars. You cant help but smile as the drugs you took start to take control. Few intelligent thoughts linger before exhaustion overtakes you and you fall asleep.

—
Tara probably wished she had something similar to put her to sleep. But the today had been the kind of day you cant just fall asleep after. Her mind was wracked with thoughts over the tiny man. What did he mean regular man? He was the size of an ant! What was that cylinder? He called it his shelter. Was he lying, was he a little alien and that was his ship? No, she’d seen his bruised skin, he looked human, at least as best she could tell with a magnifying glass. She wondered if she’d need something more powerful for other parts of his anatomy...

Her mind screamed! Tara Reed James what exactly are you thinking of! She turned her head sideways onto to pillow, this day was driving her insane. But she couldn’t wait for tomorrow. She could just go over there, dig out his little box and demand answers,. Once again she screamed at herself internally. That wasn’t right! He wasn’t some insect to be studied, he was a thinking feeling human being, and she had no right to steal his freedom like that. She pushed the thought to the back of her head. Her eyes focused on the spot in the pillow where he had been just a couple of hours ago. Already it was starting to seem like a fantasy. She thought back to his brave stand against the spider, her relief in saving him, the joy she got out of being able to heal him. With those thoughts she drifted off to sleep.

—-
Tara awoke with a start, checking her watch, it was 10:48! They hadn’t set a time she realized, but surely he had been waiting on her. Shit, shit, shit! She had slept in her t-shirt and undies from the day before. She probably didn't look great. Or smell great. She couldn't go like this. Slipping on her brown shorts she did what she could to make herself presentable. Cautiously she peeked her head out of the tent towards the nearly invisible cylinder., as if she would see him. Shaking her head, she realizes if he was there he'd see her but not vice versa. Darting out she bounds quickly over to the stream to dash her face and turns back to the tent before gasping. What was she doing! She hadn’t once watched where she was stepping. She could have crushed him! Use your head! Now with infinite caution she examines every step. Announcing to her unknown audience below how sorry she was and how careful she’d be. She carefully and agonizingly slowly makes her way back to the tent. Finally reaching it she sighs. Ok they would have to work out some kind of system here. Idly shifting her right foot before entering the tent feels a little pop under her heel. In terror she checks to see if she crushed the little man. She exhales upon seeing a tiny acorn. Whew. Finally she finished her last preparations, brushes her teeth, slips on the spider killing sandals, and cautiously and ultra carefully approached the small cylinder between the roots of the massive oak tree. What does she find?
11213111141112111111121.title: You heal, and reunite with the giantess tomorrow

choices: You return momentarily with your suit.
You activate the size ray.
You find a way out of this encounter, on your level, in some way!
112131111411121111111211.content:
You should have gone to bed!

Your drool soaks your shirt as you snore a bit. You're waking form realizes there's a reason to be aware, you just don't quite remember what. It was the first time this had happened since your last close brush of death with Trevorina, when you took her leg.

Snapping awake, you look around. Ok, everything is where it should be, more or less, your bed's a mess, when is it not, the screen in front of you is displaying the remaining cameras...

That's when you recognize, and feel, the thuds echoing within your shelter. The cameras only caught glimpses, but the feeling, that's something you'd only felt in previous encounters twice before. You smack your head, get it together! You stare down at the floor, extremely perturbed by the increasing thuds that echo through your home.

---

Tara stood before the cylinder. It was nestled between the tree roots of the big oak above, and now her feet stood somewhat close to it. She didn't want to intrude per se, but she wanted answers. Her kindness was being tested by...whatever it was living in that cylinder. She'd saved his life, gotten his name, taken him home. And now? She could just uproot the thing, demand she answer her questions. As she stood above the cylinder she began to become worried. "Richard, are you ok? Please, let me know you are ok?" The long pause worried her. What if that damn spider had nicked him, what if the trauma overcame him, and now he was dead? She hated to think of that, but it was possible. Slowly as she could she crunched down onto her heels. Staring down at the cylinder, she carefully brought up her right pointer finger. With as much delicacy as she could manage, she banged on the metal door.

---

BANG* BANG* BANG*

It wasn't pleasant to your ears to hear such a cacophony ringing throughout your shelter. For a moment through the pause in noise, you wondered for the first time if contact with a human was t he worst idea ever. Humans were innately curious, there was no hiding here. And, oh yeah, also, she could end you on a whim!

You had to calm down, however, the bangs return, BANG* BANG* BANG*. She'll destroy your roof panel at this rate! Or worse, she'll uproot your home from its hole, what a disaster!

You are not well dressed, a too short white t and boxer shorts, nonetheless, you rush out the inner door, past your berries, and up the stairwell to the exit. When you arrive, you find the metal slightly warped. A testament to the giantesses unknowing power. With great effort, you force the lever open. You climb out and are met by the disruptor of your world. She exists over you and your home, her 1300 foot form, crouched or not, focused intently on you. She stares holes into your ill dressed form. You focus on her domineering face, too entranced to notice the knees that almost hover over you, the feet no more than 250 feet away that could crush you into paste. She steadily lowers herself as low as she can and stares at you as you feel the primal urge to reenter the shelter. You cannot take your eyes off her immensity, and she seemingly can't take her eyes off you.

You stagger for a moment under he intense gaze. "Ok, so ummm, I think you have some questions Tara, am I right?" She seems to study you for a moment, its unnerving to be sure. Suddenly she giggles, loud to you, "Do you wanna get dressed first?" You look down at your paltry garments and blush. You are borderline naked! "Umm yeah thanks..." you mutter. "Hmmm?" She didn't catch any of that. why would she? You weren't in your suit. Your actions wouldn't have communicated with her. You give her the biggest thumbs up you can manage, that makes her smile, "I'll be back in 20!" her smile fills your sky, but soon her form is all you can focus on, as she raises herself from the earth. You can literally FEEL her gaze upon you, then she slowly turns and proceeds back to her tent. You have 20 minutes.
112131111411121111111211.title: Nothing, the sleeping pills knocked you out hard.

choices: You take her on a tour and explain.
You spin a tall tale.
You pull a poisoned blade, time to end this interfering one!
1121311114111211111112111.content:
You prepare yourself, much more than you had in months. You even check your breath, Is she REALLY gonna notice that? You slide into the suit slowly, your arm is aching. It may not be broken but it hurts a ton. You won't be using it anytime soon, you realize. You stare off into the wall. You were already a pathetic bug to her before, how about when you couldn't move or fight. You pessimism is about to overtake you when you realize that communicating with her may be a whole new chapter in your study on shrinking. Yeah, a whole new way to learn, to live! With some renewed confidence you ascend the stairs, and gaze across the glade to the city sized tent and the woman emerging from it. She gives a look around, a smile, then begins walking towards your shelter. Every step shakes your core, her boots shake the earth and she doesnt even notice, her movements remind you of your place far down the food chain as her feet come to rest no more than a hundred feet away. You'd be terrified, but her countenance is one of compassion and caring. Who would be afraid of that, regardless of size.

"Hey, so you ready for today?" Her voice thunders around you, but its so full of innocence and hope you can't help but smile. You stick out your hand, thumb protruded once again. You agree. She smiles. With little warning her massive hand lands next to you, compacting the earth. "Ready?" You stare up at her, entranced, "Yes" you mumble, as you climb up her pointer finger. Today was going to be interesting.
1121311114111211111112111.title: You return momentarily with your suit.

choices: Kicks up the ant hill to give you a look inside.
Asks to see other sights.
Places you near the hill and asks to see your fighting skills.
11213111141112111111121111.content:
You walk down her pointer finger to the center of her palm, a journey that seemed ridiculously long considering its real world distance. Coming to the center, you sit down upon the open, expansive palm and stare up at Tara. “Ready!”, the suit amplifies your voice just enough to be audible. “Where am I taking us?” Shoot, you hadn’t thought about that. What exactly could you show her? You hadn’t really left this relatively small area in months. Thinking hard, it comes to you. Just show her everything, your stories will hopefully be enough to distract her from the comically limited area. Pointing past her tent, towards a smaller birch tree with a bush at its base, over there. Noticing your tiny limb pointing, Tara proceeds the 20 or so steps to the base of the tree. You use the brief moment to trace your hand along the pam, your hand moving gently up and down the rolling bumps that were her wrinkles in the skin. Practically imperceptible at full size. You don’t notice the far off fingers twitch slightly in the distance at your actions. You are broken from your trance as Tara stops, she looks inquisitively at you. “Here?”

Jumping up you run to the edge of her hand when suddenly your world shakes. Tara had instinctively reacted to your movement thinking you might fall and jerked the hand back, while moving the other beneath to catch you. The rapid movement almost caused what she hoped to prevent as you fell to your hands and knees, hoping not to fall off. A brief pause later and you hear Tara apologizing repeatedly. “I’ so so so sorry, I freaked out. Won’t happen again.” You give her a small glare as you rise to your feet but stop when you realize you shouldn’t be rude to someone holding your existence in one hand.

You look down to the forest floor from a perspective you had not had in over 4 months. Noticing the berry bush you point towards it. “That’s where I’ve been getting my berries!” A small pause and her expectant eyes shut as she giggles, rumbling through you, but kinda pleasurable, like a massage bed. “Ok?” She seems to have been expecting more.

“Uhm, well I once had to kill 20 ants in one day fending off one I had cut down. That earned a little more attention from her. Crouching slowly she brings her hand out from her body a bit more. “Could you show me?” You look for the exact spot and point towards the edge of the bush closer to your shelter. “Right there, it was insane. They are nearly the size of medium dogs, and worse they just keep coming. At one point I thought I was done for when one got its mandibles around my chest and frikin lifted me off the ground! The jaws are strong as hell, but the suit held up long enough for me to plunge my knife straight into its head.”

Tara went from amusement to wonderment to disgust during your tale. “Gosh I bet that was awful.” “Yeah but its necessary, the micro world is unforgiving. Its truly survival of the fittest. Ants are pretty interesting though, their colony is just over there if you don’t mind.” You point and Tara nodded, rising slowly, only needing to take 6 steps to reach the base of a large dirt anthill. She dare not get closer or she’d likely cause a frenzy.

You stare down at the anthill for a long moment. “I’ve only been closer one time before.” Tara’s eyes got wider, “you came here?!?” You rub the back of your head sheepishly. “Hey I’m a scientist. I felt it too good of an opportunity to study the colony from such a unique perspective. Didn’t stay long, just placed some cameras and got outta here once some of the big soldiers came after me. They are like Saint Bernard huge.” You pause for a moment as you both gaze at the ants going about their business, either unknowing or uncaring of the colossal entity and her little companion looming over their home. “Ants are truly fascinating for my studies. They work efficiently as a collective, and more importantly for my studies, their impact on the local environment is so minimal, even helpful. Hell, that one little spot in front of you houses hundreds of thousands if not millions! Think of the possibilities!”

You were rambling, but Tara was focused on your words. She seemed to at least appreciate your desire to learn. Turning her gaze back to the anthill, she asks “So you never went in?” “God no, I’d be dead in moments! I’m not sure how that would work.” Tara stares contemplatively at the ant hill, vibrations rumble through you as she HMMMs. Tara...
11213111141112111111121111.title: You take her on a tour and explain.

choices: Stuffs you into her bra.
Stuffs you into her boot,
Ties you to her hair.
112131111411121111111211112.content:
"So, what other sights have you discovered?" Her voice rumbles through her hand and through your tiny body. A big smile puts you at ease, you point towards a large rock. "Let's talk there." She nods, and walks over to the rock. At best it was knee high to her, to you it had been an indomitable rock. She lays her massive bulk against the rock. "So, can I get an answer on what you are?"

You sigh, but she had earned an explanation. "I'm a human, like you, I just shrunk myself to study living at this size." Her eyebrow raises, uncertain if you are telling the truth. "Seriously, I invented this technology to better humanity, to solve all our problems, but I had to live life down there to make sure it was possible." You gazed up at two green eyes seeming to stare holes in your existence. "I get it, I think", you sighed in relief. She understood. "Seems like you could have planned better for this, like have a normal sized person to help you out." You nod, "but then it wouldn't be actual survival, it would be a farce." You both seem to stare off a bit, you speak up "I do appreciate your help, but if humanity is gonna live at this size, SOMEONEs gotta find a way to see if it can work." The giantess stares at you, judging your decisions. You shiver a bit. Then she lights up. "Oh my god, you're kinda like a hero, a little hero!" She smiles sweetly at you. Wow, you had lucked into such a caring person, what would happen next?

"So, I used to visit this spot as a kid, would you mind joining me in the oak tree, we can talk more there?" "Uhm, I guess I can use my pulley system..." Tara laughs softly, rather loud to you, "I can take you up there with me! It'll be easy." You search her body for options to carry your tiny body. "Uhm....are you............"

Before you can say anything further, Tara...
112131111411121111111211112.title: Asks to see other sights.

choices: She realizes you aren’t there!
She takes you into her hand to continue talking.
She finds you somewhere unexpected.
1121311114111211111112111123.content:
“Here you go!” She giggles as she brings you up to her strawberry brunette hair. The immensity of her head is not lost on you as you approach a few rope like strands of her hair. Despite her time out here you faintly smell lavender.

Grabbing a handful of strands you tie them to your body. You hope your tieoff job is enough, then you shout into the ear not far from you “Ready!”

Tara grins, you wait in nervous anticipation as she eyes up the tree. Only now do you worry she’ll crush your home!

Too late to object. Tara takes a running jump, her feet digging into the tree. Suddenly you feel inverted. Tara has grabbed the main branch and is hanging upside down. You are hanging several hundred feet off the ground, swaying in her hair. You can’t help but scream. Tara finds this amusing, confident that you are safe. She pulls herself up onto the main branch and then rests her backside to the tree. She reaches up to grab you when...
1121311114111211111112111123.title: Ties you to her hair.

choices: Agree to act as bait for Tara's nature investigations
Ask Tara to relocate your base
Set out on a day trip with the giantess
Spend a night inside her tent
Tell her to leave you alone, you want to survive yourself without help!
11213111141112111111121111232.content:
You have barely managed to keep your stomach from heaving through the turbulence, and as you swing to a standstill, upright and dangling from the hair tied around you, you look down to see Tara's tanned palm beneath you. Slipping loose of your bonds - with terrifying ease! - you freefall into her comforting embrace.

You stand on that warm, fleshy plain and look out across her flattened fingers, taking in the vast vista beyond. From the height of this tree, the landscape drops away into a humbling, majestic view, the glory of nature laid bare, rolling forest and meadow spread out before you. And at such a height! At your decreased scale, this is like looking down from a mountain, not to mention the fact that you also sit in the hand of a giant goddess.

That goddess addresses you, warmth rolling from her voice in waves. "Pretty cool view, huh? I could look at this all day, but I do have work to do, and so do you..."

You look up into her face, that massive, powerful face, which somehow manages to blush at asking a question of you, an insect-like nothing!

"Anyway. Uh, I was thinking, if it wasn't too much trouble, we could go over the options available to us, up here with clear air to help us think.

"For me, I could use some help on drawing out some of the rarer bugs and critters out there. They'll go running if they see me coming, but when they see you, they'll just see prey!"

She wants to use you... as bait?

"Now don't worry, I'll be close by, to take pictures! I'll step in if you're in danger! Like with the spider, yeah?"

Hmm...

"Well, that's just suggestion one! I mean, we could do something for you! I could move your cute little shelter somewhere else if you want - anywhere you want! This place can't be that thrilling, and there must be somewhere better you'd like to go?"

That is a point - this giantess could easily transplant your base, and there are many possibilities out there!

"Or we could just go for a small trip - I'll leave your home here, we can go for a walk in the nearby area and explore, see some other sights! I can bring you back any time you want, and think of what stuff you can gather!"

Hmm, a day trip might be interesting, with this colossus carrying you about!

"I understand if you want to stay here, though. But maybe... Maybe you'd like to spend a night in the safety of my tent? I worry about you all alone out there..."

You can't continue to meet her gaze as she utters the last statement, and think to yourself about what you really want even as your platform rises, Tara bringing you up to her ear so that you can tell her how you feel without having to shout too much...
11213111141112111111121111232.title: Where To From Here?

choices: Ask Tara to slow down her pace
Ask Tara to put you on the ground
Remain silent, allow Tara to enjoy herself
Climb elsewhere on Tara's body
Take a look inside Tara's bag
112131111411121111111211112323.content:
Best not to rush things. A little walk will give the two of you time to chat, and if you come across a sight that bears further investigation, or a potential new base site, you can act accordingly. It's a good thing that Tara can't see the blush that is creeping across you at her last suggestion, and you try to kill the thought. Staring into the gross depths of her ear canal helps with that; you can make out every spikey hair, every blob of wax.

"Time for a walk, I reckon," you shout into that abyss. "From up here, it'll be like a helicopter tour!"

Without warning, the fingers of the hand you stand on contract, enclosing you in the warmth of the woman's skin and muscle. You resist the natural fear your body wants, and hug back, thankful for the shelter that she provides, protecting you from the outside world as she jumps down from this tree branch.

Moments later, daylight is allowed past the spreading fingers, and you look up into Tara's face as she now stands at ground level. The hand rises to her shoulder, and you hop off to secure yourself atop the megastructure of her clothing.

She stomps over to her tent, retrieving a cannister of liquid and slipping a bag strap pointedly over her other shoulder.

Then you're off! And the landscape lurches by, rising and falling with each step of the woman. Trees pass above you, their dappled shade strobing lights. Below, it's a great distance down the body and legs, and Tara moves far too fast for you to make anything out.

Really, this is pretty unsatisfying. Your unique perspective is being wasted here, as you can make out nothing that Tara herself can't, and being up here limits your view even more! You need to be out there, among nature, to see things truly!

Should you inform Tara of this? You could climb up to her ear, let her know that this isn't doing it for you. Maybe ask her to walk slower, or even lower you to the ground so you can walk together, you spotting things that she can't see.

Then again, she is enjoying herself. She does chatter as she spots a bird fly overhead, and is smiling widely, that grin creeping even into the sliver of her face visible to you. Why ruin that?

You could instead climb elsewhere, get a better view maybe. Somewhere lower on this body.

While you're at it, you could take a peek into that bag she's carrying...
112131111411121111111211112323.title: Take Things Slow with Tara

choices: Tara notices the odd little leaf on her knee as you.
Tara brushes the little leaf off her leg, continuing her search for you.
Tara was referring to something entirely different.
11213111141112111111121111233.content:
All your worries about the safety of your home and your painstakingly crafted tree pulley system fly out of your head as the world falls hundreds of feet beneath you. Your screams of falling, before being grabbed taut by the dozen strands of hair around your waist, are only slightly louder than your subsequent screams when you look straight down. The parachute in your suit comes to mind, you've never needed it, and so, never used it.

Now might be the time as one of the strands breaks loose from Tara’s little knot, and your screams subside as sheer panic sucks the air from your lungs. You compare this to some other encounters you had, and while those were terrifying, you at least had an element of control. Not now, as the giant Tara suddenly lurches upward, her arms pulling her terrific mass close to the tree branch before your world again flips dramatically as she hoists herself onto the tree branch.

A couple more strands go, and you make an executive decision to take matters back into your tiny hands. You pull your knife from its sheath on your upper left arm. Sharpened daily it cuts quickly through the brown ropes of Tara’s hair. Youve no concept of what is going on beyond your immediate field of view, and your uncharacteristic panic causes you not to notice the steadying of the world around, after one last big scooch back by Tara to lean against the trunk of the tree, that is.

The last strand takes a couple of seconds of sawing but your through! Weightlessness holds for a brief second, then replaced by a swift, sickening falling one. Frantically you reach around and press the small switch on your lower left hip. “Please work, please work...”

Your form is jerked upwards by the chutes deployment. “Thank God”. You breathe for a moment, content that the worst is behind you, before glancing down. Tara’s last second readjustments meant you were drifting lazily down towards her body, specifically towards her...



Did you think there were choices here? The forces of physics has you now son! The mild air current, gravity, and the placement of the moving alive earth of Tara guide you on a predetermined path to a spot just above her knee. You look down as you drift over her upper thigh, your eyes can’t help but wander, in wonderment and sadly base attraction. A booming voice snaps you out of your raptured gaze. “Hope that wan’t too rough on you. Here.” You gaze back to see her eyes looking left, her right hand raised above her shoulder grazing the tips of her hair, palm open expectantly waiting for you. You frown, she’ll be waiting without answer, as you can't access the speaker in your current setup, and honestly your not sure shed hear you anyways. After a long pause her voice returns, louder and more jarring as her likely gentle voice rattles the air particles around you, along with yourself. “RICHARD! PLEASE ANSWER ME! ARE YOU OK?”

Her voice is raised in alarm at your lack of response, and you drift close to stomach level, her movements having pushed you further down her body, now a knee landing is inevitable, unless she moves again. You look back again to see Tara staring more or less in your direction, however she is intently studying a patch of hair she has pulled before her face, vainly looking for your form.

The “earth” rushes up to meet you a dozen or so feet, no more than a slight bend by Tara, you suddenly collide with the bare skin, knocking the air out of you and possibly causing a couple of bruises. You lie there catching your breath as the parachute falls over you. From beyond the fabric you hear Tara “What the...” Have you caused an irritation? Is she looking at the leaf colored parachute you currently reside under as you being to slap her skin for all your worth.

Has Tara located you?
11213111141112111111121111233.title: She finds you somewhere unexpected.

choices: Richard waves, he more or less ok.
A weak voice responds, clearly in great pain.
No movement, something has gone terribly wrong.
112131111411121111111211112331.content:
Tara was almost in tears now. After inspecting her hair to an intense degree she began to slowly, delicately, feel through the rest, desperate not to hurt her new little friend. However, with no response forthcoming, and a complete lack of finding any lumps in her hair, she realizes that he must have fallen off at some point during her climb. Immediately a pit opened in her stomach, had she just killed this person? Tiny yes, but a living breathing human being who trusted her. Suddenly a flicker of sensation from her left knee snapped her to attention. A tiny, odd lookIng leaf had landed there. “What the...” Instinctively her left hand raised to brush it off and return to her search, however the leaf looked just odd enough to pause her hand. It look almost like silk...and was something small moving under there?

With a flash of realization snd no small amount of hope, she gently pinched at the very edge of “leaf” and began to Raise it ever so slowly. Her fingers felt the odd material, confirming her suspicions. Then, as she raised further, a small humanoid figure came into focus, connected by thin strings to what must be a chute. Richard...

No movement followed, and her worries returned, as she pulled the figure closer to her face for examination. Was he conscious, she wondered? Hurt? Why was he there in the first place? She pulled the the chute just above her eye, extended her other hand beneath Richards dangling form, and brought him within a couple of inches of her left eye. Closing the other she focused intently on him, looking for answers.
112131111411121111111211112331.title: Tara notices the odd little leaf on her knee as...

choices: Tell me more about what you’re doing out here.
Do a little investigation for my paper here in this tree.
Shrink me too!
1121311114111211111112111123311.content:
Tara breathes a sigh of relief as she sees the pin thin arm wave at her, her breath causing the little man in his chute to swing gently (relatively) back and forth. Tara raises her other hand under the small figure and slowly lowers him onto it. Handling tiny people was so emotionally taxing!

———-

Richard watched the tan, wrinkled surface steadily move towards his feet. His boots touch down and he instinctively rolls his legs, falling onto the hand. He groaned, he’d certainly suffered a few bruises from the ordeal. Dealing with giant people was so physically taxing! Still, Tara’s soft smile and concerned eyes erased some of the pain as he rose unsteadily to his feet. His foot sunk into one of the deeper wrinkles, and was as wide as his foot long. A soft cough swayed him as Tara asked his attention.

“ARE YOU OK?” The vibration rolled up from the palm through his body, oddly pleasurable. Flicking on the speaker, Richard responds, Yeah! No worse the wear!” His fib seemed to satisfy Tara as her concern lessened and relief washed over. “THANK GOODNESS.” Tara leaned back into the tree trunk. Even the impact of her back against the tree created a noticeable wind from the compressed air pushed outward. “I WAS WORRIED MY NEW LITTLE FRIEND WAS HURT. THEN YOU WOULDN’T BE ABLE TO...”
1121311114111211111112111123311.title: Richard waves, he more or less ok.

choices: Okay, I did it because I want to be seen as a saviour
I couldn't trust anyone else not to mis-use the technology!
Shrinking has always been a... personal fantasy of mine
There's no time to go through the correct channels!
Uh, honestly I didn't think this through too hard
11213111141112111111121111233111.content:
"More?" you say, raising an eyebrow that your immense interrogator can't possibly see. "I already told you about why I did this: to help mankind survive on a planet of dwindling resources..."

"Yeah," Tara counters, rolling her eyes before bringing her face closer to her palm, filling your view entirely. "That's your big, long-term goal. But why did you choose to do this yourself, in private? You could have gathered teams of experts to help you with this, gotten funding for a larger scope investiagtion. As it is, you're taking the whole responsibility of saving the world onto your shoulders, with the added risk that if anything should happen to you, no-one will know and your secrets will be lost forever. That's some grade A narcissistic hero complex you got there."

"I thought you were a botanist, not a psychiatrist."

"Hey, can't a girl have multiple interests? I'll take your evasion as a confirmation of my diagnosis, bug boy."

Well, you hadn't considered the perspective she raises. It does seem a tad selfish, to risk the fate of the world on one man. What could be worth such secrecy?

Looking to her cocky smile, you prepare your retort.
11213111141112111111121111233111.title: What's With the Third Degree?

choices: Tara nodding in agreement, just looking for a way to get you back down.
Tara sound asleep!
A somber looking Tara maneuvering a bug box towards you.
112131111411121111111211112331112.content:
You contemplate your response for a moment. There was no single reason per se, but there was a hierarchy of concerns. You turn in her palm to look past her hill like knee towards the glade you’d set up in those months ago. The peacefulness and beauty reminds you of your purpose.

Still staring off you reply “I truly did come out here to find solutions to humanity and the world’s ills. And yes, I did it for myself as well. A true adventure, the likes we can only fantasize about in our day to day mundanity. But as to why I came HERE. Other than a stupid misstep with my initial choice early on that is, was because the implications of this technology are SO great.”

You break for a moment and turn back to Tara’s face. She’s locked on, fully enraptured. You grin for a moment and return to your speech. “You see, this tech has the ability to do great good, but terrible evil as well. I had to be certain of its benefits before I even considered involving anyone else. No colleagues, no friends...not even family could be fully trusted.” Ok, you’re laying it on a little thick now, but the clear sympathy on Tara’s face meant it had worked. "It’s not just accidents or mistakes that put people at risk if shrunk. I worry more about certain human hearts. Imagine a person with no morals or sick desires. With this tech they could get away with horrible injustices...I guess for me people are hard to trust.”

She catches you off guard with her next question. “Then why do you trust me?” “Because I lucked out. Because in the brief span we’ve known each other you’ve not only shown that you are a person curious and concerned for the world, but a gentle soul.” Her wide smile is gratifying but you continue. “You had every opportunity to hunt for me like a madwoman after our first meeting, but you didn’t. You had complete control over me after Trevorina got me, but you healed me and respected my wishes. You had all the power, but you didn’t abuse it. Today you've put up with my simple stories and musings, and despite discovering something that changes everything, you seem more concerned for me than exploiting it for yourself. You are a good person Tara, so I trust you.”

A little sniffle erupts as her nostril flares and you notice a sheen of a tear in her right eye. “Thanks.” She sputters a bit and turns her head. “That’s...uh...great to hear, really. How..how about we enjoy the view for a few more minutes, okay?”

You smile that your simple words did so much, and turn back towards the forest and glade, and plop onto your rear in her palm. She takes a moment to recover, but soon is staring off as well. Nonetheless your sixth sense indicates she’s taking glimpses of you. After 10 minutes you catch yourself nearly falling asleep in her palm. “That was great, but hey I got a few things to tend to, and you’re gonna fail that paper of yours if you don’t get going.” You look over your shoulder to find...
112131111411121111111211112331112.title: I couldn't trust anyone else not to mis-use...

choices: Climb to Tara's ear to wake her up
Nestle to sleep on her knee, be here when she awakens
Climb down to your capsule for rest
Root through her pockets
Head to the treetops for an adventure worthy of legend
1121311114111211111112111123311122.content:
Low rumbles shudder through the entire world, as defined by Tara and her hand that you sit in. Looking up, the bright eyes that once regarded you with such wonder are closed, the mouth below them dropping open to exhale great, regular breaths. You scamper quickly along the palm, jumping from it to the prominent knees just in time, your feet leaving the skin moments before the arm goes limp, dropping the hand to dangle downward.

Dragging yourself to your feet, you consider the resting woman. It must have been a hard day for her to have dropped off to sleep on this uncomfortable tree branch. To see such a powerful being utterly passive, in recline and defenceless, is quite something. Right now, she's little more than a terrain feature, not of the wit or humour in that great brain evident.

Is it safe up here? What is she falls from the tree in her sleep? But wouldn't it be more dangerous to try to wake her right now? Hmm.

You weren't lying when you said you have a few things to tend to, so maybe you should get down to your shelter. If you stay up here without a giant protector awake to protect you, any sort of predator may attack in the night and carry you off!

Patting the warm flesh beneath you, your mind rolls over how much you truly know about this woman. Perhaps you could look through her pockets while she sleeps, learn more about her.

Or, you could arrange a surprise for her when she wakes up. You could climb to the top of the tree, get a full view from up there and have an exciting story to thrill her with come morning.
1121311114111211111112111123311122.title: To Wake a Sleeping Giantess?

choices: Do your best to forget.  Get to the capsule, continue alone.
The body will attract scavengers.  You need to shrink it, to save it.
You should grow to normal size to bury Tara.
You should alert the outside world, have someone find Tara
Merciless, you should salvage what you can from the corpse
11213111141112111111121111233111221.content:
From her knee, you carefully descend to her lap, and then scale her torso, her rugged clothes easy enough to grasp. You swing around to avoid her breasts - don't want to get too fresh here - and crest her shoulder without too much exertion. You stare up at her ear, atop that massive, slender neck, and pull yourself toward it with loose strands of her strawberry-brunette hair. Holding yourself beside that yawning cavern of skin, you lick your lips in anticipation of what you should say.

In the end, you settle for something traditional: "Wakey wakey, sleepy-head!"

The world rumbles again, and you smile at an imagining of the surprise on her face. When she finds out what you've done, she'll laugh too. You jump from the hair to the tree trunk, to get a better view of things as the giantess awakens, clear of being thrown loose by her movements.

Thus, you have a perfect view of Tara falling.

She shakes herself awake, her arms rising, her head from side to side, kicks with a leg, her body following to one side, sending her great form tumbling down to the ground -

The sound of her impact at the tree's foot is the sound of the world ending.

"No, no, no..." you mutter, working yourself down the tree. You're so far up, no matter how much you push yourself there's only so much height you can descend at once, and the sky darkens as you close on the ground.

By the time you're close enough to see Tara's form, you can barely make out her shape. Flicking on your emergency lights, you play the pinprick beams across her, lying on her back, limbs spread. You trace the line of each arm and leg, saving the head until last.

The neck shouldn't be at that angle, bent over the root like that. The eyes stare blindly toward her empty tent, looming right above the entrance to your shelter.

Finally dropping to the ground, you pound it futilely with your fists, blaming yourself for this, you and your stupid prank. Knowing yourself to be so puny, you'd over-inflated Tara's power, imagining her as an invincible, immortal goddess. But she's all too human, and now she's dead. You'll never hear her voice again.

Minutes pass before you raise your head, wipe away tears. This... This is just another challenge. To survive, you'll have to learn to overcome grief. There's no room for it to distract you. But this was a fellow human, and she deserves dignity in death, not to be left here, her loved ones utterly ignorant of her fate.

You're not thinking clearly, and it's dark now and you're alone and you killed someone and you need to make a decision...
11213111141112111111121111233111221.title: Tragedy

choices: Agree wholeheartedly
Refuse outright
Ask for certain guarantees once you return
Tell her you don't like being used
Jump off her hand and leave with your gliding wing-suit
11213111141112111111121111233112.content:
"What?" you reply.

"Well, why do you think I climbed all the way up here, Richard?" Tara says, giggling down at the tiny man in her palm. "I'd like you to take a look inside, tell me what you can see in there. What little bugs are up to when no-one's looking. You'll see what no-one has seen before, give me an edge in my paper! How's that sound?"

She jiggles the hand a little bit, and you wobble while she smiles, willing to subject you to discomfort simply for a moment's levity. And how much worse is her expecting you to risk your life crawling into a dark hole to perhaps give her a marginally higher grade?

But maybe she's not being that callous. It's difficult to read the expression of a being that immense, micro-expressions ironically being harder to make out for a three-eighths inch man.

Still, she is waiting for your response, which is surely a good sign, right?
11213111141112111111121111233112.title: Spelunking

choices: Tara digs up the hideout
Tara calls for an ambulance
Tara runs off to find help
Tara tries macro on micro CPR
Richard's emergency protocols kick in
1121311114111211111112111123313.content:
No, his eyes were closed, no movement..! But how could she possibly apply CPR to a man smaller than her thumbnail?

Tara was in actual tears at her helplessness - Richard was right here, in her hands, and yet may as well have been on the Moon for all the help she could render him! But wait - he must have some equipment that could help in his little base thingy! If she could dig it up, maybe there'd be a little... something... that could help...

Oh, she was just running through wild ideas! She may as well just get out her phone, call for emergency services - it might be better if she didn;t move the tiny man and waited for a professional.

But could she really afford to wait? She could take him in hand and run back to civilisation; it wasn't too far, and someone should be able to help her!

Well, if she was going to be that risky, why not just try and revive him herself. Maybe, the slightest pressure to his chest? The tiniest exhalation of breath?

What was she to do? She didn;t want him to die!
1121311114111211111112111123313.title: Tiny Man, Big Saviour

choices: Tara realised her mistake, and picks up the chute
Tara thinks you just fell, and ignores the 'leaf' as she searches
Tara guesses that you 'teleported' to your shelter capsule, and looks there
Tara heads to her tent for equipment to help her find you
Tara thinks she must have imagined you again
112131111411121111111211112332.content:
Your original plan in choosing a leaf-green parachute had been to blend in with nature, to avoid predators detecting you. Now, that seems like a terrible idea. From her elevated position, Tara sees nothing more than a leaf on her knee, and effortlessly brushes it aside with her hand.

Down where you are, you get your first experience of what her terrible, immense power is like when turned against you. Relentless flesh smashes into you, adding further bruises before sending you into freefall. This time you are entangled with the chute and its lines, plunging with nothing to slow your descent!

Your fingers work tirelessly, tugging and twisting to free your limbs and get the chute deployed again. You turn in mid-air, rolling to bring the main body of your salvation to grab the air, to cushion you best, before the real ground ends your life.

Once more you are jerked as your plan works, and you can breathe easy as you gently descend the last few feet. The parachute settles gently around you as your feet touch down, and you don't have the energy to rell it all it. The best you manage is to pull enough aside to see the outside world, to gaze up the vast distance you just fell, to see the goddess Tara still sitting atop that distant tree branch.

She bellows something, just distant thunder, and then you see her jump free from her perch.

The sunlight is blotted out by the descending giant, and a moment later her feet impact the ground, one great boot either side of you, the greatest quake yet as her vast mass sinks those mountainous forms deep into the earth. Soil chunks are thrown into the air, raining down on you like hailstones. You draw the chute back over yourself for cover, and hope that she's dropped down to look for you.
112131111411121111111211112332.title: Camouflage as a Disadvantage

choices: Richard had ascended the tree, with the help of his pully system
Richard had barricaded himself inside
Richard bursts through the door, in a mad dash towards Tara
112131111411121111111213.content:
What Tara saw once she caught sight of your shelter, froze her place. A swarm of reddish brown colored ants were laying siege to Richards home in forces that looked to be in the dozens! She recognized their color, knowing it belonged to a species of ant that were'nt supposed to be common in a shady tree covered area such as this, but regradless, fire ants were here!

These little bastards had the ability to bite and sting, and though the chances of someone dying were mostly due to volatile allergic reactions,... well... they arent called fire ants just because of their color schemes. These little bastards burned, and Richard was surrounded by them! Tara knew that doing something like plunging her hand in to retrieve Richard would prove more dangerous to him than helpful, especially since she didnt know his exact location. As Tara pondered how to help effectively, she picked up a broken branch nearby with attached leaves, and used it to brush away hordes of ants with powerful swings that sent them flying through the air! Though it didnt seem to matter,... as soon as a dozen of them were cleared, it was as if a new dozen would appear from thin air and take their comrades place. Tara was close to panicking. If she needed to get stung to get Richard out, so be it, but she needed to figure out where he was first!
112131111411121111111213.title: Another battle! The ants have attacked your home!

choices: Agree to have Tara shrink down with you
Shrink Tara but grow yourself to look out for her
Grow back to normal for recovery alongside Tara
Refuse Tara - she accepts and puts your capsule back
Refuse Tara - she takes it badly, and keeps your capsule
11213111141112111111123.content:
You sink into your bed. With all the hurt and excitement, you could sleep for a week. A day should do, though. Yeah, just hunker down here and wait her out; she'll get bored and wander off, and you can be free to continue your solo survival experiment. You can do a full check of your inventory, after you shut your eyes... just.. . for a little... nap...

***

You are woken by the calamitour shaking of your entire capsule world. As you slam into the wall of your bedroom, you conclude this is more than just a tremor from a walking macro-fauna - something is attacking the integrity of your base itself!

With gritted teeth, you manage to mash a hand into the control to bring up the external camera feeds, and see the unmistakable mass of Tara, stooped over the roots of the tree, her fingers digging into its roots -

With a lurch, you enter freefall, seeing a moment of Tara standing up on the screen before the feed cuts out. You slam back into the floor as a thunderous impact echoes through the shell of habitat, again after a moment's pause. Then there is the call, deadened by the metal between you, but clearly the desperate wail of a woman:

"Richard? Richard, are you in there? Are you all right?"

Seems any hope of her forgetting about you and leaving you alone have been dashed. You force yourself upright, lumbering over to the exit hatch. It's difficult to open with one hand - and you're not helped by Tara alternating tapping the capsule and calling your name - and even as you do so, you slump panting on the other side.

The air you were breathing is sucked away from you as a bigger set of lungs gasps above you, Tara leaving you gasping for more than one reason as you look up into her worried face, mere inches from your own. At the periphery of vision, the tips of her finger and thumb can be seen, your mighty shelter held casually by her in one hand! You have to remember not to look down...

"Thank God you're alive!" your abductor says, and a smile rumbles onto that cliff face. "When you didn't show up, I thought... Never mind. What is this thing, anyway? Are you an alien, or something?"

Well, little point in staying secret now. "No, no, I'm a regular person. I just used a device to shrink myself, to better study nature and test myself, see if I can survive in this giant world." You raise your broken arm. "Not doing too well at thay last part right now."

"Really? Wow. That must be incredible." Tara's massive front teeth push out to bite down on her lower lip delicately. "That sounds so cool. To be able to see the world so close, without scaring everything away just by walking. I'd love to see that. I'd like... I mean... Could I join you? I mean, just for a bit! Just to see what you see! It would be, uh, so helpful for my paper! To see the beauty of this world..."

It's strange, seeing a pleading look on a face belonging to a being powerful enough to crush you. The machine is certainly capable of shrinking a second person, and if there is anyone you'd want to have by our side here, Tara would be high up on that list.

"It would be very dangerous," you say. "I mean, I would have died had you not been here. Two of us, tiny, could be overwhelmed and no-one would know!"

"Well, uh, you could always swap with me! I can go exploring, while you go big and look out for me!" A shy smile spreads across her face. "You could pay me back for that expert doctorin' I did."

It might be time to go back to normal, if even for a little while. But while taking the time to recover and heal at standard size, would it be right to throw an inexperienced person into danger in your place? Maybe you should just grow back, spend a little time with this woman before decding what course to take.

Or is your proprietary technology more important to you? If you refused Tara's request, asked her to put your home back, she'd comply. She respects you.

Or so she says: having so much power over you, how do you know she'll just accept your refusal? Even though her looming, hopeful face is utterly adorable, the brain behind that face controls a monster as big as a skyscraper...
11213111141112111111123.title: Like An Elephant, A Giantess Never Forgets

choices: Extend an olive branch and ask her for help
Try to sneak past the woman
Forget it. Another time
112131111411121112.content:
The next morning you wake up early as always, slipping into your usual routine of push-ups, sit-ups, shower then clothes. Doing your best to keep the memory and yearning to encounter that woman again far from your mind. Most of you hoped that when you left your shelter this morning, you would find that spot she set up in empty... her packed up and gone for good, off to enjoy life somewhere else. Considering it was currently 6:00 AM, you found it likely that unless she was an early bird like yourself, she would probably still be asleep. Not that it mattered so long as she keeps out of your way. After all, today was the day you had to go out and refill your food stock.

First, you needed to check if she was in fact still there or not. You walk over to your phone to pull up the camera feed, and weren't surprised at all to find that she hadn't left. What did surprise you, was what she was doing out on a mat she laid in front of her tent. Her body moved calm and tranquil like the ocean as she executed pose after pose in her yoga routine. She looked incredible. Even more powerful than the first time you laid eyes on her. The black leggings and sports bra outfit showed you just how capable her body really was, as she proceeded into an upward dog pose, exposing her toned, washboard abs to you. This made you feel uneasy... like you were invading privacy by standing here staring at her in this camera feed... but then you thought, she knew you were somewhere out here. Was this part of a plan to lure you out or something? You didn't think she got a good enough look to recognize you were even human,... but now who knows. It was very possible you were just paranoid, and this display was no display at all, just part of her morning routine much like your own workout. As tempted as you were to just sit here and watch, you had things to do.

So after slipping into your suit, and dragging your makeshift sled behind you, you head up to the surface and exit the protective shell of your hideout. The woman was still busy with her stretches so you take advantage and make your rounds at all the usual supply spots for your food. You follow the routes you had to help you navigate the areas in the grove where food was available and activity from predators was minimal. Along the trip, you pick and store the usual edible herbs, but the real prize was the crabapple tree, which unfortunately was in the immediate area of the spot where the woman had set up camp. The safe route you had runs right through her camp, effectively blocking it from you lest she discover you again. At this point, you had no idea if she would be leaving soon, so if you really needed to get that goldmine, you might need to take some risks.
