112131111411121112.title: A New Morning

choices: Tara rolls out her sleeping bag
Tara stops for a snack
Tara needs her phone to call someone about the small man she saw
Tara needs her camera for some pictures
Tara needs a piece of food to lure out the small man she saw
1121311114111212.content:
The sky is replaced by the sole of the woman's hiking boot, and for a moment you fear your imminent end. Yet common sense prevails even through this full panic, and you watch in awe as the foot soars overhead, the heel pressing down into the earth well beyond your grassy shelter. The first shockwave is followed swiftly by a greater blast as the rest of the shoe lands.

The woman's second foot follows suit even more distantly, and you are looking up at her humungous heels as she faces away from you. The heels, which are the first part to complete a step; while the foot is overhead, you are safe from being stepped on by a walker, and if the heel is about to land on you you won't have time to react. She's clearly decided that you're not in this close cluster of greenery, and has stepped carefully closer to the stream to see if you've gone there.

Her voice echoes down from above, as if any creature would come running when a human monster called! Let her keep searching here, you'll be long gone by the time she gives up! WIth one last look up at the twin towers of her tanned legs, you turn to leave her to it.

Problem, though; were you to head back to your capsule, you'd be crossing open ground, in full view of a being with such an elevated position as her. Should she turn, she'd spot you almost instantly, and the chase would be on again. You don't want this clumsy excuse for a lover of wildlife bothering you on your own turf, so you'd best keep out of her sight until she forgets about you.

But where to go, then? Looking away from the oak tree, your view is dominated by the only slightly shorter mountain, recently erected by your unwelcome guest: her tent. It would be the last place she would look for you, and while there you could see what you could scavenge from within. It's not really theft, you tell yourself: it merely a tax for encroaching upon your lands, or reparations for the damage she has done.

You don't even have to duck under the flaps to enter, and find yourself staring around an enclosure that could contain several small towns stacked atop each other. The woman hasn't set up a sleeping bag yet, so the floor is merely occupied by that backpack of hers. Besides the rolled-up sleeping bag, it must also contain whatever supplies she brought for her stay. Food, drink, construction materials - you should take everything you can, since the presence of this woman will probably scare away the bugs that you would normally prey upon, and who knows how long she'll be here for?

So, up to the towering bag you walk, ready to force your way inside and take whatever you can.

Thudding tremors warn you of the woman's approach - you either underestimated your travel time to the tent, or overestimated how long she'd search for you. Damn, best hope she doesn't interfere too much!
1121311114111212.title: Checking In With The Neighbours

choices: Tara is going into town to meet her friend
Her friend is coming out here to join her
11213111141112123.content:
The flaps to the tent fly open as Tara pushes past them in a rush. Instinctively, you crouch down and duck behind a fold in the bag that provided enough cover as a steep hill would, as she walks across the tent, heading right towards you! Fear jacks up your heart rate as she grows closer and closer to your spot, but you soon realize after taking one look into her eyes, that though she was only a glance from looking directly at you, at this moment in time she was completely unaware you were here. Instead, as she leans over with her arm outstretched, she doesn't reach for you or the bag, but her cellphone which was laying on the ground next to you.

You couldn't help but stare in awe as her arm plunges past your elevated position and rises back up to the usual unimaginable height as she types on the screen and brings the phone up to her ear. It looked like she would be distracted with whoever was on the other line for now, giving you opportunity to go ahead and make your way into the bag. You followed the path of the zipper further up to the bag, finding an opening between the two tabs for you to slip inside. You drop down onto the top of a rolled sleeping bag with a soft thud, and use the light that seeped in from outside to your advantage as you searched for something to take back with you. Mostly everything in here was far too large to pick up or even fit into your shelter, but you expected that. You also expected to find what you just laid eyes on, which was a baggie full of trail mix that was sandwiched between the wall of the bag and a book! Perfect! Just as you began to make your way down to it, you heard the voice of the woman greet her friend on the phone, full of excitement.

"Julie? Hey, you're never going to believe this! I'm out in the grove I told you about... the one off Higgins ave... yeah, anyways, I found something... and, its just... look, can we meet? Okay good. How about..."
11213111141112123.title: The Call of the Giantess

choices: Have an adventure
Start walking to your neighbor's yard
Set up various camps or create a portable camp
113.content:
As you take your first few steps into this newly reformed world the fearful reality of not being able to survive suddenly hits you. You comprehend your size to be approximately 1/32 of an inch tall with how much space you have to fit under your family's wooden fence. No human would be able to even see you unless their eyes were at most an inch away from your tiny frame and concentrated on seeing you, much less distinguish you from anything more than a minuscule insect. However, people will not be your primary concern in this unforgiving wilderness. Insects, spiders, and maybe even small mammals or amphibians will be the ones most likely consuming the whole of your attention.

All these these thoughts sink in before finally entering your family's backyard. That's when you realized that staying in one place for too long was way too dangerous for someone of your size. The grass blades alone were the size of buildings. An ant would probably be the size of a house or bigger! You would have to adopt a migrating from place-to-place mindset if you wanted to make it out here with all the other forms of wildlife. As you churn the idea of becoming a full-blown nomad around in your head more and more, the concept of constantly moving from one location to another suddenly seemed less forced. You would still be able to adventure wherever you wanted as long as you kept remembering to gather supplies along the way and if you still end up running into dangerous animals you could always retreat to your presently monolithic family members if they happened to be outside. Other small animals wouldn't dare approach your relatives so keeping close to them while their outside seems like a good idea.

Of course, there is the problem of figuring out where to sleep. You couldn't just lay on the ground out in the open where everything hunted and digging a hole through the dirt wherever you slept would put you at risk to the types of animals that burrow underground which, come to think of it, are a lot. Since you're now traveling the only choices you have are to either build multiple bases out of random junk whenever you feel like settling down and then you'll have multiple places to return to after you make enough or you could create a sort of tent to carry around with you for setting up quick and easy.

Lastly, there is the question of whether or not to stay in your family's backyard or to travel around the cul-de-sac from neighbor to neighbor with a new landscape every couple of days. You have a good relationship with all your neighbors and basically know how they act and react to certain situations. You also know that half keep a wide variety of pets that can range from giant dogs, even from human perspective, to rabbits, to even chicks and small cats. You tend to have a decent connection with most of the animals being an environmental conservationist and all but you're not sure how any of them would react to seeing a shrunken person, if they could even perceive you as a person.

Your body relaxes as the idea of becoming a nomad kind of sounds pretty badass. Doing whatever you want, surviving off of the land, moving wherever you will, taking advantage of the everyday giants surrounding you. It pretty much fits every desire you had walking into this new experience. Now what should you do first?
113.title: Nomadic Lifestyle

choices: Stay in Ashleys yard
Go to the Duquettes
1132.content:
The immediate neighbour to the left of your family's house was a young woman named Ashley, past her was a polynesian family of five by the name of the Duquettes, and beyond that was a house that was split between two young couples no older than 19, one couple occupying the upper floor while the other lives in the fully furnished basement. Every one of them had the same size backyard you did; Ashleys yard being more or less empty aside from a beautiful small vegetable garden that lined her fence, the Duquettes having built a large extension on their patio to accommodate a hot tub and their patio set, then the young people having nothing more than a small fire pit smack dab in the middle of their yard.

You felt confident that navigating these properties would prove beneficial, especially with Ashleys garden providing such a great source of food. However the traffic of wildlife that must frequent that garden may cause some unfriendly competition to occur, but you remembered that the whole point of this shrinking business was to get some excitement in your life anyways so...

The way into the yard was an easy enough journey. The great wall of wooden fence made it easy to know where you were going , and you soon found yourself passing right underneath its gap into the new yet similar landscape of your neighbours lawn.
1132.title: Start walking to your neighbor's yard

choices: Your first encounter with the giants!
Bugs invade your shelter!
You start to gather more supplies, all alone.
114.content:
Looking at the grass around you, you realize that you are probably around a quarter of an inch tall. You are far smaller than you realized after walking underneath the fence and in your parent’s backyard. The entire idea of surviving in this immense jungle seems almost impossible at such a tiny size. Bugs, birds, other animals. . everything makes a challenging foe. Just hiding seems kind of boring too.

You decide to take a different approach.

Cheat.

After walking through the grass for a couple of hours, you made your way over towards the patio area. There, a new jungle appeared for miles and miles. . cement. Making your way over towards the side of the cement, you saw a large circular tubing systems spiraling upward and onto the cement jungle. It was your garden hose.

This would work out nicely.

You could set up a base camp near the side of the house. Your family regularly had picnics and other outdoor cooking events which you could forage food from. You’d have a water supply from the hose system. During the winter when things start to get colder, you could temporarily build a shelter inside using the holes into the house. Then, once things warmed up, you could go back and live outside again.

It would be perfect.

The main problem with your original plan was just how much scavenging, fighting, and fleeing you’d have to do. With this, you could enjoy everything at your small size, while being regularly comfortable. The only downside would be with the shrink gun so far away, it would be hard to retrieve the gun. Realistically too. . . somebody would find the gun. Then, it might be a cause for investigation.

Still, for now, everything was okay.

After another hour, you finally made your way up and onto the patio. Utilizing some grass and shredding some of it to use as rope, you set up a very tiny base camp. By now, it was late, so you sat down and relaxed under the stars. By next morning, you were able to get up somewhat refreshed and ready for whatever your new life would throw at you.
114.title: Living on the Patio

choices: Risk it all, and approach the pile.
Don't take any chances and stay in your shelter by the wall.
Another giant comes out to help her clean.
1141.content:
WHAM!!

You awoke, shocked at the loud shockwave that shook the ground so hard. What was tha-

WHAAM!!!

Your body shook and your flimsy shelter fell apart as another loud booming stomp shook your entire location. Getting up, you pushed aside the simple grass structure and looked outwardly to investigate the sound. Your eyes grew wide when you saw who it was!!

WHHAAAAM!!!

Miles and miles away, you spotted a mighty titaness taking a few foot steps in the distance. Looking up and stretching miles and miles high was a blonde giantess, wearing a polka dot bikini and holding a broom. A middle aged woman who was in her early 40’s looked across the cement jungle, your new home. Putting her enormous arms to her side, the goddess from another world brushed her well toned body a bit, due to the dust from the broom that had swept onto her. It was no wonder a lot of bugs didn't make their nests by here, your mother was absolutely horrifying!! Even from afar, you realized that the simplest gestures that she made could cause so much devastation.

“WELL, I GUESS THIS PATIO ISN’T GOING TO CLEAN ITSELF!!” The booming giantess spouted out loud to herself, as she set the broom down on the ground.

Again, the impact of the broom hitting the ground was tremendous, far more impactful than you would have thought possible. It was strange though, because you could see a different set of. . dust or something moving around as she moved her bare feet through the dirt of the patio. Could that be. . dust particles?

It was like . . being so small made you a bit sensitive to the movements of things around you. Whether it be motion or smaller particles. Interesting.

Your supplies were pushed around to and fro, as the impossibly high being started to move things around with the broom. Watching from the comfort of your partially destroyed shelter, you reached into your backpack and pulled out a high quality binoculars. Putting them on, you look a bit more closely at what was happening. The dust particles that you could see from earlier were flying upwards and attaching onto the giant bare foot of your mother as she attempted to get things to look orderly. It was incredible the amount of detail you were able to see being so shockingly tiny!!

Remarkable!

“EEEP!!!” The immense goddess yelped out loud. You were not expecting such an outburst, so you felt yourself getting startled, as if she had somehow noticed you.

Instead, she noticed something else. An ant.

Your mother was really weird when it came to insects. If she didn't notice them, she was fine. . but even the smallest ones that got close to her. . she would freak out. This time was no exception as she quickly lifted up her enormous feet, high into the air, her toned muscular legs reaching up into the sky, hugging her skin tight shorts high up in the air. It was if the ant looked right up at your mother as a quicker than light motion brought your mother’s giant foot right on top of that ant, totally obliterating it’s body!!!

Your mouth was agape as you saw small tiny particles of the ant still stuck to her feet as she continued sweeping.

Focusing on the cleaning, your mother had begun to form a pile. She pushed the trash in a big pile over to the right. . dangerously close to where your base of operations was situated in. Luckily, even though she was getting a bit closer to you, unless she started to sweep out the corners, you were safe where you were at. Knowing your parents well, you knew that they very seldomly cleaned the corners of the patio. This was partially due to laziness, but also they didn't think they ever needed to clean there.

Lucky for you.

Your mother was taking awhile though, she seemed to be cleaning much more methodically for some reason. It was unusual. Sure, your family would occasionally have picnics, but she never really cleaned like this before.

Pulling out your binoculars again, you watched her more closely. A fly landed on your mom’s large left breast, which your mother took notice. Moving very quickly, she swatted at it with her hand, smashing the insect on her tit, its body exploding all over her body. With a small grin on her face, your mother went back to looking to where she would clean, ignoring the dead body now paraded on her breast. You watched from below in awe of her pure power!

Snapping your head back into reality, you realized you needed to focus on survival.

An idea popped into your head. That pile wasn't too far off from where you were stationed at. You had your backpack with some emergency supplies. . but what then? They would run out so soon. Yet, here right at your doorstep, your mother had brought you a bounty of food, sticks, and other goods of use. Some wood pieces, some metal, even some screws. The amount of salvage and goods you could gather from the pile was tremendous.

Yet the risk was high too. If your giantess mother started to sweep the items in the trash. . you could go out with it. Also, with your mother’s general hatred of bugs. . if she noticed you in the midst. . she’d make quick work of you underneath her enormous bare feet!!
1141.title: Cleaning out your home!

choices: Return to the pile to get even more!!
Start rebuilding your base camp for now.
Put a good deal of distance between yourself and the giants
11411.content:
You could feel your heart beating through your chest. Your mind was reeling on whether to play it safe, or take this risk. Peering through your binoculars over at the pile, you look through the goods there.

Screws, wood chips, some food, there was even some metallic tops for screws that you could use as containers for yourself. So many rations. . it was. . so tempting.

Yet, isn't this what it was all about. Braving the elements and doing things that were a little bit risky? Wasn't that the point of all of this?
Steeling your courage, you looked at the pile, then back at the god like amazon still sweeping around the corner. Wiping your forehead of sweat, you started emptied your backpack in your still partially destroyed base camp. You needed it to be as empty as possible so you could secure as many supplies as you could.

Making your way towards the pile, you felt really really scared. God, this was so risky. You could feel your skin feeling tingly and a little weak as you felt the repeated pounding from both the giant broom and your mountainous mother's feet ravishing the land. After a few minutes, you made it to the pile, as your mother continued to add to it, still you being unseen.

Looking through the piles, you began to quickly prioritize the order of importance based on the items that were readily available. Food was something that wasn't too hard to gain in this area, because of all the scraps around here. Quickly, you first placed some of the metal tops for the screws in your bag. They were a little heavy, but being able to store your goods is something that is critical to the success of your trip. Next, you gathered a bunch of wooden splints. Crafting these into building materials, as well as possible weapons, was the next step. While you did have a machete that you shrank yourself with, it wasn't going to last too long. . so you would need a replacement.

SLAM!!

You practically had a heart attack as the entire pile shifted and shook as your mother's giant foot smashed hard into the ground again.

'DAMN!! YOU BUGS NEED TO GET OFF OF MY PATIO!! IF IT WASN'T SO UNHEALTHY FOR ME TOO. . I'D FUMIGATE THIS ENTIRE AREA AGAIN!!'

You realized that there really wasn't that many bugs that you had seen while going around this area. Your mother must have really fumigated this place hard before you came in. You'd need to create some kind of escape if she ever got the idea to do that again. Maybe, create a tunnel inside the house to hang there til all that poison died down here.

Your thoughts back to survival, you started again at the pile.

The final set of items you were able to stuff in your bag, was some small pieces of twine. These were great, because you could deconstruct them and use them for a variety of goods that could be extremely useful to you. After the final thing was pushed into your bag, you grabbed a broken in half coffee stirrer in your hands and made your way back to base camp, your heart still beating so fast with the adrenaline rushing through you.

After about half an hour of traveling, you finally made it back, a little sweaty, tired, but feeling good. It had taken a lot longer getting back than it had to come over here, due to the weight of all these items. If you were able too. . you might want to pick up some of those smaller screw pieces that you saw back in the pile, to try and make some kind of wheelbarrow. That would definitely make supply gathering a bit less. . tiresome.

You unload the supplies in the nook in the wall besides your broken down base camp. Once you rebuilt, this would do very nicely. Grabbing your binoculars, you check back on how your giantess mother was doing.

At this point, she had finished cleaning out two entire sides of the patio and it looked absolutely spotless!! You could eat off of the floor, without fear. Again, this was a bit strange. Why was she going to all of this trouble to make the patio so clean? Your parents never went this in depth.

WHAM!!

Your thoughts were disrupted when your mother again slammed onto the ground hard, stomping out some unfortunate creature with her giant bare feet.

Shaking, you look over to try and see the damage she had done. It was too far away as she had started to move in that different direction.

Looking over back at the pile, you saw that at this point, she had merged her two big piles to make an even bigger one!! Even more supplies and goods were at stake, although you knew it would only be a matter of time before your mother started to focus on your area next. If you were still hanging around there. . it would be very unsafe.

Rubbing your chin, you ponder on what your next move will be.
11411.title: Piling up on supplies

choices: Try and get the battery.
Forget it, and return to base camp.
Head towards your mother.
114111.content:
You had learned a lot from your last trip over at the pile. If you could just grab the things you need and not pile yourself down as much, you probably could get back to your base camp before your mother noticed you again. All the supplies you were gathering would have taken you so much longer without your giant mother helping you. It was very useful afterall.

Taking a deep breath, you already know what you are going to do. Argh. . you feel like taking such big risks this early isn't the smartest move. Yet. . you know how good it will feel being rewarded with such a well-established base camp. Plus, with your mom cleaning so thoroughly, you'll need to be loaded up with food before your family comes out and has a picnic or something. It would be a lot harder foraging for food later.

Rushing over again, with an empty backpack and your bare hands, you stare up at the monolithic mother that hovers over in the distance. She is still pretty scary due to her size, but she seems less intimidating now for some reason. Maybe you are getting used to seeing her, and since she is familiar with you, you feel a bit safer around her.

Still, you had to be cautious and not let that mindset go to your head. Even unintentionally, your family posed a great threat to you and your base camp.

You couldn't let them become aware of your location at all.

Finally reaching the pile, you looked through it now that it had grown larger in size. There was some really good stuff here, but for now. . this would probably be your last trip to the pile. Gathering necessities needed to take priority over grabbing things just for other practical use. The first thing that you placed in your bag was a couple of small circular screw holders. These could be used as rudimentary wheels and you could make a wheelbarrow, a cart, or whatever you needed to help you out.

'YEAH YEAH YEAH!! YEAH!! OH YEAH!!!' boomed high above, but not in your mother's voice.

It was the song Candy by Mandy Moore. That was her ring tone.

You shook your head as your mother could be so childish having a teen pop song as her ring tone. She must have wanted to feel younger than she actually was.

'HELLO?' your mother boomed, now pacing back and forth. You needed to be careful here, as if she noticed you now being distracted by the phone. . you'd be finished!!

'OH HI HONEY!! YES, EVERYTHING IS GOING WELL!! THE PATIO IS LOOKING MUCH NICER NOW!! EVERYTHING WILL BE READY FOR OUR DINNER OUTSIDE, TONIGHT!!'

Your ears perked up. That was why she was cleaning so thorough. . they would be eating outdoors tonight. The question for you though . . was how? A table dinner on the patio, BBQ, Smore's? There was so many different options, but she didn't seem to be saying anything else. Regardless, you might have to 'crash' this party to try and gather some additional supplies. For now though, you tried to refocus your efforts on the pile again.

Next, you saw a bunch of beef jerky scraps that someone probably was eating out here, but the tiny specks of it were now scattered everywhere. These would be a good food source due to their longevity and their ease of storage. Finally, you grabbed some more twine. Rope would be crucial for tying and otherwise, so getting more of that would be very helpful. As you started to make your way back. . your eyes grew large when you saw a small triple A battery!! It was so big compared to you but. . if you could figure a way to bring this back to base camp. . you might be able to use its power to do some rudimentary things.

'NO DEAR, WE DON'T WANT TOO MUCH OF THAT!! WE NEED TO WATCH YOUR BLOOD PRESSURE!!' Your mother said in a somewhat naggy voice.

Your dad probably wanted to eat something unhealthy but was shot down. Poor Dad.

Looking back at the battery, you started to think of some other ways you could put this to use. A small heater, stove equipment, whatever you could think of you might be able to do . . if you could get this big thing back. The question is. . how would you do it? It sure would be risky getting this big thing back to, considering how vigilant your mother has been towards insects. Still, it might be worth it. Also, now that your mother was on the phone, you might be able to get it away before she even notices.
114111.title: Need before Greed

choices: You wake up a few hours later, ready to work on your base camp
You are awoken early as your mother has begun cleaning your area!
You are torn awake by someone picking up the battery
1141111.content:
At first, you didn't think it would be a very good idea to try and get that battery. On the one hand, it was in a pretty good location. Pushed off towards the edge of the pile, you got the feeling that the dirt and grime around it didn't have a lot of traction. Plus, the fact that the battery could roll made things simpler too. The main problem would be how to keep it going forward.

'ALL RIGHT, HONEY!! I'll SEE YOU TONIGHT!! BYE BYE!!' The mighty giantess stated, hanging up the phone.

It seemed that her conversation had now ended. Taking an action now might bring the ever watchful eye of the giantess onto you. Still, you weren't entirely sure if you were going to go this route.

Looking back at the pile, you saw a plastic straw wrapped in paper. The straw was positioned semi facing up, but in a way where you could position and push it forward. That was it!! You'd use the straw to push the battery out. Then, you'd use its forward moving momentum to keep pushing it forward, using one of those mini straws from a coffee cup. It would be a ton of work, but with something like this. . you'd be in a good position.

As you climbed up and onto the grime, part of you contemplated this action. It was so so risky. . you really needed to play it safer than you had been doing. Yet, you wouldn't let fear keep you down. Using some screws as a levee. . you pushed the straw with the entire weight of your body!!

Nothing. . .it barely moved forward towards the battery.

Scratching your head, you looked for something else that could knock it forward.

BOOM!!!

BOOOM!!!

BOOOM!!!!

The ground had been basically shaking the entire time, but now it was moving at a much quicker pace. Moving your eyes away from the pile, your face careened upward. . the giantess was pushing another completed section towards yours!!

You screamed as the broom thrust tons and tons of dirt, papers, food, and other shreds of garbage right at you. Swimming upwardly, you popped yourself out of the pool of dirt and managed to climb out of the growing pile. Once topside, you watched as the dirt shuffled the rest of the trash forward. . and into the screws you were using as a levee!! They mashed the straw super hard and thrust it forward.

Your eyes grew wide as you knew what would happen next!!

The battery got hit. . and it started rolling towards your base camp.

Quickly taking action, you barrel rolled out of the pile and picked up the mini straw like a spear.

Rushing after the slow moving battery, you hit it with all of your force and watched it continue to move forward. It was working!!

Soon you'd have the power of electricity. . once you figured out some way to use it, that is. The act of moving the battery was very tiresome. You had to wait until the battery was a bit ahead of you, but still moving then rush at it with all of your might. You could have possibly hit the battery a little weaker. . but you couldn't risk it stopping and staying in place. . or worse rolling backwards towards you!!

As you continued to move the battery in the now open field towards the corner of the wall towards base camp. . you heard a loud shrill, louder than anything you had heard before.

'EEEEEKKK!!!!'

You covered your ears the sound was so massive and all consuming. Stopping for a moment, you turned around and saw your monolith sized mother staring right down at you. In that moment, you both stared at each other, seeing eye to eye. This. . this was it. She had. . had seen you.

'WHAT IS THAT UGLY TINY GREEN BUG!!' Your mother stated, her nose and other facial features curled up in disgust at the hideous creature before her.

Your eyes grew wide as she started to head right towards you!! She had come to crush you!!

Turning back towards the battery, you slammed into it again as hard as you possibly could. You were so close to getting that battery at base camp. . and with the other supplies in your backpack, you'd be set for awhile. You didn't want to lose your supplies. . but you also needed to save your life!!

BOOOOOOMMM!!!!

The most massive soundings force slammed into the ground behind you, causing a shockwave of dirt to push you and the battery forward. Turning over on your back, you faced the giantess as you saw she was about one more step towards reaching you. Looking back at the battery and the ground, you looked for some kind of escape. A hole, a patch of ground, something to protect you from the massive foot stomp that your mother was about to unleash on you.

There was nothing.

With a quick look back, you saw that your mother had arched her giant right foot high into the sky, preparing to push all of her weight onto you. . crushing you entirely!! No, no, no!! The massive shadow of your mother blotted out the sun, creating a dark shadow over everything around you.
Rushing forward, you put yourself besides the battery, slightly underneath it.

BAAAM!!

The massive sole crashed into the ground.

The enormous foot had completely compressed the ground around you, but the little gap that the battery had given you was enough to keep you from totally getting crushed. Opening your eyes, now a little bit more shocked at the realization. . the foot started to make its way up again.

Looking down on her foot, she noticed that she had not gotten the tiny bug on the ground. . instead he was still there by the battery.

'WELL, THAT WAS PRETTY SMART OF YOU, BUG!! LET'S SEE WHAT HAPPENS WHEN I GET RID OF YOUR LITTLE BATTERY!!'

You were far too long off to reach base camp if your mother kicked this battery away without you. You needed to stay with it. Just as the words left her mouth, you immediately reached into your bag and pulled out some of the twine you had grabbed earlier. You threw it like a lasso on the side part of the battery and tied the end around your waist. This was so. .

WHAM!!

Your lasso worked even better than you thought possible. Since the twine wasn't on very tightly, it didn't rotate you back and forth with the battery as it quickly rushed towards the underside of the wall, somewhat close to base camp. The only problem as you began to drift away from the giant that had just tried to kill you was that the rope wouldn't last for too long. You needed to get to base camp soon.

With a careful kick with her toes, your mom kicked the battery to the side, to more easily squish the bug nearby. She saw what looked like. . a web. . attached to the bug as it moved with the battery towards the wall.

'OH NO!!! YOU ARE NOT GOING TO GET AWAY!!!'

The giant bug stomper rushed herself forward raising her giant foot towards the battery as she prepared to stomp it into oblivion. With a careful calculated hit, she slammed her foot down on the battery again. . totally encompassing all view!! Your heart was beating so fast as the skin and weight of your mother collapsed on the battery a second time.

This time, she had stomped even harder as the skin of her foot rubbed against your minuscule body as you started to whimper a little, fear overtaking your senses. Luckily, the rope didn't break.

As your mother again lifted her foot up to check again if she had crushed you, the battery started to move up with her foot. Shaking it a little to get it off, she flung you forwards and at the wall.

WHOOSH!!

You felt super dizzy as the rope had now gotten stuck pretty tight as you spun in circles, dozens and dozens of times before. .

SLAM!!

The battery fell underneath the wall, safely out of sight of your giantess tormentor. You detached yourself from the rope with your machete and fell to the ground, throwing up all over the place from the dizziness. You were so tired. . but you had . . done it.

As you drifted off into unconsciousness, your mother started to curse and swear.

'DAMN IT!! I WAS SO CLOSE!! FUCKING GREEN BUG!! I'LL FIND YOU AND STOMP YOU INTO NOTHING!!'

As the giant woman started to hyperventilate a little, she realized that if a passing neighbor or mailman were to walk by, they would probably think she was crazy. Regaining her calmness, she started back at cleaning again. . she wouldn't forget that weird green bug, though.
1141111.title: Giantess Encounter

choices: The back door opens, the gods have returned!!
You decide to try and collect some water.
A troop of insects marches by your camp
11411111.content:
'Ugh. . '

Moaning, you rub your head, it. . .like most of the rest of your body, was very sore.

You had gotten very greedy, but shockingly enough. . you were still okay. Still, taking risks like that would eventually lead to you dying. . so you needed to start focusing on the surviving part of your trip. There was still a lot of things you had not yet done that still needed work. Getting up, you felt very funny. Looking at the ground, you see stains from when you threw up. Your body must have been a bit dehydrated.

Peering at the giant battery besides you, you realized that it had not crashed exactly where your base camp was. . instead it was a little ways closer towards the door to the house. From your estimates, it was a good couple 'blocks' from your current base camp. Not too far, but not exactly a short walk either. Scratching your chin, you realized that it would be impossible at this point to bring the battery exactly at your base camp but. . an idea struck you.

This could be your new base camp.

Your old one was already destroyed from all the stomping and this spot seemed just as well. Sure, it was a little further from where the water was, but it was also more wedged into the wall. This would make for an ample escape from predators, such as your giant family or other insects or birds. As you walked around the battery, you saw that the 'kick' from your mother had made a small hole. Walking into it, you couldn't see much of anything . . it was too dark. Once you got your supplies from base camp and moved them over. . you'd figure it all out.

A few hours passed as you went back and forth, moving your supplies to your new base camp. Having drank a lot of your current water supply, you realized that you would eventually need to gather more. You estimated that you would probably run out of water tomorrow, and that was by just rationing it too. You were drinking far less than you should be. More importantly, you needed to establish your current base and make it secure. There were just far too many predators that could make a short meal out of you. Being prepared and safe was your number 1 priority. You would have to worry about the water situation later.

The first thing you set up was an adequate entrance to your base. Using the battery like a wall and also a room, you moved some of the broken wood from the crash to erect a barrier for things entering, but leaving you a 'door' to enter into too. That door was basically a simple pulley system where you could pull on a rope outside which would open a panel for you to step into. It was simple, but effective. The second fortification you did was seal up that back part of the wall. You didn't want any creepy crawlers to get a jump on you while you were resting or away. Finally, using one of the containers, you created a simple easy torch. It would conduct heat inside its metal furnace, but with a simple top that you could place on it. . put it out just as easy. It was a bit big though, so while it lit up your base, it wouldn't be much use outside.

Looking at all the stuff surrounding your base, you smiled, happy at what you had built. You decided to give your new base camp a name, something other
than base camp. If this was to be your new home, you wanted to be able to refer to it properly. You needed it, in order to keep your humanity.
After setting up your leafy bed, some other simple designs, you made a crude sign with your new base camp name: Dion.

Dion was a Greek village which sat at the bottom of Mount Olympus. From here, the mortals could look up high at their gods towering above them. You found it only fitting considering the giants who were now your gods, too.

After making a wheelbarrow, some grappling hooks, some simple wooden spears, and storing the food well so no other insect could make its way inside, you decided to plan your next move. Looking out onto the patio, you saw the sun was still present, but in a few hours it would be getting dark. You needed to think of your next plan.
11411111.title: Building a Better Base Camp

choices: You decide to forage from them again.
You decide to play it safe and wait at camp.
You decide to explore the garden.
114111111.content:
"YEAH, BUT YOU KNOW HOW MUCH I HATE BUGS!!"

The sound of your mother's booming voice stirred you from your thoughts. Grabbing your binoculars, you peered towards the portal of the gods. Walking outside backwards was your giant mother. Now, she was wearing a bit more clothing, wearing a nice red top that showed a little bit of her cleavage and some formal esque black shorts.

CLAAACK!!!

CLAAAACKK!!!

She backed up again, wearing a pair of black high heeled shoes. In her hands, was part of the table. You grimaced as you realized what was happening. The family was. . was going to be eating outside!!

"YOU KNOW HOW MUCH I LOVE HAVING THESE FAMILY GET TOGETHER'S!! BESIDES, YOU CLEANED UP THE PATIO YOURSELF!! YOU KNOW THAT THERE ISN'T ANY BUGS NEARBY!!!" Boomed a powerful masculine voice. As the rest of the table came into focus, you saw your father holding it on the other side. Together, he and your mother placed the table down.

WHAAAM!!!

You realized that your mother was closest to you right now, her big black high heeled shoes clacking on the hard cement floor. Looking up at her, you could see that she was wearing a set of red panties beneath her skirt too, actually matching her shirt. You shook your head, you shouldn't be looking their anyway.

"YEAH, BUT OUTSIDE. . EVEN IF YOU CLEAN EVERY BUG. . THERE IS ALWAYS A HUNDRED MORE WAITING!!" You heard your mother say with an irritated shrill.

"I EVEN HAD THIS UGLY GREEN BUG GET AWAY FROM ME EARLIER TODAY WHEN I WAS CLEANING!! HE WAS SO GROSS!!"

Looking down at your camo colored 'green' clothes, you realized that eventually you were going to need to switch to something else. You watched your father roll his eyes as he set out two other chairs on both sides of the table.

"OH BABY!! YOU'LL BE OKAY!! IF I SEE ANY BUGS. . I'LL STOMP THEM OUT OF EXISTENCE!!"

Your mother let out a coo when she heard how confident your dad was about killing bugs.

"O-OKAY DEAR!! THANK YOU!!" She said with a smile, happy that her man would have her back.

From the den of the gods, you heard another voice, a bit low but still feminine.

"IS MOM STILL MOANING ABOUT BUGS?!?"

You recognized that voice anywhere. It was your sister, Jessica. A few seconds later, you watched your titanic sized 17 year old sister storm out of the house. Wearing a black tank top revealing a little cleavage from her small slender frame, she wiped her hands on her shorts and long pantyhose. You rolled your eyes. Jessica was still going through a bitter phase, embracing gothic culture. Twirling her short dark hair, she muttered some obscenities under her breath. You watched as she stomped her giant military style boots on the ground as she brought some food over on the table, letting out an annoyed sigh as she did this.

"DAD, DO I HAVE TO EAT OUTSIDE?!? I HAVE OTHER THINGS I NEED TO DO TOO!!!" Jess moaned, making angry faces at everything around her.

Your father shook his head.

"NOW NOW, YOU KNOW I WANT EVERYONE PRESENT HERE!! WE HAVE A LOT OF THINGS TO TALK ABOUT, AFTERALL!!"

"HEY EVERYONE!!!" The high pitched voice tore through the air. It was your older sister, Joy.

Joy had just gotten back from an incredible backpacking journey with some friends of hers. Wearing a trendy brown sweater, Joy looked absolutely gorgeous, her blonde hair done up very fashionably. Pulling her glasses off of her face, she placed them down in between her little cleavage. Compared to your mother or Jess, Joy had pretty small breasts. . but she dressed them up well. She was basically a cross between a hipster and a hippie. . respecting nature while looking good doing it. Putting her hands on her tight blue jeans, she struck a pose as she let out one of her classic charismatic smiles. You hated to admit it, but she looked pretty amazing. . she just had so much confidence. Joy stretched her arms out towards her family. Your mom and dad rushed over to hug her, excitedly asking her how things have been.

"UGH. . BIG HEAD IS BACK!!" Jess muttered by your base, a not so affectionate nickname that she had been calling her behind her back.

With the entire family together (unbeknownst to them, including you), the family finished putting the last few items for their big dinner outside. They were all getting ready to eat their food. You watched as they took their seats. Your father sat farthest away from you, nearby the door. To the left of him, sat Joy, who put her big bag of stuff beside her down, some of it dripping over. She was relatively close to you, and would be easiest to get to, if you decided to forage from that bag.

Your mother, with her big high inch heels, sat on the other end of the table. Technically she was the closest member of your family, and although you didn't see any reason to try and forage by her, you could go over towards Jess who was on the other side of Joy. Jess was a notorious bad eater, you knew that she would drop a lot of food to you, even if she didn't mean too. On the other hand, this was kind of risky. You had already foraged multiple times today, maybe you should just stay at base camp, Dion. Rest it out and just kind of listen to your family instead. You thought it over as the family started to grab items of food from the table.

1141111111.content:
You have to go for it!

All these encounters happening in one day have been tremendous for your stockpiles and you realize too that on other days, you will find little if anything at all. So, getting as much non perishable goods stockpiled now is absolutely critical!! Grabbing your clothes which you had taken off to take a quick rest in your makeshift bed, you grab your wheelbarrow and put on your backpack. Filling the barrow with your grappling hooks, you are ready to go.

Opening your front door, you look out and onto the terrain in front of you. These massive gods just casually sitting there is quite the sight to behold. You feel yourself shudder a little, the level of intimidation about them fills you up. Putting your palms together, you shake off any jitters and prepare to get this done.

"THEN MARK MADE ME A PRETTY FLOWER THAT I HUNG UP ON MY DOOR!! HE IS SUUUCH A DREAM!!" You overheard Joy telling some story to your family. She always was telling them weird stories about her love life. Although, they usually ended up badly. As you exited, you know had to decide which family member to go towards. Before you made any decision, you would need to get past your mother's high heels undetected. Otherwise, this gathering mission would have to be aborted.

"UGH, IF HE WAS SUCH A DREAM, WHY DID YOU BREAK UP WITH HIM?!" Jess asks realizing that Joy could go on and on.

Joy looks at her dark clothed sister and shakes her finger at her.

"HEY!! HE CAN BE A DREAM BUT. . WELL. . JUST NOT MY DREAM!! WE HAD. . SOME GOOD TIMES THOUGH!!" Joy said a little bit sad. She started to hug herself.

"I. . I MISS HIM!!"

You saw your dad put her hand towards Joy, in an attempt to comfort her.

"I'M SORRY, HON!" He started, "BUT. . WHAT ABOUT THIS LUKE GUY YOU WERE TELLING ME ABOUT!!"

Joy's facial expression immediately changed.

"OH LUKE!! HE IS SO CALM AND QUIET!! HE DOESN'T ALWAYS EXPRESS HIMSELF BUT I KNOW. . DEEP INSIDE HE HAS A LOVING SOUL!!"

Jess rolled her eyes and let out a sigh. You were ready to join her. You started to shut out their conversation as you were getting close to your mother's heels. Looking up at her, you saw that she was looking at three general areas. Joy and her story, her food occasionally to take a bit, and down on the ground. . to make sure that no bugs were coming at her. You realized that this was going to be a little trickier than you initially thought. You could go around her, but by the time you gathered the resources and got back, the dinner would be over. If your parents started to pack up, your mom would notice you for sure. She was a crack eye for any 'bug' intruder.

You watched as she ate. Take a bite, look at Joy, watch the ground. Take a bite, look at Joy, watch the ground. About 20 seconds of away time from the ground. That did not give you a lot of time.

Suddenly, something different happened.

"WELL, WHY DID YOU LET GEORGE SAY THOSE THINGS TO YOU?!"

George? Well, Joy really did love those boyfriend stories. Though now. . she was super focused on Joy.

Now was the time!!

Rushing with your wheelbarrow, your goal was right past her area of the table and underneath it. From there, you could determine whether you would go for Jess or Joy. You looked to the left as you saw your mother's skyscraper sized heel lifted high into the air. It was absolutely enormous.

Suddenly, her heel lifted upwards, just casually moving as your mom was a bit relaxed. She hovered the enormous heel. . right over your head!!

Screaming, you made a mad rush to the side right before it came crashing down.

WHAAAM!!!

The shockwave pushed you to the side. She was. . .starting to look down. Thinking fast, you grabbed the wheelbarrow and dived underneath it. To her eyes, it looked like a missed speck of dirt on the ground. She stared at it for a moment before you heard her taking another bite. Moving the wheelbarrow upwards, you pushed it into the right place as you dashed away and under the table. What a close encounter. Shaking a bit, you looked around at what to do next. Only death awaited you if you stood by your mother and she would not drop any food, she was a very careful eater.

On the one hand, you could forage Joy's backpack and find some interesting things in there. She always carried all sorts of nutrients and other goods with her at all times and with her bag already leaning downward, it would be easy to get over there. On the other hand, Jess' area was already plastered with some spaghetti and other types of food. A little bit of water as well which you could fill in your container there as well. You needed to come up with a decision, or lose out on this opportunity!!

Being only 1/16 of an inch tall, you lost your confidence in surviving for long in the elements. To be honest, you did not want to shrink this tiny so your plan was already ruined there. The glass door is closed but you are so tiny that you fit through a small crack and you are now in the kitchen of your house.

The familiar smell of your house fills your nose, bring back memories. The old, hardwood floor of the house extends for miles to form a vast, brown plain. 12.content:
After careful consideration, you've decided to move in with the neighbors. Not that you've asked them, but given that you're planning to live in their house at 1/8th of an inch tall, you doubt they'll notice you.

The Andersons are a pretty nice family, and you have to admit, the family itself will provide nice scenery -- Dan and Rachel are both 39, and both could pass for younger; their oldest daughter, Taylor, is a high school senior who just turned 18 a few weeks ago, and you're glad of that, because you finally don't have to feel awful about checking her out. The younger kids aren't too young, either -- Abby is 15, and the youngest brother, Ethan, is 12. This is good, because you're going to spend a lot of time on the floor; you didn't want to be found by a toddler.

The best thing about the Andersons, though, is that Abby is highly allergic to pet fur, which means no dogs, no cats, not even a hamster.

You grab your backpack, with a sleeping bag, a knife, a few days' worth of food and water, and a couple changes of clothes, and head out your door, to the house right beside you.

It's noon, and that's not accidental; the kids are all at school, and Rachel and Dan are at work. Checking both ways to see if anyone's looking, you walk up to the garage door and punch in their security code. (Took a few days of observation to figure it out, but it's worth it.) You let yourself in, and close the garage door right away, before entering the house.

It's a pretty standard three-level house; you haven't been in it before, but you have a friend who lives in one with the same plan. You enter through the mud room into the kitchen, and begin to scout quickly.

You have some time, but still, you don't want to stay big for too long. What if someone comes home early? No, you've given this some thought, and you head straight for the place you plan to shrink....
12.title: A New Roommate

choices: Rachel, the mom
Taylor, the teen
Abby, the middle child
Dan, the father
Ethan, the youngest child
121.content:
You aren't stupid. Whatever fun might be had hanging out with the parents or Taylor, you need to think logically. The kitchen is the epicenter of family activity -- and that means food and water in abundance.

You look along the baseboard, happy to see a few crumbs already dot it. You kneel down, and consider carefully; after a bit, you decide on the space between the refrigerator and the counter. There's enough dust there to make you think it's rarely cleaned; that's exactly what you want.

You push the device deep into the space where you'll be; it's designed for you to be able to activate it if you need to, just in case you decide this is a horrible idea. Taking a deep breath, you push the button, and stand back, and wait just a second....

It takes a few minutes to regain your bearings. Touch, taste, and smell are immediately online, but your hearing comes in only after a few moments, and it takes a good two or three minutes for your vision to clear. When it does, your jaw drops.

You thought you were prepared for the world at this size, but it's startling now that you see it. The counters loom more than a quarter-mile above you, and the refrigerator dwarfs that. You swallow hard, as you realize how enormous the Andersons will be.

Still, you don't have time to panic. You need to get settled in and prepared. You walk into the enormous canyon that separates refrigerator from cupboard, and build your camp.

More than once, you freeze instinctively, as a loud noise makes you think something's approaching. But each time, you relax. You even find that the condenser of the refrigerator, only about a ten minutes' walk from camp, is dripping just a tiny bit of water -- which for you is about a gallon a minute.

Yes, as you sit down, back against the counter, you're starting to feel okay.

That's when you hear it.

Far distant, you hear a great groaning creak, followed by a series of thuds. Irregular -- fast, then slow, then steady, then stopping altogether, then picking up again. Each one shakes you, just a tiny bit -- a small earthquake that builds slowly as the thuds approach.

You stand up, as the quakes get louder and louder. Then, suddenly you see it -- a flash of motion as the behemoth crosses in front of the refrigerator. You crane your neck up, but can only see as high as the knee of the person. still, you quickly realize it's....

The shoe was positioned stationary in front of the fridge along with its twin on the opposite side from it. You deduced that from the hip, young style, the ankle socks and the smooth skin belonging to the legs that rose from them like redwoods, this had to be Taylor standing before you.

12122.content:
It seemed Taylor had brought some of her friends home for lunch hour at school; friends who were named Laura and Sophia which was made clear through Taylor's call to them, since two other pairs of giant feet had stomped their way into your sight, though you didn't know who was who. They girls loitered in the kitchen as they talked about the daily rumors and what Taylor could make them for lunch which attracted your interest since that meant Taylor would be bringing food out of their cupboard and refrigerator vaults which would be extremely difficult for a person of your stature to infiltrate.

But how could you pull it off before you were even familiar with how to traverse this massive, unfamiliar territory properly? There was a lot that could go wrong if you tried to get up to the counter in a hurry and steal some food as they prepared it without having any predetermined escape plan. A hell of a lot. So for the time being perhaps it was better to just stay down here and familiarize yourself with every nook and cranny of this place.

That was the idea you had decided to stick with... until you heard a soft thump on the floor towards the giants feet. Your eyes flick to the object and find a small crumb of bread resting beside the barefoot of one of Taylor's friends; the foot was light dark, as if the girl had a Polynesian family background. You walk closer until the cupboard no longer obstructs your view of the three girls and see that she had long, black wavy hair that flowed down to her chest that was clothed in a burgundy t-shirt, and below, black distressed jeans.

There was another girl standing adjacent to her, a golden blonde haired girl who wore a black v-neck sweater, blue capri jeans and black ankle socks. At one point she looked down to open a drawer and pull a butter knife from the other cutlery, revealing to you that she wore a gold necklace and had bright brown eyes that shined like an ocean.

Needless to say, Taylor had some gorgeous friends... but awing at giant girls wasn't the priority right now. You needed to decide what to do next.

121221.content:
A disturbance in the pooled refrigerator liquid sends needles up your spine once you realized that it sounded like movement behind you! You turn towards the sound and the sight nearly induced a heart attack, for what was in front of you now was a great, hulking beast of a reptile stalking towards you!

It was a gecko, a leopard gecko... not that the distinction made a difference; a gecko is a gecko and from what you knew, they had quite the appetite for bugs, which right now you certainly fit the bill for. But why the hell was this thing here?! They weren't native to any region around here! This had to be a pet of some kind, most likely Abby's. How could you have missed this when you were scoping the place out? You really screwed up and now you might pay the price as lizard chow!

The mammoth sized monster was as still as you as it checked you out. Its tongue darting in and out as it tasted the flavor of the air around you, most likely just curious as to whether to eat this strange new creature it chanced upon. Obviously, getting into a fight would probably not end well for you, so combat was last measure to infinity! You wanted to try and book it to the shrink device and grow you back, but it was sitting right next to the gecko against the cupboard wall.. not to mention those girls were still here and you would have a lot of explaining to do.

As thoughts and strategy's filled your brain, the gecko took a reserved step forward, prompting you to take two steady lunges backward. You cursed yourself. You were moving to quickly. If you weren't more careful you were going to agitate this thing and be dead in a matter of seconds!

You back away slowly from the curious gecko, hands up in a calming gesture in a desperate bid to buy you any time at all before it inevitably came at you. You could tell it was getting past curiosity now, and was close to deciding whether you were going to be its food, as it followed the pace of your steps toward you.

The girls continue to chatter and laugh among themselves, making you a little angry that they were so oblivious to the standoff happening below them. At this point, you had exited the confines of the gap between the cupboard and fridge and had now officially entered the open floor of the kitchen with stomping feet. With your ears you listened for any indication a foot was coming your way, and with your eyes, you kept them locked on the lizards. The two of you stared each other down as you continued moving in the direction of the girls. A quick peek back with your peripheral vision, told you you were getting very close to one of them, so the time to make a move was coming very soon, lest you wait too long and either get eaten or smashed into paste under the weight of a giant teenager.

A few more steps backward and you reciting hail marys three times in your head, you turn and enter into a full on sprint toward the closest foot you could! The gecko followed suit, and it didn't have to sprint to keep up with you (come to think of it.. you weren't even sure a leopard gecko could sprint), and it wasn't long before it was nipping at your heels.

The targeted foot was close enough now, so with all the strength you could come up with, you leap from the floor and cling onto...
