It's a fair drop down to Taylor's bed, but its soft surface should be safe enough for a person of your stature to safely land on. Checking that your possessions are all secured, you take several steps backward. The trick will be to not look down...

A run and a jump. It's simple, and it seems to you that you hang in the air for a long few seconds. You can't help but imagine yourself as the star of an action movie trailer in that time, arms pedalling in the air, the thrilling freedom of having nothing to weigh you down...

The fall is quick, and you roll as you impact on the thick, flower-patterned duvet. Your pack is still shut tight, nothing was dropped! A moment of cheering in celebration is allowed. What a rush! It's not just about survival, it's the incredible experiences that no one else will ever go through! If you'd tried a stunt like that at regular size, you'd have been splattered. Being the size of a bug brings with it a certain resilience to the gravity that so oppresses most of humanity.

Well, there's nothing of interest on this featureless, lumpy landscape, so you waste no time in working on the next step of getting to the floor. It's quite a trek across the uneven surface, and you're still half a dozen inches from the edge of the bed as a series of thundering booms announce Taylor's return.

She strides into her room, chattering away on the phone clamped to the side of face tightly.

"No, there's no sign of anyone here! But the beer didn't open itself, mom! I'm scared, and I don't know what to do. I feel like there could be someone watching me right now..."

Oh, how right you are, you smile, crossing your arms to take in her beauty again. But that moment of cockiness will cost you: you whistle at the widescreen view of her ass when she turns around, but as she collapses down onto the bed you fear that you're going to be crushed beneath it!

Yes, bugs can fall far without injury. But when a bigger creature gets all up in their face, they're going to be the loser every time. Taylor's considerable body presses down half the bed surface, the spring creaking in protest under her weight. You're not directly beneath her, but well within the area of the giantess' influence, and when the bed springs under her, you are catapulted upward.

You don't go flying very far, but as before it all happens in slow motion, Taylor spread out beneath you like a landscape. You look down, and quail as the giantess gets even larger as you fall toward her. Fingers crossed, she should be as soft as her duvet was, and you'll make such a tiny impact that she won't notice!

Breath is kicked out of your lungs, and you can hear straps on your bag breaking as you impact heavily. You can't waste time scrabbling to see what you've lost while cradling your own head for injuries. Your vision blurs, but you seem to have landed on the girl's shorts. Time to get off here and onto the bed, unless you want to spend precious time searching for the even more precious supplies that could be scattered in the creases of her clothes.
12312.title: On the Bed

choices: Climb down from Taylor
Use Taylor as transport
Run a test to see how much you can move on her skin before she notices
This ain't fun any more - get her attention!
See what materials you can scavenge from this titan
123122.content:
Taylor's still talking away on the phone - hence the rumbling thunder overhead - so you should be able to retrieve your pack without risking her spotting you. So, you carefully stride across the ridges of her shorts, looking under each crease and fold, but finding no sign. Tiny, insignificant folds are dunes to you, but you must climb each. Still no success. Even the valley where her shorts meet her torso and end, giving way to the sheer expanse of her shirt as she sits up, there's no sign. But there are no scattered pieces either, so it must be intact.

It didn't fall onto the bed itself, did it? Turning away from Taylor's intimidating tummy, you walk across her thigh, looking for a good place to climb down from. You don't even know which side you should look on! Maybe it's gone for good!

But no, as you look back ahead to keep track of your progress, you spot a dark, lopsided lump sitting out beyond the safezone of the shorts, incongruously settled on the expanse of pale flesh that issues forth from beneath Taylor's clothes.

You run forward, soon coming to the sawn-off terminus of the fabric, nothing but the girl's skin ahead of you now. But a few yards of your scale away lies your precious survival pack. You must merely step out to reclaim it and you can be on your way.

Taylor strikes without warning. That tiny pack must have caused an itch of some sort, as her hand swoops down, and one of her fingers extends to scratch at it. A simple motion, and your pack is obliterated utterly, her nail and fingertip exploding it beneath them, then grinding the contents to dust. As a final insult, the flick of farewell as the hand reascends scatters what molecules remain.

You couldn't have asked for a better depiction of the power and threat this girl holds. Even if she doesn't see you, think you're a bug and try to crush you, she could perceive you as a minor itch and kill you in a moment. You also couldn't have asked for a graver predicament, all your supplies destroyed and trapped atop a girl that at best will present an obstacle!

Climbing down from here - from her - remains an option, but you'll be without tools or supplies, scrabbling even harder to keep alive. The other option would be to return to higher ground, tag along in Taylor's pocket or similar, and hope that she can get you close enough to some food or other useful items so that you can get a bit of a head start in getting back on track. It's the least she can do after so casually dashing all your hopes...
123122.title: A Show of Power

choices: Stick with Taylor for now; it's safer
Try to get off Taylor in this moment of calm
Do your best to transfer yourself to the bike
Attempt to attract Taylor's attentions
Work your way lower on Taylor - slowly, slowly while she's distracted
1231221.content:
You look down the height of Taylor's thigh, readying yourself for the long climb ahead and below you. Above, the girl herself makes another godlike statement.

"Mom, call the cops. I'm getting out of the house; whoever took that beer could still be here. I'll be at Alycia's, okay? Love you."

She hangs up the call, and then stands. A simple motion to her, but you are forced to make a quick grab for any part of her shorts that may support your weight. Your fingers sink into gaps between the strands, and snatch tight as the powerful leg beneath powers the behemoth on her way.

Taylor's steps were imposing when she moved across the room from you. Here, at ground zero of every explosive step that she takes, you are terrified out of your mind. Impacts shudder upwards from her feet, shaking you like a grain of salt with every movement. More scary than the experience is the knowledge that you're being taken away from your size-change machine, and any hope of escaping this failed survival attempt.

In her rush to escape an intruder, Taylor has kidnapped that same invader, unaware that he is a speck clinging desperately to her for life! It's true what they say: the insect is way more scared of the human than the human is of them!

Taylor's steps are hurried in her fear, her mighty muscles working overtime as they churn away before you, biological machines whose power could support thousands of people your size without complaint. Your life means nothing anymore, and the challenge of survival will now be an even steeper climb than the gargantuan teenager sweeping you away.

Your tumultuous torment ends briefly, and you can look over your shoulder to see the girl's hands reaching out toward a construct of pink tubes, a gigantic black plain elevated above its mid-point.

A moment, and you deduce that it is a bicycle. Taylor is going to ride to Alycia's house, and you'll go along with her.

Unless you act now to part ways with the girl, and stay in the house! Sure, you'll be in the garage rather than her bedroom, but with your survival instincts you should be able to fight your way through the house!
1231221.title: The Call Is Coming From Within the House

choices: Climb to the ground here, outside Alycia's home
Wait until Taylor walks inside the house before getting off
Climb higher, and try to stick with Taylor until she goes home
Get off and wait on the bike
Taylor makes the choice for you!
12312211.content:
Of course you've seen Taylor riding her little bike before. How could you not? Over the months of surveillance you subjected your neighbours to, she would ride to and from school, go out on weekends and more. It's how she's kept herself so fit.

Of course, now she hurriedly heads as fast as she can away from a feared home invader. If only she knew that invader was actually a speck on her white shorts, clinging on for dear life!

As her thigh rises and lowers with each push of her muscles, it is certainly a lot less difficult to hold on than when she was walking; it's much more level, like a ship in a stormy sea rather than clinging to a skyscraper in a hurricane.

No, the problem is the speed as she zips along. At your scale, the distances she covers are magnified, and it's like she's travelling at over forty thousand miles per hour, more than ten times the speed of the fastest aircraft made by man! Comprehending the world around you is impossible, and you can barely keep your thoughts straight. Think what this could do for public transit, if people could be shrunk down and carried places en masse - it would be the future of travel! And here you are using the technology for selfish reasons, to dare the universe that you can survive the worst it can throw at you.

You've been a fool. There's no way you can survive this, no way without your supplies, stuck here to a young woman's leg. You're not even sure that you can hold on until she reaches her destination...

Hold that thought. The bike skids to a halt, and the goddess yells out Alycia's name. Clearly you've arrived, and can let out a sigh of relief. Soon she will rise from her vehicle, to walk inside and see her friend. You can't stick with these giants much longer, as the risks of death are too great. To establish yourself, you need to cut off ties with the human world. Without your emergency supplies, you need to hook up with some method of living ASAP - no wasting time with teen gossip.

Now, the best way to go about that...
12312211.title: The Future of Transportation

choices: You turn and bolt, running for your life
Drawing your weapon, you jab to scare the girl away for a moment
Trusting to your tiny size, you jump from the desk to the floor
You run toward Abby, hoping to get out of her view and hide on her
You freeze, holding your hands up and waiting for her move
1233.content:
"You're in trouble!"

The voice booms out across the room, and you shudder at the sentiment - whoever this is, you are indeed in trouble. But as the door slams open, handle banging against the wall, shockwave blasting you back off your feet, you look up to see that it might not be as bad as you thought.

It is Abby that has sprung into the room, the fifteen-year-old middle child of the Anderson family, her eyes and mouth wide as if to surprise her sister. She wasn't shouting for you, she was trying to catch Taylor!

"Oh," Abby says as she deflates,shoudlers slumping as she walks further into the room. "She's not here."

You pick yourself up, waist height to this young giant and hundreds of feet from the floor. There is a powerful impact to your right as she places a great, glass tower on the surface, and you stagger as you look across to the massive beer bottle that you'd been drinking from only a few moments ago! You foolishly left it out in the kitchen, and when Abby found it she must have concluded that Taylor was the one responsible!

"Well," Abby says as she crouches, bringinge her face level with the bottle, eyes locked on its large label, "she'll still know that I know, if I leave it here. Mom and Dad are gonna be PISSED."

Two thing of note here. Clearly, Abby likes to talk to herself, which is rather random but might be a useful nugget of information. Secondly, you're somewhat amazed at how true some of the statements of the fictional 'Gulliver's Travels' are.

Clearly, the ratio of size difference between you and humans is far greater than any two characters in the book, but as Abby's face looms above, you can all too well appreciate the magnified ugliness of the average face. This teenager has festering hills of acne bigger than your head, her entire visage cratered with deformities that an average person would not notice. It is with revulsion as much as fascination that your eyes play over that mountainous surface.

Abby jerks back, raising her phone to take a picture of the beer. "A little evidence will seal the deal. Busted!"

She clicks a couple of snaps, before thumbing between them, pinching and zooming to find the best image. She continues to mutter to herself before she steps forward again, pronouncing a very final: "Well, well, well, what do we have here..?"

Abby stoops again, her humungous head hovering directly over you, her eyes gazing directly down upon you, nostrils flaring storms around you as her smile widens impossibly. Examining those pictures, she saw your tiny body beside the bottle, and knows that you're here...
1233.title: Younger Sister, Bigger Danger

choices: Abby wants the little man as a pet
Abby wants the little man as a scientific cutiosity
Abby wants to get famous off the little man
Abby wants to torture the little man
Abby wants to share the little man with her family
12331.content:
She's... she's so huge. You had thought to shrink yourself into a world of giants, but at one eighth of an inch tall, the Abby that looms over you right now is closer to a god. Far, far above your ability to comprehend, let alone cope with! You turn and sprint, putting her to your back in the desperate hope of escaping her gaze.

The girl grunts as she stands up again, and then another of her pronouncements rings out across the landscape of Taylor's desk. "Hey, don't be scared, little guy."

There is an incredible impact, monstrous noise and vibration as an immense surface blocks off your path. When the dust settles, you look up at the skin of Abby's hand, lowered before you. Of course, with her god-like viewpoint, she can see over any obstacles that you may be running around, and use a small part of her anatomy to make an utter mockery of your escape.

You groan as you see just how small a part of her anatomy has been deployed. Her fist has crashed down on the desktop, with only her pinky finger extended to form a barricade to uppity insect you. Even that whorled surface is several times your height, quite the daunting obstacle even if you weren't tired from running. And goddess Abby has taken no effort, outclassing you in every way with her speed and power.

You stand, defeated, but that is not enough for the girl. That finger slides across the floor toward you, bashing directly into you with terifying force, knocking you off your feet. "Pretty dumb," she says. "Just climb on already."

You're not sure which was your bigger mistake - shrinking yourself quite this small or forgetting that damn beer bottle! Now, here you are, at the utter mercy of this being. No way to survive beyond what she wants. Whatever that might be...
12331.title: Not So Fast

choices: Set up camp as planned
Dig into the skirting board
Live as a nomad within the living room
Create a complex spider's web above the heads of the family
Climb to a high place
124.content:
You walk into the living room, the area where the family will spend most of their time gathered together. Several comfortable looking chairs and a couch arc before the massive flatscreen tv hanging from the wall, and pictures of each family member, alone or in groups, speckle the walls.

From this area, supplies will be plentiful, and there'll even be a little entertainment available when the Andersons gather to watch a program. With such a vast amount of traffic however, there is the increased risk of being spotted, or just plain accidently crushed underfoot. But you wouldn't have opted for such a survivalist lifestyle if you feared taking risks!

So, where would be the best place to station yourself? Still regular size, you check the room thoroughly before you take the plunge to an eighth of an inch. You want to get this right.

Under the couch, right up against the skirting board, you will be out of sight. Bar any decisions to move the furniture to vacuum underneath, no one will spot you. You run a hand along the carpet underneath the couch, and find it pretty clean; it must have been done recently, so you have some time before you'd have to fear being sucked away. Time to prepare.

The device is simplicity to use, and in moments you are a speck, traipsing under the impossible awning of the couch where before you could barely squeeze your arm underneath. You marvel in the sheer scope and scale of your new home.

The skirting board sounds solid to a cursory rap of your knuckles, but at this closer scale you can see how fragile it is, how easy it would be for you to dig in, termite-like, to construct a living area for yourself in the very fabric of the room. You hadn't considered it before, but it's something worth contemplating. It would be more tiring than simply setting up your little tent, but may be worthwhile in the end.

And there's always the third option: go without. Why tie yourself down? There's no hostile climate to fear indoors, and leaving evidence of your dwelling is just more likely to lead to discovery, whether you're present there or not. Perhaps it would be better to live as a nomad within this room, without any ties to a specific point, going where the food is and living beneath chair or couch as the mood takes you.

Where the mood takes you... Looking upward, you see the vast expanse of the ceiling. It may be crazy to think this, but then it's surely crazy to shrink yourself this small in the first place. Why not live up high, and swoop down when supplies are needed? Live like a spider, some crazy series of ropes and pulleys...

No, no, surely that's a step too far... But some height might be helpful in avoiding the feet of the family. Maybe it would be possible to scale and nest within a bookshelf...
124.title: Central Shrunken Base Camp

choices: Yes Abby's room
No Ethan's room
The bathroom
The mud room
More choices
125.title: Abby's bedroom?

choices: City Hall
Library
Lost in a gust of wind and end up in the forest
Crash in a neighborhood house
Toward a public transportation hub
13.content:
This has to be the worst Idea you've ever had. It's also the opposite of survival. Walking the streets at anything less than a few inches is pure suicide. If anything it would be as if you had become a rat so you sat down on your bed and tried to reconsider. Writing and keeping a journal of your experiences is your priority you want people to know what it's like being the first shrunken person so maybe living like a rat downtown would fit the first experience being the lab rat after all.

Laying out something's you'll need were as follows: Keys to the house "Even though they'd be useless shrunk down". Backpack, lighter, magnifying glass, Bowie knife, canteen, three sets of cloths, blanket, food ration, flash light, notebook & pen. And finally the beacon for a drone that will come to your rescue should you need it.

Without any further delay you get into the machine and set it to a modest three quarters of an inch hop on the drone and climb into the sky to your destination.
13.title: Urban Sprawl

choices: The Fountain
The Garden
The Roof
Crash your drone to distract the guards as you run past them
Drop from your drone ONTO a security guard
131.content:
It's not just survival that this new size will allow you to experience differently - now you can go places never before imagined, see sights few can witness, be privy to secret decisions made by the rich and powerful.

Now, while it may have been nice to go and infiltrate the offices of a world leader, you'll settle for the city hall of your home town. What does the mayor and their cronies get up to behind closed doors? It'll be so interesting to be near such powerful people!

Of course, you realise that security around such a place will be stricter than many of the other locations you could have chosen for your new home. As you skim closer to the statue-lined hall, you realise that you'll have to be very stealthy indeed, noting the towering security guards standing watch. There's no way they'll over look your drone, even if they do ignore three-quarter inch you.

So, you'll have to put down some distance away and approach on foot. There is a small fountain right in front on the hall, which should provide cover for you to land and take stock before making your way across the largest square you've ever seen.

Alternatively, you could put down in the gardens to the rear of the building, and make your way through the jungle grasses to your destination.

The most daring plan of all would be to head for the building's roof, and try to work your way down into the interior, wary of pigeons the whole way...
131.title: City Hall - Big City, Big Home

choices: The porn...  I mean erotica section.
The lounge/break room.
The children's section.
The toilets
The boring non-fiction section
132.content:
You would not believe how long it takes to fly a measly five miles to the nearest library when you're shorter than an inch. You've got time to take a nap, and despite your nerves, you do manage to catch some sleep. The beeping of the drone wakes you up, alerting you that you've arrived.

Floating near the ceiling of the place, you can't help but feel awed. Even from up here, the place looks massive. The ground looks so far away, and the people strolling along appear so tiny, even though the smallest of them could crush you without even knowing it.

You shake your head, clearing your mind of these thoughts. It was time to be serious. You've done some reconnaissance (read: you've been to the library before) and determined a few hiding spots that could work as a base camp.

First, there was a disused bookcase near the back corner. It contained some "Adult Romance Novels," and you had to assume not many people used the area. Camping out back there would keep you more than safe from the crowds roaming the place. Of course, it was far from anything, making scrounging for supplies much more difficult than it had to be.

Next was the employee break room. Technically, you hadn't seen it, since the back rooms are off limits to anyone but the librarians, but you assumed it was there. It'd be a great place to get supplies, since all break rooms are mandated by the state to carry snacks of all sorts (That is a law, right?) Admittedly, it did suffer from constant use, making getting trampled a bit hard to avoid. Plus, you'd need to spend time finding it before you could set up camp. That'd be a pain.

Finally, in the children's section, you could hide behind the picture books. You've stealthily been back there, and you knew dusting wasn't a thing that happened there very often. Having your base crushed under a feather duster would be quite the set back, you'd willingly admit, so it'd be nice to not have to worry about that. Unfortunately, it was near kids. Loud kids who'd keep you from sleeping and likely use you as a toy if you were found. Shudder.

Well, it's time to decide. The drone'll drop you off, but it can't fly for much longer without recharging. The sooner you pick, the better.
132.title: Reading Rainbow

choices: Feel one of the books moving
Decide to find more supplies
Go look at the nature of the public library
Begin fortifying your home
Carve up some books for firewood
1321.content:
You ride your drone to the far back corner of the library, deciding to live in the adult romance section. Hardly anyone ever used it, so you should be safe from potential discovery.

The bookshelf appears as big as a skyscraper to you as you land on the second to top shelf. Thankfully too, as your drone dies out as soon as you step off. You walk in between several books, and find a nice area to set up base camp. It's a small cave, and you set up your supplies, and wait for the lights in the building to flicker off.

When the lights slip into darkness you start to drift away, preparing for the next day.

When you awake you
1321.title: The porn...  I mean erotica section.

choices: "Bathroom"
"Breakroom"
"Cafe"
You leave your mind open to another option once you hit the ground
You follow the power cable to its source
13212.content:
You awoke before dawn, while the library was still nice and empty, the perfect time to take into account what you had and what you needed.

The "camp" was looking a bit sparse; a ruffled up blanket and a pile of supplies under the shadow of "Werewolf Lovers IX" was all to your name. The ration you had for breakfast was gone, too, leaving enough food for a few more days at most. Water was looking even worse, as you'd severely underestimated how thirsty you could get in the dusty shelves.

Ripping out a piece of notebook paper, you began to scribble a list. First and foremost, water. You had only enough for the day, and doing anything would be impossible without staying hydrated. You knew you could get water from the bathrooms, but they were on the far side of the building, at least a day's trek if you were being cautious. The break room was closer, only a few hours away, but it suffered from serious danger issues. You wrote two columns down: 'bathroom' and 'breakroom.' You needed water, badly, but nothing was looking good. Then a thought struck you of a recent addition to the library: a small cafe, designed to attract more foot traffic to the dwindling business. There will be food and drink there, but the very nature of 'foot traffic' is dangerous to you. Still, you scribbled 'cafe' below the other two words.

Sighing, you slipped the paper into your back pocket. Before you could go anywhere, you needed off this bookshelf. It was possible you had been a bit too ambitious when you chose such a high perch, but there was nothing you could do about that now. On a hunch, you moved to the back of the shelf. A hole was rusted through the metal, revealing the wall behind it. And, more importantly, revealing a thick power cable that connected to an air conditioning unit somewhere above. You can't help but smile. At least something's going your way.

Half an hour later, and you had descended the cord to the ground. Next time would probably be faster, but it's always better to be safe than sorry. Looking around at the darkened shelves that surrounded you gave you a bit of a rush. Yeah, this was difficult and a bit of a pain in the ass, but it was an adventure! Pulling out the list again, you took the pen and circled:
13212.title: Dawn of the First Day

choices: Self-reliance
Take help from a giant
Hide until it goes away
Climb up another book-case
Take a diversion, the long way around
132121.content:
Water is your most important need, and the bathroom has it in abundance. Even splashes on the floor from someone overzealously washing their hands will be enough to sustain three quarter inch you for days at a time. And the foot traffic there, while brisk, should be more a case of 'in and out quickly'; in the break room, a giant could loiter for up to an hour, with an increased chance of spotting you!

As you slog through the thick, dry carpet fibres, you wonder how you're going to transport the water. In order to avoid having to make this trek too regularly, you'd best take back a decent quantity. But carrying back a barrel of water is just going to weigh you down, make you a bigger target and get you thirsty to boot! Not to mention the problem of getting it up to your camp on the top shelf...

No, you haven't though this plan through at all well! You look over the few canteens you're carrying with you. You've barely begun this trek and your tongue is already like a cracked twig in your mouth. This survival lark is going to be hell!

Passing between the stacks, towering higher than any edifice your larger self ever saw, you keep a look out for any raw materials that could be of use to you. The best you can manage are scraps of paper - the remains of notes fallen from the pages of books - which are too large to easily carry. You could slice sections off with your blade, but that would take time you don't have.

Seems the sterile environment of the library is not one suited to a scavenger!

'A day's trek' you estimated as the duration of the journey to the bathroom. You glance at your watch to see only a few hours have passed, and you've still got a way to go. Also, you have crossed the opening time of the library, and can soon expect giants to be about.

You can hear the distant rumble as they approach: for you there will be no silence in the library!

How should you react to the imminent arrival of these titans? You could continue your journey, sticking to cover where possible and largely ignoring them. Or you could dare to make use of their power, to hitch a ride on one as it passes, to lessen the time your journey will take.

Or you could postpone your search for water, and hide somewhere safe until the coast is clear.
132121.title: Water of Life

choices: You fall loose onto the station just in time
You remain attached to the front of the diaper
You are kicked off the diaper toward a wash stand
The mother's thumb presses down directly on you
The mother drops the diaper on the floor
1321212.content:
In the long term, you were going to have to either move your base or find a closer water supply. However, your thirst wasn't going to wait for that; you were going to need water soon, and this trek wasn't going to cut it. As stupidly dangerous as it was, you were going to need help.

This was something you'd expected and considered, and you weren't looking forward to it. Even if you managed to find someone heading in the right direction,you'd never be able to jump onto a moving foot, and you'd never be able to hold onto it once it started moving. If you tried that, you'd be under a shoe in seconds, dead on your second day. If you were going to survive a ride, you'd need to find something stationary with a safe hiding spot that would be likely to head towards a restroom. Maybe a purse, or a backpack, or...

There, just across the shelving aisle. A baby stroller.

It was the perfect target. Right now, it was completely still as the mother browsed books beyond it. It had a nice hiding space in the hanging storage basket, and it would likely be heading to the bathroom as soon as the baby needed a change.

You looked left; the path was clear.

You looked right; the path was also clear.

You sprinted forward, across the yards and yards of free, empty space. Clouds of dust billowed behind you, but you couldn't stop, couldn't slow down. You'd made it across a quarter of the aisle, then a half, then three quarters. With a mighty leap, you grab onto the worn wheel of the stroller. Little divots make handholds, and soon you're at level with the basket. One final jump, and you land in it, tumbling down to rest alongside a bright pink diaper.

There's no time to rest, however, as the baby above you begins to cry. "Waaah! Waaahhh! MmmaaHH!!" It's deafening, forcing you to cover your ears and grit you teeth. The thin canopy of polyester above you shifts as the child struggles. Even though you know better, you can't help but worry that it'll break and you'll be crushed.

The sudden pounding of footsteps indicated the mother's return. "Shh, shh, it's okay, I'm still here," she coos, trying to calm her child. "Ohh, you made a mess. We'll fix that right up, okay? No need to cry, mommy's here." She bends down, and before you can process it she tosses her book into the storage basket, right on top of you. It presses you down, hard, but the diaper beneath you cushions most of the weight. Still, you're helpless as the stroller begins to move.

In less than a minute, the mother makes it to the restroom, completing the trek that would have taken you all day. Still trying to calm her child, she sets up the changing station, pulling out the talcum powder, baby wipes, the diaper. And, unfortunately, you. The book hadn't hurt you, but it had forced your leg into the pink frills on the diaper's front end.

With a soft thump that only you heard, the now quiet baby was set beside the supplies. She was a girl of two or three, but even laying down she towered far overhead. You worked at your leg as the mother worked at her child; her long fingers removed the soaked diaper and began to clean the child's behind. In moments, she'd be ready for her new diaper.
1321212.title: Hitchhiking Gone Wrong

choices: Climb down the woman
Time to go parachuting!
Climb across the wall
Stay right here until the giants leave - make your own way back
Cautiously approach the toddler - higher up the body!
13212121.content:
You thump to the tabletop with a wheeze of pain, but also a sigh of relief. You shrank yourself to test your survival skills in a larger world, not some kid's underwear!

There's no time to contemplate the distance you have fallen before the diaper's pink mass is spirited heavenward by the godlike hand of the mother, without a care in the world. The monstrous giggle of the daughter encourages you even more to turn away from the sight: the movements of humans as behemoths may be awesome and amazing, but you really don't want to check out a humungous toddler's ass.

No, what you need to concentrate on is getting down from this platform, and continuing with your mission to collect water. So, how to get down..? Having climbed down from your own nest using a length of power cable, you have no climbing equipment with you! And the smooth white walls of this washroom aren't as handhold-friendly as the stroller was. There's no way you can clamber down that sheer surface.

The woman could help you out here, again. As she looms over the titanic baby, her lower body is quite close to the edge of this platform. It's not too far a leap to her clothing, and the thick denim of her jeans will be easy enough to descend. The risk comes from her potential to do something unpredictable while insect-you clings to her massive leg.

There is another option. You still retain some of those paper scraps that you salvaged on the way here. Now, you're no physics expert, but it's possible that you could use one as a makeshift parachute and float to the ground with a simple leap of faith. Hopefully without catching the eye of the woman above you...

But why climb down? You came here for water, so perhaps you should try to get to the wall, thick and pock-infested at your scale, and try to climb horizontally, to somewhere with available liquid.
13212121.title: Diaper Disaster Averted!

choices: Jump off now, to the library's front desk
Stick with the woman, to get outside supplies
Take this to the streets
Jump to the stroller
Tear a hole in these jeans
132121211.content:
Time for one muttered prayer before you launch yourself from the cleaning station, passing through the air and dropping toward the expanse of denim.

Thudding into the solid surface, you slide painfully down its rough exterior as you scrabble wildly, your fingers losing skin as they dig at strands thicker than your arms. Your fall halts, and you have a moment to catch your breath and contemplate your survival. Just a moment.

Then the woman moves, a simple step to the side that creases a contortion all across the wall of fabric to which you cling, deforming it to the whim of her godly thigh muscle, and shaking you wildly. It's all you can do to maintain a grip; any dream of descending to the floor dies here!

Terrified beyond description, you cling tight to the jeans, afraid that any movement may coincide with the giantess moving, and casting you, screaming, to the ground so far below. You're stuck here for the foreseeable future, waiting for a chance of the woman ceasing movement for a guaranteed period of time before you try to get off.

So you wait, listening to the cooing of the mother over her daughter, and narrowly avoiding becoming crushed between a fold as she stoops to place the toddler back in the stroller. The rise upward is more exhilarating than any roller-coaster, but then she begins to walk.

The leg swings back and forth, and you doubt any mountaineer would stay attached better than you are right now: this is akin to climbing the slope of an exploding volcano!

Motion ceases, and you blink a few times before looking over your shoulder. You can make out the hazy form of the library's front desk, close enough to leap across to, and with a rough enough surface that gripping should be a cinch. You don't risk it yet though, listening for any indicator of sudden movement on the woman's part:

"Just the one today?" the amiable voice of the librarian booms down.

"Yeah, I hardly get any time to read with this little bundle!"

"Heh, yeah, tell me about it! See you next week, then!"

She's checking out a book - perfect! You can jump to the front desk with time to spare!

Although... This woman will be returning here in a week. You could stay with her, allow her to take you home with her. While the library is desolate, devoid of food, the house of a family will be plentiful. You could gather lots of supplies there, and if you stowed them aboard the stroller - invisible to a regular human eye - you could have the woman bring you and them back to the library in seven days' time! Then, suitably outfitted with supplies, you'll have reserves to fall back on while you build your new life here in the library!

Thirdly, here's your chance to return to the streets, the original plan you set out to survive. Once this woman's out the door of the building, you get the Hell off her and try survival here on Hard Mode.
132121211.title: Hip High

choices: Sit with the woman until she heads home
Take this chance to move to the supermarket
Jump across to the leaving shopper
Get off at the cashier's desk
Drop off before she enters the building
1321212112.content:
Of course, just because you're not leaving the woman while she's standing still doesn't mean you're not going to take advantage to move! With a quick scan of the area you find your destination, and pull yourself along and up. Soon you are nestling yourself in the gentle hammock of her right hip pocket, able to relax your arms. Women very rarely use their pockets as much as men do, and with her hands occupied with the stroller, you should be safe here for the rest of the trip!

You get a better appreciation of your method of transport as the journey resumes, and see the titanic world pass by at incredible speeds. The marvellous sight of such giant people and places...

It's early morning, and it seems that the woman has a few more chores to run before she heads home; you recognise the terrain she passes through, and realise that she's making her way to the local supermarket!

Your original plan for a food-gathering expedition involved just tagging along with the woman, but in a place dedicated to storing food you'd have your choice of what you wanted to take! The only problem would be that if you chose to skip off here, you wouldn't be able to rely upon the woman to take you back to the library in a week. If you stop off at the supermarket, your chances of returning to the library and the shrinking machine will fall to nearly zero; you'd pretty much be switching your chosen home. Is that what you want to do?

Your thoughts are disturbed as another figure approaches from through the supermarket doors, one pushing an already-stuffed trolley, stacked to capacity with enough food for a lifetime! That surely looks like the easiest road to take!
1321212112.title: Stop-Off at the Supermarket

choices: Plan to stick with the food
Plan to stick with the transport
Stay with the woman herself
Climb higher during her travels
Climb lower during her travels
13212121121.content:
It's relatively relaxing, allowing the woman go about her daily business. She passes everyday products in the supermarket aisles, cartons, cans and boxes bigger than the greatest billboard, their prices inscribed in words dozens of feet tall! Every now and then she stops to reach upward, to heavens beyond your sight, or else stoops, your pocket sanctuary constricting slightly as you witness her immense arm lift one of the consumer monoliths for depositing in the stroller's basket.

Yes, you should stay with her; out in the supermarket, you'd struggle to reach items that normal people so casually take, and you could starve to death when surrounded by food. Instead, you will relaxingly ride out this journey, even catching a little sleep while you can - when this woman gets home, you want to make the most of the seven days you have with her and her family before heading back to the library. Best plan ahead now for getting off her in her kitchen for stocking up with food - or should you stick with the stroller, so you know where you'll have to stash your goodies?
13212121121.title: Mothered

choices: Descend to the kitchen floor to commence resource gathering
Traverse to the dog for transport and water collection
Remain in the hip pocket for reconnaissance
Climb up for the higher reaches of this woman-mountain
Jump off as she passes a table
132121211211.content:
Luckily, it's straight home from the supermarket for the woman. Her hip works powerfully along, regular strides pausing only when it becomes time to cross the road. You had thought to memorise the route, in case you ever got separated from her in the future, but the sensation of motion stops you from forming thoughts too advanced.

As the big, red door to the woman's house creaks open, the first doubt of your plan manifests in a loud, roaring bark, and an immense beast leaping at you.

The woman stoops to greet her pet dog, and you are saved from being smashed by the monster's arrival by being enclosed in the envelopment of her denim pocket.

The dog is a complication, you think to yourself as you shudder in terror. And yet, it's so much better than if it had been a cat. Dogs don't tend to concern themselves with licking up insects, and if you've learned anything from 'Honey, I Shrunk the Kids' (essential viewing to train for your survival), it's that a dog could be very helpful! Also, a pet does mean that a large storage dish holding water will be on the floor of the kitchen - very easy to harvest, so long as you can avoid being licked up.

Yes, there's always a bright side! As the goddess who brought you here rustles the dog and baby-talks to it, you come to a decision about where to progress next. Your original plan had been to make your way to the floor and scope out the kitchen, but that may be more dangerous now that an excited canine is running around.

You could always jump onto the dog itself, and allow it to take you about as a means of transport. So long as you don't cause enough of an itch to be scratched like a flea, it should be safe enough, and you can drop off when it needs to drink to get your own fill.

Or, maybe you should stick with the woman for now, get a lay of the house from her perspective, and plan your week of stockpiling before acting on it.
132121211211.title: Home is Where the Hound Is

choices: Climb down and get to the water bowl
Climb down and gather some hair-rope from the carpet
Climb down and look for a temporary base camp location
Attempt to get off near where the food is stored
Get onto a kitchen counter
1321212112113.content:
A single syllable from the lips of the giantess makes the dog withdraw, its hind quarters thumping to the ground, where its tail pounds away at the kitchen floor. The woman stoops briefly, then you watch as she lifts an immense plastic bowl - far bigger to you than any sports stadium - to the sink, filling it with water and placing it before the hound, who gratefully begins lapping at it.

Next, she takes the time to remove her daughter from the stroller - you take especial notice of the corner the vehicle is pushed into, as it is your route out of here in a little under a week - and stride out of the kitchen.

Once more you are at the mercy of massive muscles at your back, but she is ever so slightly slower now, and you admire the brief time you spend in her Olympian hallway before she is in the living room, and placing her daughter down into the pen barred off by skyscraper-like bars. A few words bring a laugh to the lips of the giant toddler, and then the woman walks back to the kitchen to unpack her grocery shopping.

You marvel yet again at her strength as she hefts the boxes and bags, and pops open cupboards and the refrigerator.

It may be time to act. But where should you begin?

This whole journey began because you sought water, and the dog far below is nearly done - but leaves more than enough liquid for you to get.

You know where the food is now, but you will need ways of transporting it. At your size, human hair - or even dog hair, at a pinch - will work well as rope, and there will be plenty of it scattered around this house.

You'll be staying here for a week, so maybe you need to secure a location where you can shelter during that time.
1321212112113.title: Day One: The Domestic Routine of the Goddess

choices: Climb down to the floor
Jump onto the woman when she passes
Rest on the chair for a while
Scale the chair back to get the lay of the land
Look down the back of the chair for what may have been dropped there
13212121121132.content:
Three quarters of an inch tall, climbing down this woman's awesome leg would be difficult even if she were standing still. Which she isn't. Luckily, a roared question from the toddler brings her back into the living room, and as she strides powerfully past an armchair you take the opportunity and leap.

The landing knocks breath from your lungs, but at least you're alive to breathe! Pulling yourself up, you survey the room from a new, fixed point. The goddess stoops to talk with her child again, and you consider your position atop the chair's backrest.

The soft covering of the chair is thick beneath your feet, but as you walk across it you make out several lengths of hair, dropped from someone's head over the course of an ordinary day. It is thick and sturdy in your hands, more than good enough to take your weight or that of any items you may try to carry. It's too long for you, but the work of your bowie knife soon cuts it down to size, and you coil several lengths tightly, securing plenty of rope for yourself, a good start for survival!

But where next? There's enough hair for you to climb easily to the ground if you wanted, but you could also attempt to jump back onto the woman when she next walks past. Alternatively, if you're already feeling a little exerted, you could rest up here and wait until the household has calmed down - perhaps until someone actually sits in this very chair - before thinking about leaving.
13212121121132.title: D1:  How Long is a Piece of Hair?

choices: Gather food from the woman
Harvest water from the dog bowl
Secure a resting spot on the stroller
Head elsewhere in the house
Check exits from the house
132121211211321.content:
The thought of using human hair as a rope to climb down may have seemed preposterous to the outsider, but you find it an ideal aid, thick and textured well enough to maintain a tight grip. Hand over hand you lower yourself toward the carpet far below, steady and assured.

The only minor danger comes when the woman walks back into the kitchen, the storm of her passing wrenching your rope about wildly in her wake, but it holds. Just. It is a minute or two before you summon the courage to resume your descent, but in time you set down on firm ground once again.

Right! You have rope, but you still require food, water and shelter. The first is still being unloaded in the kitchen by the woman, the second lies in the bowl of the family dog, and the third is atop the stroller that is on the other side of both.

But with a giant woman so close, maybe you'd be better off heading elsewhere for now.
132121211211321.title: D1:  Still Much More to Accomplish

choices: Press on to the water bowl, get to your goal quickly!
Turn around and run back to climb the chair, find high ground!
Detour into the playpen, the one place that won't be vacuum'd!
Grab onto the woman when she gets near
Press close to the wall
1321212112113212.content:
You begin your hike across the living room carpet toward the kitchen, trying to ignore the monstrous noises coming from the child in the playpen to your right. There's more than enough fear with the dog beast and the goddess that tower at your destination.

Minutes have passed, and then a tremendous crack of thunder rolls out, repeated twice more moments later. The dog bursts into life, moving from its bowl and bounding around with enthusiasm. The woman rises from her position and moves to the front door, navigating the dog easily.

Once opened, the door reveals another giant woman, and a brief exchange of god-words is exchanged. You have ceased your travels momentarily, frozen in wonder, but pick up only the gist of what is going on.

A dog lead is attached, and the beast is taken away by the second woman, a professional dog walker removing one problem from the house. Excellent! Now you can harvest water without worrying about being eaten by a dog!

The mother strides back into the room, passing over you with shuddering impact. She stoops over the girl again, and her words this time are clear:

"Right, now that Posey's gone for a walk, I can do some cleaning in peace. And after that we can get you fed, okay? Just don't be scared of the vacuum..."

Oh God. A vacuum cleaner would kill you in an instant. You need to get safely away from it as quickly as you can!
1321212112113212.title: D1:  A Tidy House

choices: Use the playpen as shortcut to get closer to the kitchen
Scavenge the playpen for supplies
Sit tight and recoup your strength
Climb up the playpen bars to get the lay of the land
Shout up at the girl, see if you truly are unnoticable
13212121121132123.content:
The vacuum won't go into the playpen while the daughter is there, so you run off in that direction. The mother rises again, stepping past you with her bare feet erupting clouds of dust from the carpet, but you are unfazed. The thick bars of the pen are sturdy enough to imprison the titanic toddler, but at three-quarters of an inch tall the gaps between them are like triumphal arches.

No, no problems at all, not until you find yourself looking up at the monstrous girl again.

Sitting on her ass, she pays you no attention as she works through some complex narrative with a pair of dolls in her mighty mitts. She is a landscape unto herself, towering far above the scattered toys around her, but the pen is still big enough that there's more than enough room to keep out of her way.

So, what to do while the vacuum goes about its destructive business?
13212121121132123.title: D1:  Shielded by the Young

choices: Scavenge discarded hair and other detritus
Risk approaching the toys for better loot
Chance it all to go near the girl herself
132121211211321232.content:
No, now that your life has become wholly about survival, there is no moment that you should not spend trying to acquire more tools and resources to ensure yourself another minute of existence.

What is there to offer in this area? Well, the girl drops hairs as much as her mother, and hers will be finer, so you could scavenge some more rope from the carpet. Those toys could have many salvageable materials as well. The last, and most intimidating, option is the girl herself: the thick material of her clothes is of better quality than both scattered hairs and cheap toy imitations.

Which is it to be?
132121211211321232.title: D1:  Everywhere is a Resource

choices: Stay with the girl as she is picked up
Drop off to stay in the playpen
Use your rope to try and swing onto the mother
Use your rope to try and swing onto a higher piece of furniture
Take this chance to run for the kitchen
1321212112113212323.content:
Swallowing back your fear, you walk up to the girl, passing the immense bare foot that points up at the ceiling, following the wall of her leg toward the main mass of her body. The dress that she's wearing is thick and could provide some fine clothing to warm you in colder climes, but the true motherlode hits you like a revelation.

Maybe it's because you were almost killed by it earlier today, but the moment your eyes roll past the nappy the girl wears, you realise it would be the perfect material to take.

You have rope, but that's no good for holding together more than single lumps of material. You would ideally need some large covering for less solid hauls, which could then be tied up by the rope. With your trusty bowie knife, you could cut away substantial amounts of plastic from the periphery - not enough to be noticed by the giant world, but enough to make several watertight sacks.

Engrossed in her play, the girl does not notice the insect crawling its way up along her leg and toward her nappy. Keeping well clear from the main mass of the thing about her body, you saw away at those frills that stand clear of the girl. Tirelessly you work, ignoring the noise of both the girl above and the constant, threatening drone of the vacuum so far away. She moves occasionally, her merest shifts of weight deadly threats to you.

Still, large rectangles of thick, dependable plastic fall before you in sheets, and you fold and secure them with your rope, reliable carrying tools for whatever foods you may eventually acquire.

Then, a god-voice thunders over both you and the girl: "Upsadaisy!"

You hear it clearly, and realise that the vacuum has stopped. The mother is going to pick up her daughter again! Do you want to be a part of that?
1321212112113212323.title: D1:  A Second Resource Acquired

choices: Climb up the girl to get to some food
Descend to the floor to head for the water in the dog bowl
Remain on the seat
Wait for the mother to close so you can get to her
See if there's more stuff to harvest from the girl
13212121121132123231.content:
You hang tight, glad in the knowledge that the nappy was emptied only recently, and you won't have to stomach any more disgust. Looking down, you see the girl's feet swing in empty air, the floor distant below you as the woman casually carries the giant girl into the kitchen. A surface meets the girl's ass, and you are slammed into it too as she sits down.

Peering toward the light, it looks like the underside of a table; the mother has placed her daughter into a high chair in order to feed her. This could be a great opportunity to get some food, or given the free transport to the kitchen you could climb down and go for the dog bowl while there's no-one to disturb you.
13212121121132123231.title: D1:  Feeding Time

choices: Scrape food from the bib
Scoop food up from the tray
Head toward the jar held by the woman's immense fingers
Just get higher on the daughter for a later chance
Just get onto the mother for a later chance
132121211211321232311.content:
With your hair rope it is a piece of cake to travel up the girl. First you walk out from under her skirt and climb atop her clothed leg (so she doesn't feel you), and then you dedicate yourself to climbing up her torso, the thick material easy to scale.

Once you're up beyond the tray of the high chair, you get a better picture of what's going on. The girl giggles as her mother looms above, a 'big aeroplane' of a spoon zooming toward her mouth. In the woman's other hand is a jar of apple-flavoured baby food, no surprise.

For you, such a food would be very useful. Soft for the young to eat, it will be easy for a tiny person like you to feed off, whereas adult food would be hard. Baby food is also high in nutrient content, great for survival.

How to get that food, though? The girl is wearing a bib, which has gathered quite a bit of mess that she's dribbled free. You could gather that easily, apart from the need to hang off a vertical surface in the process.

Some has also been splattered onto the tray of the high chair, and you could get that. Of course, it's an otherwise clean white surface, and if that mother saw an insect crawling around near her daughter, you would be annihilated in an instant.

The direct option would be to head for the jar itself, clear of the baby. This will contain its own risks, as you exchange one monster for a greater one: a woman of unmatched godly strength.
132121211211321232311.title: D1:  Beggars Cannot be Choosers

choices: You manage to hold onto the bib.
You're rubbed right into the little girl's mouth!
You're knocked off by the collision, and fall.
You are stuck to the mother's hand
You are left dangling from the girl's chin
1321212112113212323111.content:
For a moment, you consider leaping onto the tray, but you quickly realize the risks involved; if you're spotted by the mother, she could swat you like an insect, and even if she doesn't, that tray's gonna be cleaned eventually. Even if you aren't tossed in the trash, you're likely to end up covered in some sort of cleaning chemicals, and you're not sure what that will do to you at your size.

The good news is that the bib is easy to climb. It's made of terrycloth, and you don't even need to use your hair ropes to help you -- the cloth itself is full of handholds. You quickly scale to about chest level, toward a dollop of applesauce that missed the girl. It's not easy -- every time the girl chuckles, it's like the mountain you're on has an earthquake. But soon enough, you fill two bags -- not bad for a quick haul. Now, you need to....

...but you don't have time. "All gone!" thunders the goddess of a mother, and she leans over her daughter. You hear something tearing -- you realize that it's the velcro holding the bib in place. Then the mom does something horrible.

Well, it's horrible from your perspective. From her perspective she's just efficiently cleaning off her daughter's face with a quick swipe of the bib. Unfortunately, it's the bib that you're on. The girl's face suddenly fills your vision, and the mom rubs you across it....
1321212112113212323111.title: D1: Bibbity bobbity boo

choices: The woman tosses the thing away without looking at it
The woman drops the thing into her palm for immediate inspection
The woman pushes the thing into her pocket to look at later
13212121121132123231112.content:
The applesauce sticks to the wiping bib, gooey as it is. The three-quarter inch man is less sticky, and so as the methodical work of the mighty mother's fingers do their work, you lose your grip.

The daughter giggles at the sheer fun of having her face wiped, and so the mouth opens, at just the right moment to catch you up in it.

The tongue slaps against you in the darkness, a gross, wet monster of a thing, and it likes what it tastes. You have enough applesauce on you to register on these developing tastebuds, and are immediately batted around the mouth.

You collide with something hard, one of the growing teeth rising to prominence in this gummy maw. Now there's blood in her mouth, and the jaw works to open, wondering if your harder-than-applesauce form needs to be bitten open.

Light floods in, and sound with it. "-pen up!" booms the mother. "What is it you've got in there?"

Oh, thank God. You roll onto your stomach, looking out at the concerned face of the goddess. The position of her wrist shows that her finger and thumb are pressed against the sides of the girl's face, and at the peripheries of your vision you can see indentations in the walls of the mouth.

You crawl forward, casting aside your destination - all that matters is getting out of here! You were so lucky to have taken no real damage inside the girl!

Then the fingers of the mother's other hand squeeze into the mouth, filling the space ahead of you are they probe for the unapproved morsel her daughter had been sucking on. One finds you, the sheer power of the skin-covered digit somehow harder than the girl's tooth. The ridged surface scrapes at you for a moment, and its dryness is a welcome respite from the mouth's saliva.

Then the second digit takes you from behind, squeezing you painfully, unstoppably. You scream, but see it from her perspective: she has no reason to suspect any living creature is in her daughter's mouth, and so has no reason to treat you tenderly.

You are pulled forth with the merest effort, clenched tight between two fingers of the giant woman, compressed to the point of bursting. "Anything else?" the voice rumbles, and a handful of seconds pass before attention is paid to fingerful you.

You're no medical doctor, and so can't immediately numerate the injuries you've sustained. But your view of the giant face closing in on you is getting more blurry than ever, and you can taste your own blood. Your limbs don't hurt when you move them, but that's probably only because you can't move them at all under the power of the woman.

No choice for you now: you must respect the woman's decision!
13212121121132123231112.title: D1:  Man for Dessert

choices: a request to be taken back to the library, and your size device
a plea to live with her as a pet
a supplication to be taken to a doctor to be treated
132121211211321232311122.content:
Everything hurts.

The effort of pushing yourself up on hands and knees nearly blacks you out again, but the comforting warmth beneath your palms shocks you enough to look up.

Your expression of shock must be mirrored in that face before you, too massive for you to fully examine. You look down again, your swimming vision identifying the thick channels in the skin of the woman's palm, and then up again, hoping to find some recognition there.

The battering you sustained within her daughter's mouth, followed by the extreme pressure at the fingers of the woman herself, leave you too heavily injured to continue your survival challenge. Certain death is all that awaits you if you continue alone.

Therefore, as the deafening thunder of the woman's words crash into you like a tide of sound, issuing forth from a mouth far vaster than the last, studded with great, gnashing teeth, you steel yourself to answer. Swimming in the afterwash of her warm breath, you struggle to kneel before the goddess who looks down at you, ready to petition her for her aid. A truncated explanation of your situation is your preamble, followed by:
132121211211321232311122.title: D1:  No Longer Self-Sufficient

1321212112113212323111222.content:
You pour your heart out, how you tried to survive in this giant world but were found wanting. You appeal to the sympathies of the giant mother, elaborating on your terror of trying to survive her footsteps, her daughter, the dog and the vacuum cleaner. It's all just too much.

But with her care, and that of her family, you could recuperate from your wounds and live on. And once you're better, you promise, you'll be fiercely loyal to her in gratitude, and you really won't cost much to feed.

She weighs this up for all of a second, then a brilliant smile breaks across her mountain face like the dawn, and she rises to stand above her daughter.

The rest passes in a blur, as she leaves her daughter to tend briefly to your wounds. You are left to lie on a handkerchief on a kitchen counter-top while she goes about her day, and hours later her husband - and father of the girl - comes home, and you are introduced to him, and he to you. He is as willing to help you as his wife, and has an easy-going manner.

Thus, your attempt at tiny survival ends, and instead you live the luxurious life of a three-quarter inch pet to a family of three. You are left to your own devices mostly, but always close to the presence of a giant to look out for you. Having been unable to succeed at getting a second child, the parents treat you almost like a child of their own.

The daughter is kept well clear of you for years, until she is mature enough to be trusted around someone fragile enough to fall apart in her hands. Your relationship varies from squabbling siblings to frustrated owner and pet, but never does it get too antagonistic. Knowing full well your utter inferiority, you are careful not to push her too far.

It's a mundane life, one without a chance for ambition or testing yourself, but at least it is a life.
1321212112113212323111222.title: To Live Only at the Goddess' Pleasure

choices: Loot more stuff from the girl's clothes
Try to extract some stuff from the body of the crib
Climb out and down from the crib to go elsewhere
13212121121132123231113.content:
The terrycloth scrapes at your front as your back is smashed against the clammy flesh of the girl's face. The sudden shock smacks your grip free, and as the bib is withdrawn you don't go with it, instead freefalling directly downward.

"And now it's naptime!" the woman gleefully roars, reaching forward again over her small daughter. The displacement of the air opposes the rising of the toddler as she is lifted from the chair. The combination slams you against the chest of the younger female, and you scrabble wildly to find purchase. The mountain you cling to rises ever higher, and then tilts forward to a large degree as the girl is pulled close to her mother. It's a small impact, but enough to knock you out.

***

You pull your eyes open, and find yourself entangled with the thick cloth of the girl's front. You don't appear to be harmed, and none of your possessions has gone missing. The rising ground beneath you, alongside the constant rumbling roar confirms that the girl is sleeping, so you're safe from being spotted.

Casting your eye upward, you can see bars rising around the body of the sleeping girl, but not the same as the playpen. More than likely this is her crib.

So, where to next?
13212121121132123231113.title: D1:  The Sleep of the Innocent

choices: Get off at the changing table.

The girl sits close to the tray, and so it's merely a hop down from her chest to the surface, and you hurry over to the nearest glob of dropped apple food to begin harvesting.

The nappy-bags (you'll have to come up with a better name) work perfectly, and the otherwise gooey mess is kept together as you tie it up. Soon you have gathered several parcels of food, and they are liquid enough to substitute a little for moisture.

The girl is finished above you as well, as you look up to see the mother wipe a giant napkin across the baby's lips to catch any last stray food. The napkin them swoops down to clear the tray as well, and there's nothing you can do to avoid being swept up with it.

You cling tight to your supplies and tools as the storm washes over you, carrying you back and forth in the woman's irresistible grip. You are scraped harshly, and then wrenched away, and the napkin folds around you, compressed in the fist of a god.

At the centre of the napkin you are not killed, but you are trapped in the thick confines of the paper. You are considering how to fight your way out of this mess when the giantess releases her grip, and your prison freefalls an uncountable distance, your tight confines only just shielding you from full impact.

Knife in one hand, flashlight in the other, you cut yourself free and cast your eye around. There is a faint stench of rot, and weird, damaged structures loom all around you. With the browning skin of a banana down and to your left, you conclude that you've been dropped into the trash.

That means you're trapped, but someone of your resourcefulness should be able to make the best of this situation. There must be plenty of good food and tools in this rubbish mountain!

Or, if you're in a rush to leave, the choice is up or down...
1321212112113212323112.title: D1:  Swept Away

choices: Begin the long trek back toward the house
Strike out for a life on the streets
Stay with the bag to head to the dump
13212121121132123231121.content:
No rush. You're in no immediate danger here, and so you take the time to explore, climbing up and down in this bizarre, vertical world. And, trapped in the corners of yoghurt pots or smeared on chocolate wrappers, you find scraps of food which you eagerly eat to maintain your supplies. Liquid is more scarce, but there is some only just expired milk which you choke down.

This being a kitchen bin, there isn't much in the way of raw materials or tools to utilise, merely disposable wrappers and packets. No great loss; at least this is a place where you can spend the night, and strike out early in the morning.

In fact, you have lost track of time with all the effort you put into clambering around this dark tower! Sleep is not hard to attain,and you wrap yourself up snugly in that great banana skin...

You wake to the world rustling and moving around you. Clearly, it is now bin day, and some great giant in the outside world is carrying your temporary home away to be disposed of. Scrambling to your feet, you gather your possessions, but can do little else as unsure footing leaves you wobbling and losing ground, falling downward uncontrollably...

You hit a surface just as the bag thuds to the ground itself, and you wait a few moments before ripping out your flashlight and knife. A matter of moments has you cut open a hole to peek out into the world.

Sunlight nearly blinds you, but you can see that your bag lies on the side of the road, a long path leading beyond a gate past a garden to the front door of what you presume to be the house you were in. That's a long way to go to get back...

Do you want to get back? You originally chose this path wanting "Urban survival: Shrunk in the city. You will be in a bumpy mess of concrete, living almost exclusively off of the giants above. The environment will consist of dark corridors to massive amounts of hard ground where giants commute. The danger is being super tiny while thousands of people, rich and poor walk to their destinations, not giving a care for the tiny person they may almost step on. Food will be of abundance but competition with insects and animals may force quick acquisition of weapons and craftiness. " Choosing to go into a library flies in the face of that. Now is your chance to recapture your original dream.

Or you could just stick with this bag: it will be taken to the dump, and you've already seen how much bounty a single bag of rubbish holds: you could make a living at the heart of the industry!
13212121121132123231121.title: D1:  A Safe Haven

choices: Run away as fast as you can
Throw away a bag of food to distract it
Dump all your supplies to get more speed
132121211211321232311211.content:
Three quarters of an inch tall, you emerge from the rubbish bag into the bright sunlight, and set your eyes upon the distant house. Well, you had a good night's sleep, so a little exercise won't be too hard. Shouldering your bag of supplies and tools, you stride forward.

A shadow passes over you, and a terrifying screech tears into your world. In the time it takes you to look upward, the bird smashes into the ground ahead of you, its head jerkily regarding you as little more than food.

It towers above you, and will strike in mere moments. What do you do?
132121211211321232311211.title: Day Two: Approaching the House

1321212112113212323112111.content:
You run, putting your all into the sprint, exerting your muscles more than they ever have, tearing through limitations in pursuit of a hopeful escape.

The bird considers the insect for a second before jerking its head down, beak capturing the morsel with minimal effort.

The beak closes around you and the head rises, tilting backward. Trapped, you are thrown back down into the monster's gullet, and a sad ending to your dream of survival.
1321212112113212323112111.title: D2:  A Foolish End

1321212112113212323112112.content:
Ha! That big, dumb bird will stop to snatch up that one bag of applesauce that you tossed over your shoulder while you get away! Strike one up for human ingenuity!

The bird isn't smart, no. But it can tell which of two items is bigger, and calculate that it can snatch you away and still have time to take the smaller satchel later.

That is what it does. The beak ends you almost instantly, but you have enough consciousness to experience every second of agony dissolving in its gut.
1321212112113212323112112.title: D2:  Not Nearly Enough

choices: Climb the stroller again
Cling to the woman's sandal as she walks past
Dig into the fur of the dog
1321212112113212323112113.content:
What good is food if you're not alive to eat it? Shucking off your pack - with all the applesauce, bags and ropes within - you run away, hearing the impact of the bird's beak as it tears into your offering. With any luck, it'll choke on a piece of plastic!

Or, as the case turns out to be, it is all too quickly distracted by the contents of the rubbish bag, allowing you to scuttle under the gate before slowing your pace as you walk u the garden path.

Grass looms on either side, and you keep a healthy distance from either extreme for fear of other predators lurking within. It can't be far up the path, but your three quarter-inch tall self travels slowly.

So slowly in fact, that by the time you are closing on the looming doorstep, and despairing of how to climb it without your rope, another shadow falls over you.

You freeze but turn, - and find yourself in the presence of three beings far, far vaster than that little bird! Pushing the gigantic stroller, the mother has returned home, her monster dog on a lead in her wake. She will soon pull out her keys to enter the house, so you have a little time to grab on to get carried inside!
1321212112113212323112113.title: D2:  All or Nothing

choices: Approach the mother and child.
Go down the hallway.
Head into the kitchen.
13212121121132123231121133.content:
You had time to scale the stroller back in the library; that time is short. And while you could probably hang on to the sandal, any slight shift by the godlike woman could wipe you out.

No, you need to be smart, and smart means taking the safest route. That's the walking carpet full of hairy ropes, ropes you've become accustomed to climbing. You race to the pooch, and though there are a few false starts, you leap and grasp hairs on its hind leg just as the door opens and you bolt inside.

That's the good news -- you make it back inside. The bad news is that the dog, being a dog, rushes into the house without a care in the world, its speed causing you to lose your grip just moments after you make it inside. You groan as you hit a wall and slide down it; you're fortunate that the shrinking process makes you a little bit more durable. You'd never have survived that in real life.

The mom and toddler thunder past you, the mom maneuvering the stroller back into its berth, the toddler walking unsteadily into the living room. You can hear the dog drinking from its bowl off in the distance, and soon the mom joins her kid, laying down next to her and reading a mammoth book.

Well, the first day didn't go so great, but you pick yourself up and dust yourself off, and decide that today is another day. Unfortunately, you don't have the bags made of diaper that you made yourself yesterday, or you'd go try to collect some water. Maybe it's worth it to trek back into the living room and make some more. Or maybe you should head down that massive hallway toward the little girl's room -- there are probably diapers there that aren't being worn that you could use. And maybe there would be useful things in the parents' room as well.

Or maybe you should just go into the kitchen. You could use a drink of water, after all.
13212121121132123231121133.title: D2: Fast and Furry-ous

choices: Get to harvesting from the girl
Scavenge from the woman
Resume your place riding the woman
132121211211321232311211331.content:
You walk casually into the living room, where the massive mother completely blocks your sight of her daughter with her body. Her voice washes across the room: she is quietly talking through the story to the girl, but to a man of your three-quarter inch height it is still a rolling, booming oration.

The story is seemingly about fairies, and the book is probably one picked up from the library yesterday. Trite nonsense written for babies, you try to put it out of your mind as you approach the woman-mountain, as intimidating as ever despite being only half as tall.

She lies on her side, one arm outstretched to keep her torso upright and knees bent to form a surface for her daughter to lean against as both pore over the illustrations of the gigantic tome. Your initial thought had been to approach the child to obtain more bagging material, but now you have the opportunity to instead see what you can harvest from the mature giantess.

You don't have much time though, so perhaps you should merely use this as a chance to once again climb aboard the woman - higher than her hip this time - and allow her to serve as transport, given that walking yourself around the floor of this house is really going to eat up time.
132121211211321232311211331.title: D2:  Storytime

choices: Get more baby food
Try for adult chow
Live a nomadic life at ground level
1321212112113212323112113311.content:
The material you harvested previously was perfectly adequate, and would have served you a long time had you not been so foolish as to lose it. If you were to try for some other substance, you have no proof that it would even be as good, and may well be worse.

So you'll stick with sacks made of nappy, and just alter your behaviour to survive better. You won't get caught out and thrown into the trash this time!

The mother-mountain is imposing, but she remains still. You stalk carefully across the rough terrain of the living room carpet, coming up quickly enough to the woman's denim-clad butt. Sparing only a moment to whistle as you marvel at its height, you scuttle around her legs, quite a diversion as you follow her bent knees to crest around the mighty heels and wiggling, bare toes. They're no threat really, but the simple movements of each of those muscled behemoths still sets your survival instincts on edge; the woman remains a threat, enough power in her smallest extremity to destroy you.

She's still overall though, a steadfast rock for her daughter as she reads through the trite tale. It's as you step around those feet that you see the danger of the moment: her daughter laughs at points in the story, gently kicking out with her legs and smashing them onto the ground with frightful power. In the macro-world, those are small gestures on behalf of the toddler, but your three-quarter inch height finds her motions catastrophic. The feet on the end of those legs are diminutive, a third at most the mass of her mother's. Yet they still ram down onto the carpet with a surface area greater than you can cover in a few seconds, and with a random, unpredictable rhythm.

At the origin point of those limbs is your goal though, and so you proceed further, hugging close to the comforting form of the titan mother, whose solid presence emboldens you. Let the girl lash out, while you remain safe in the shadow of the true power of this house! Your confidence only grows as you crest the feet, proceeding back up the shins to the knees, where the girl leans.
