So, you step away from the goddess to venture onto her daughter's skirt, and to the distasteful area. It smells clean - or rather, doesn't stink to high heaven - so you set to with your blade again, repeating the process of slicing out a few sacks. You have more time than yesterday as well, with enough warning from the tone of the story that echoes like thunder. You have half a dozen sacks, good to stash food, water and more!

Now to fill them. Yesterday, you got it filled quickly but were caught out. Should you stick with the daughter again, and try to salvage her food? Or should you transfer to the adult? Her feeding habits will be less predictable, and she will be much less likely to spill any for you to gather, but the sheer aura of comfort that she's exuded should make it a calmer experience.

Or you could strike out on your own, content to scavenge scraps from the floor and remove the whims of giant gods from your survival equation.
1321212112113212323112113311.title: D2:  Tried and Trusted

choices: Cling to the woman and follow her
Head down to the peach-sauce jar
Find the perfect position on the young giantess
13212121121132123231121133111.content:
From the timbre of the mother's words, you can tell how close she is getting to the end of the story, and begin to extricate yourself from under the girl's skirt. There's plenty of time to gather more hair-rope - invaluable for any climbing! Avoiding the still-lively leg once again, you use the skirt's surface as a guide, and once you reach its edge you continue, climbing up it until you are walking along the girl's lap.

The story reaches its happily ever after, and an apocalypse sounds above you. You flinch and look up, to see that it's just the girl clapping her hands together in glee, with enough force to explode you into goo.

With a shudder, you grab tight to the clothing, and not a moment too soon - the mother reaches down, an epic show of strength lifting the mammoth child into the air and twirling her. Such a simple, innocent act, and to you it's like the world is collapsing into chaos.

Still, you struggle upwards as the mother relents and carries her daughter into the kitchen again, to place her in the high chair for feeding. This should be a mere repetition of what happened yesterday, but with the turbulent movements of the giants around you, it's a nerve-wracking adventure every step of the way!

With determination and deadened fears, you pull yourself above the shadow of the great shelf of the chair, midway up the chest of the girl, whose every breath distorts your climb, making a risky cliff into an obstacle almost wilfully trying to throw you off.

So, last time you tried the tray and were swept away. Maybe here, higher up, you will be able to gather baby food without being so inconvenienced.

As if in answer to your thought, a loud impact below turns out to be the woman placing an open jar of food on the tray, plastic spoon leaning against it. The large picture on the side shows a peach - you're not picky for flavours right now.

Then those tremendous arms reach up and past you, tying a vast bib around the girl's neck. Her forearm rests dangerously close to you, sheer power sheathed in flimsy silk.

Another sound, high pitched and rhythmic - the doorbell. The woman is about to rise to go and answer, and now you have a choice.

You could take this brief moment to jump for the mother's forearm, to let her carry you away, to see who's at the front door. Or you could take advantage of her absence to climb across to the chair shelf, and scoop as much food from the jar while it's unattended.

Or, you could stick with the plan you have, and manoeuvre yourself to a good position on the baby's body to harvest food when it is dispensed.
13212121121132123231121133111.title: D2: We've Been Here Before

choices: Go With the Postie
Break into the Box
Hang Around for Food
132121211211321232311211331111.content:
The one wild card in this situation, the one thing you can't predict, and also the most powerful being in the room, is the mother. It was her that swept you into the rubbish yesterday, and today you shudder to think what may happen if you go climbing around the daughter or toward that jar in her absence: what will she do when she gets back? You may not be so lucky as to survive today!

So instead you swiftly transfer across to the woman's forearm, careful to clutch tight to her clothes and not get her attention by touching her skin.

In a moment, you are whirled away, up and around in a motion more terrifying even than when the daughter was being swung in the air. At least then you were upright; now you are pendulumed back and forth at the goddess' side as she strolls casually to the front door. At every one of her footsteps, each time that her wrist reaches its upward peak, you swear that you're going to plunge off and to your doom.

Somehow, miraculously, you do not drop. No, you dig your fingers deep into the thick, silky material of the blouse, and tell the heavens that nothing will stop you from surviving. Nothing.

At the last, you're nearly undone when the journey stops. The arm comes up higher than before, and while you prepare yourself for the usual backswing, its continuation of motion twirls one of your hands loose, leaving you dangling.

The arm freezes in place, and you look along the arm above you to its terminus at the hand, the crushing fingers applying themselves to the handle, wrenching open a monumental doorway and ushering in a dazzling sunlight.

"Package for you," announces the newly revealed goddess, backlit but still clearly dressed as a postal worker. She proffers a gigantic box, and your host swings up both her own hands to accept it, taking you along for the ride once again.

Here you have another choice - if you've had enough of this household, you could take the moment of contact as an opportunity to scuttle across to the postwoman, and accompany her on the rest of her day.

Or you could just climb across to the box - the woman is sure to return to feeding her daughter once the transaction is done, and while she's thus occupied you could explore the package to see what resources you can scavenge.

Lastly, you could stick to your constant plan, and remain on the woman's arm as she goes back to feeding that monster girl, and thereby collect your daily food rations.
132121211211321232311211331111.title: D2: Going Postal?

choices: Get delivered to another house
Stick with the postal worker
Get off this ride now for the larger world
1321212112113212323112113311111.content:
You've had enough of this damn family already. Better to venture off with this valiant delivery-woman, and see a wider array of possibilities!

New hope rising within you, you bring your second hand up to grab tight, hauling your pathetic bodyweight upwards on the mother's arm. You scramble eagerly, shimmying across to the brown surface of the parcel, and jumping across to it. The surface bobs as it transitions between goddesses, but you hit the ground running, sprinting flat-out toward the distant, blurry mass of the postie even as the package is drawn towards the mammoth bosom of the recipient.

She hasn't backed off yet, and you spring through the air, arms pedalling furiously, eager to grasp any surface to arrest your descent. You slap against the rough surface of the postal uniform, your three-quarter inch form easily gripping the thick threads.

Thunder above as pleasantries are exchanged, and then the cliff-face to which you cling lurches away, and you're left to ponder your next move.

You have your starting gear, as well as a supply of sacks and ropes from the house. Still no food or liquid. This glorious woman is to take you door to door, and you will have your choice of places to stay. Of course, most homes won't be receiving parcels, so you'll be left just with the slot where the letters go as an entry point. Not so hot.

Why not stay with this postal worker until the end of her day, and see how she lives? Can't be much left to her round now.

Or, you wonder, looking out at the majesty of nature as she strolls down the road, you could climb down her and try living in the true outside , away from frightful human contact...
1321212112113212323112113311111.title: Out Into the World

choices: Slice into the brown paper covering
Slit a parting in the tape
Leave it and go to recover from your wound
1321212112113212323112113311112.content:
Whenever there's been a choice between taking the money and opening what's in the mystery box - not that you've ever been in that literal situation - you've always gone for the unknown. This box could contain any number of things - rare food or drink, a construction of exotic materials or merely something very, very pretty.

You've already convinced yourself by the time you grab your free hand into the surface of the blouse sleeve and haul yourself up. No rush here, so you wait as the parcel transitions fully into the care of the mother - the mighty monster sagging with the weight, impressive in itself - and squat on top her wrist.

Watching the path ahead - once the door has been closed - past the immensity of her thumb, you see the living room table approach, and transition to the brown paper wrapping as the package begins to lower.

Thunder erupts as the box impacts upon the table surface, and the woman's wrist clips your back as she withdraws, brief contact bruising you. She's gone before you can even turn to look, returning to feeding her daughter in the kitchen.

Medical resources are something else you should have thought about - it's pretty likely that at points in your survival expedition you'll sustain injury.

For now, you'll have to make your pain worthwhile, and extract all that you can from this factory-sized box.

It is covered in brown paper, thick tape securing it in place. Underneath, there is no doubt tough cardboard. Do you think your trusty survival blade is enough to cut through such immense defences, and are you confident that the rewards will be worth the cost? You've already taken a nasty bash, and your knife can't be guaranteed to get through this unscathed.
1321212112113212323112113311112.title: D2:  Hopefully Not Gwyneth Paltrow's Head

choices: Get water from the sink when the jar is claened
Climb down to get water from the dog bowl
Wait for the woman to get some drink herself
1321212112113212323112113311113.content:
Your fingers regain their place, and you heave yourself into a more secure position for the journey back to the kitchen. The arm remains clear as the front door is closed - given a nudge by her humongous ass - and she caries the box into the living room. Ample time for you to work your way to her wrist, in preparation for stage two of your plan.

The box thuds down, the goddess rises, and the arms swing again. You are steady and secure, even if disorientation still dizzies you. But then the great hand at the end of this arm reaches out, plucking up the jar of peach baby food ready for its partner to begin scooping with the spoon.

By this time, you're atop the wrist, and inching your way toward that welcoming source of nourishment. The fact that you haven't been swatted off proves one of your assumptions correct: the act of feeding her daughter is so familiar to this woman that she doesn't even need to look down at the jar when she scoops food from it. Her eyes are concentrating wholly on her daughter, the spoon on autopilot.

Thus, you can scamper across her wrist, the pulsing flesh beneath you, and brace between finger and thumb to scoop as much food as you can into your welcoming sacks. Every now and then you must pause as a great plastic spoon descends, removing in a stroke masses of gunk greater than your entire body. Unwilling to be taken to feed the god-child, you remain in place until it has left, and then resume scavenging.

You are careful not to get too greedy, to repeat your mistakes of yesterday. As you wrap the sacks up tight with hair, you are already considering the next step of your plan.

Water.

The jar will probably be washed up in the sink, so one simple step would be jump with it when the woman takes it there, and gather what water you can.

The dog is probably finished its own drink now, and there should be enough for you still, so you could climb down to the ground.

Or you could stick with the woman, and wait for an opportunity that you hadn't predicted to reveal itself.
1321212112113212323112113311113.title: D2: Let's Try That Again

choices: Grab the dog to explore the back garden
Grab the woman to view the back garden
Press on to gather your water
13212121121132123231121133111132.content:
The moment the wrist lowers to the woman's side - to her hip - you jump across to the main body. Soon she'll be cleaning up, carrying her daughter and all manner of other activities that would be risky for a tiny passenger.

Now burdened by several sacks filled with nutritious peach-flavoured goo, you can't just go leaping around like an acrobat, and your transfer is more like a controlled fall. You throw out a rope as you let go of the wrist, and snag one of many stray strands of denim jutting from the sheer surface of the woman's leg.

Braced, you hardly feel the impact as you collide with the immensity, and slowly begin the descent. The rope is actually less reliable than the plentiful and thick handholds offered by the rough surface of these jeans, and soon you are slowly climbing down by jamming your feet and fingers into gaps between threads, feeling all too well the warmth pulsing from the powerful flesh beneath.

When she inevitably walks, it's not so difficult to keep from falling. She steps slowly, and doesn't have much distance to cover. No hard task to remain still as her muscles work up, hefting the whole forward with a lurch and a thunder. Once she's still again, you resume your descent.

So, it's slow progress, and when you reach the open space between the bottom of the jeans and the floor - where the bare expanse of her ankle and foot fills your world - you have to play out another line and scurry down it, for if she were to walk now you would be kicked for sure.

Yet luck holds, and while you're down a couple of ropes, you find hair enough to replace within seconds of hustling away from the titan woman, through carpet toward the kitchen once again.

Just as you though yourself clear though, there is a cacophonous bark, and the monster dog lopes into view. It is greeted with words from the woman, who turns to face it, one foot swinging dangerously close to you before coming down to flatten so very much of your immediate world.

"You wanna play outside?"

This could be a chance! While your last journey with the dog-beast was less than pleasant, a chance to explore the back garden would be interesting. Who knows what manner of plants may be available there for you to partake in? Unable to open the door yourself, you'll only get opportunities when the gods deem it time!

The woman is still close - and your rope still attached - so you could instead grab onto her as she heads to the back door, although she may not step outside herself, leaving you with a lot of effort for no reward. Unless merely the intel from seeing outside is reward enough in your opinion?

Then again, this makes a trip to the water bowl even easier, removing the dog from the equation entirely!
13212121121132123231121133111132.title: D2: Stay On Target

choices: Construct a camp on the stroller
Construct a camp nearby but not on the stroller
Leave camping for now and go out and about
132121211211321232311211331111323.content:
Ignoring the giantess and her pet behind you, it is quiet as you trek on to the massive, plastic structure across the room, your back bent under the weight of the food you have already acquired. Perhaps, you think, there would be some merit in building some manner of stroller for yourself, to make ferrying large loads easier? When you have time, you should look into developing such an aid.

The dog bowl looms above like a miniature volcano, but you scale it simply enough with the aid of your ropes, and similarly abseil down to its main depression, wherein the scattered pools of water are easy prey to your gathering. After lapping up your own fill, splashing your face into the bargain, you wrap up several waterskins and climb back out.

Base camp beta - aka the stroller - lies not too distant, and under even heavier weight than before you continue your pilgrimage. The vehicle is carefully placed out of the way in the corner, and you have plenty of time to look over the best place to store your supplies. There are plenty of pieces of damage that would be invisible to the human eye - tears in the fabrics, dents in the metal and plastic. Looking over the whole structure you find a small cubby hole: a flap of fabric hanging low. You can secure your bags there with your ropes, and being on the underside they will not be crushed by anything the giants place in the main compartment.

Now, where to store yourself? Should you set up your sleeping place on the stroller, with the risk that it could be taken at any time? Or should you camp somewhere more permanent, albeit further from the supplies? Or should you leave that for now, and make good use of these remaining hours of daylight to see if anything else about this house can be used?
132121211211321232311211331111323.title: D2: Only a Day Late

choices: Go with the woman and stroller
Stay at home and explore
1321212112113212323112113311113232.content:
No, with all the lifting, carrying and running you've done today, climbing up so high once again doesn't sound like a good idea. No, best you bed down right now, get as much sleep as you can.

Near the skirting board there are great clods of dust, a reassuring sight: clearly the vacuum cleaner doesn't get pushed this far! They serve as nice padding too, and you wrap up warmly in its embrace. At your size, it's not so fine as to bother your breathing so much.

The house is noisy around you, with the mother and the dog moving around, joined in a couple of hours by her husband, the man of the house. Yet none of them ventures near to your spot, and your exhaustion from a day of hard work is such that you drift off to a well-earned rest, and dreams of being hunted by a great bird.

Sleeping indoors, in a well-tended home, is a good start. You have a supply of food and water, and have finally reached a level of sufficiency to keep yourself alive for a little while.

Morning breaks when the thunderous tread of the woman closes on your position, and you open eyes to see her immense feet standing near the stroller. Must be time for her morning walk, daughter in tow. Do you want to go with her, or remain to explore the house while you're alone? It would be the first opportunity to scout the terrain with no risk from giant interference.
1321212112113212323112113311113232.title: D2: A Well-Earned Respite

choices: Climb the kitchen counter
Return to the living room
Go looking for the bedrooms
13212121121132123231121133111132322.content:
No, you freeze where you are, allowing the gargantuan woman to plant her feet seismically, rolling the colossal stroller back with thunder. The still-terrifying toddler awkwardly stomps across the kitchen floor, and you feel pure awe as the monster is lifted from the ground by her mother. A kiss is given, and then the child is fastened in her seat.

The next terror is the dog Posey, barking in excitement for her impending walk, a storm of devastation before your eyes. A word from the woman brings the dog to a sudden stop, hind legs dropping to a sitting position . A lead is clipped to the collar, and then the three giants leave before your stunned eyes, the door slamming shut behind them like the end of days.

Silence, for probably the first time since you got to this house. Tentatively, you stroll out into the greater area of the god kitchen, planning out how to take advantage of having the house to yourself.

Firstly, you don't know how long they'll be gone for - this morning you have no idea how long they had been gone for before they got back. So, every second counts. Given your tiny size, you'll more than likely only have time to get to wherever you're going, and have to hang tight to do actual scavenging when humans are back.

For example, there's food just for the taking atop these kitchen counters, or the cupboards even further above them. Yet to scale those heights will take more than just your hair ropes, and it's a sheer surface.

In that time, you could relocate to another area of the house - and the further away, the less time you'll have before being disturbed. The cavernous living chamber is right next door, but after your previous cursory inspection - and the vacuum cleaning that followed it - is there anything worth looking for?

Further in are unexplored lands: bed- and bathrooms. Wonders indeed, but quite the trek.
13212121121132123231121133111132322.title: D3: Left to Your Own Devices

choices: Stay in place and react to the situation as it develops
Hide behind one of the towers
Drop down onto the cupboard door, well below her eyeline
132121211211321232311211331111323221.content:
There's food up there. Something that isn't peach-flavoured baby goo. So what if it's a sheer climb? The effort will be worth it.

Of course, your hair ropes have nothing to loop onto to allow you to climb, so to get yourself started you have to hack at the base of the counter with your weapon, get some decent climbing holes. You pull yourself up the painful feet - to you, anyway, in reality fractions of an inch! - until you reach the overhang where the doors of the cupboard built into the counter end. Of course, opening those doors would be like prying the gates of Heaven open with a toothpick, so all they are to you now is another surface to climb.

Luckily, these sections are more pitted and scarred, and you can secure your rope to a tiny fragment of wood splinter that no mighty human eye would possibly detect.

You laugh to yourself as you swing out over the abyss. Already you're thinking of 'them' as being human, and yourself as something so much the lesser. Only two days ago you were one of those gargantuans, and now you're already thinking of them as impossible obstacles rather than former peers.

Climbing to the base of the door, you can look up and see many more scattered holes in the surface, cratered like the surface of the moon. A bodged-together grappling hook and line sinks in above, a tug to make sure it can hold your weight.

Each such swing and climb drains yet more of your energy, aching muscles protesting as you drag yourself up further and further. The simple handle of this door stands out to your left like a plateau, and you clamber across to it for a little rest, lying on your back as the spool rope in your hands again. God, but this had better be worth it.

The handle means the halfway point of the door, and after your near-nap from exhaustion you haul yourself upright again, almost staggering into the wall. But you must press on, spinning, throwing and pulling taut again and again, hauling your puny weight ever upward until finally you slump onto the shelf at the top of the door, just a final few inches to the counter-top itself.

Yet you can't make that last push just yet, instead grunting at the lactic acid burning through your muscles. This simple counter, waist-high to the gods of this world, is nearly insurmountable. There may be food at the top, a reward from the gods, but the effort you've put into it will be greater still.

You have to make it all worthwhile. Staggering to your feet, you send the last hair rope up to the very edge of the counter, and the last, longest inch-climb begins. You have no time to luxuriate in reaching the summit when you get there, treating yourself to the third and longest rest of all. Above, you see the distant ceiling, even further above you than the floor is below. And this new world is just the most mundane of environments.

You sit up, laughing as you take in the landscape: a mound that can only be a bread-bin, behind towers that hold salt, pepper and all manner of other condiments. Far distant to your right sits another precipice, above which monolithic water taps loom. Fallen towers end in gleaming, razored metal, knives that put your little needle to shame. Bins and boxes of cereal and rice, and an upended dome holding fruit bigger than houses. A golden goose and a magic harp, and it may have been worth climbing that beanstalk.

Now, where to start, where to start? You have several bags, and several possible sources of nutrition, but there are non-food options as well.

Then the death-knell sounds, as the front room crashes open, signalling the return of the goddess and her daughter, doggie in tow. What had been silence is shattered by their return, and you stand up in panic, eyes darting for somewhere to hide. In moments she has crossed into the kitchen, scooping her immense child up into her arms. "Time for lunch!" she announces, stomping closer.

She'll have to put the baby down somewhere first, and that buys you moments. Moments for you to hide from her. There's the terror of her potentially finding you, but also possibilities opened up by her making available resources that you otherwise would have found inaccessible. What do you do?
132121211211321232311211331111323221.title: D3: Climbing the Beanstalk

choices: Make a peace offering to the beast and continue your life here.
Gather as much as you can and find the fastest way out to the yard.
Tough it out, dogs have short memories.
1321212112113212323112113311113232211.content:
There was little reason to hide like an insect. It was extremely unlikely that the busy giantess would notice a bug sized person with all the clutter on the kitchen counter, and what with her other duties. In fact you were quite amused by the situation. Since you had met this family you had been consistently at their feet. Now, for the first time since you'd shrunk, you got to look down on two of the monsters, the toddler and the dog. You approached the edge of the counter, taking in this amusing sight, and getting the lay of the land in general.

You pull out your journal and make notes of the patterns of the giants, this knowledge would no doubt be very helpful and could mean the difference between life and death in the future. However, as you observed this average family, something occurred you hadn't considered.

Posey, the immense Husky, finally noticed you. When you had been on the ground Posey ignored the little bug. It didn't smell interesting, and Posey wasn't the kind of dog to take interest in such insignificant things. But now, on the counter, something the god dog associated with yummy foods, the creature felt you were now worth investigating.

You are so distracted with observing the human giants, you didn't notice the dogs approach until the last minute. Suddenly your brain's logic center seized control again, and you realized that you weren't as safe up here as you'd arrogantly assumed. This was a giant's world after all.

You stumble back from the edge, turning to run towards the wall behind the counter. You briefly fall as you are gathering your supplies on the run. The delay probably wouldn't have mattered, due to your slow speed with your reduced legs, but it seals your fate. Suddenly, two massive gray paws, attached to long gray and white legs slam down on either side of you. In the macro world, it was probably a few inches to either side, but it rocks you nonetheless. Shit. Your senses innately pick up the presence of the immense being behind you, to which these legs are attached to. Slowly turning, you are rendered in awe of creature staring down its great nose at you. Judging you, like a god of old would judge a follower.

The husky's great head cocks to the side, it clearly doesn't understand what you are. You are the weirdest looking bug its seen, looking more like one of the toys the child plays with. It lowered its head towards the creature, intent on gathering further information.

The slow but inevitable movement of the giant dogs head makes you want to scream and run. But you know that's guaranteed death right there. You have to hope the creature simply loses interest and moves on, leaving you to your adventure, which was going pretty roughly. Still, your hand reaches slowly to your downsized machete. It was a final, last ditch option should this encounter turn ugly. For now, you observe the large black nose getting closer, sniffing intently and creating a bit of suction that also messes with your hair. Behind it, two massive ice blue eyes seem to stare straight through you. It's humbling what power this creature has over you, and the whole of the micro world.

The bug/toy creature smelled of the home, and of humans. It was so confusing to Posey. She couldn't decide what to do about this little intruder. It clearly wasn't a threat, but what actually was it? Was it food? It was on the counter after all, but Posey didn't eat bugs. Nevertheless, having exhausted the information from all her other sense, she finally decided to go with the last one, taste.

The head had retracted somewhat, as the beast clearly processed the information she was gathering on you. You were taking small, unnoticeable steps backward, trying to gain some distance in case of immediate escape. But you had made no more than an inch or so progress, when the head began lowering again towards you. A massive pink tongue briefly flickered across the muzzle of the husky. Looks like you were about to be tasted. That wouldn't do. If she liked what she tasted, there was no chance you'd survive her maw. The nose directly above you, the tongue darted out, but you were ready. You jabbed directly into the oncoming muscle, stopping it dead in its tracks, as the a loud yelp filled your ears briefly. Retracting its head swiftly, more in shock than actual pain, the animal descended to the floor below. Even up on the counter you could fill the impact. You take off, sprinting for cover. Your "sting" will only last mere moments, and you are certain that a now very pissed off husky will want vengeance on the offending insect. You do feel pretty boss though, the whole experience felt like a scene out of God of War. The "boss" recovers quickly though, rising back up to its former spot, but you are now out of range of the angry god beast. It barks at you nonetheless, causing you to fall to the ground and cover your ears. Its so loud and intense. Several barks later and the master of the terrible beast makes herself known.

"SHUT UP POSEY, QUIET GIRL!" echoes around you. Seems the giantess has had enough of this. She approaches the counter, briefly glancing toward what Posey could be barking at inside the house. She sees only the cans and other items normally on her counter. "SILLY GIRL, THAT'S PEOPLE FOOD, YOU KNOW YOU CAN'T HAVE THAT." Risking a glance, you see the midriff of the giantess towering over the counter, and the dog, which doesn't seem quite so big now that she's made her presence known. With a display of strength almost terrifying to witness, the woman grabs the dogs collar, and drags her down to the ground below, scolding the whole time. She's the true master of this domain. Still, the immediate danger has passed, and you can get back to scavenging. Still, you worry that the dog which has ignored you up to this point now will have it out for you. A formidable enemy that can pick up even your tiny scent, hunt you down, and exterminate you. Maybe staying in this house isn't an option anymore. Maybe you should gather what you can and leave as soon as possible. Maybe back to the library, maybe not. Just away from the beast. Or, you COULD try to survive here. Maybe you can make peace with the creature. You had found that a bit of cold chicken could calm the most aggressive of dogs. And there was some, not far away on the counter...
1321212112113212323112113311113232211.title: Stay in place and react to the situation as it ...

choices: You're square, live and let live and get back to adventuring.
She's delighted by the gift, you made a friend for life!
Nowhere near good enough, time to pay for your crime.
13212121121132123231121133111132322111.content:
God this was idiocy. You'd just escaped with your life, and now here you were, hacking at a piece of chicken to offer to the beast who almost ended it. Sigh. If you wanted to continue living here, among this family, you were gonna have to be at peace with the family guardian. The larger the offering, the likelier of success, as you hacked out a piece about the size of you. You smirked, a chicken was now a creature that could end you without effort. You were much lower on the food chain at this point.

At your reduced size, you did notice you had superior strength. With a you sized piece now available, you put away your machete and lifted the chicken onto your back. The mother and child had left, you had no idea where. Across the kitchen floor was the husky, sitting calmly on the ground, a towel underneath, the woman had hooked up the great beast to a leash, tied to a knob on the nearby door. Approaching the edge, you tossed your token of friendship off the side, and proceeded to make your long way down. Fortunately the same imperfections that made for handholds on the way up, worked just as well on the way down.

Reaching the bottom you quickly reacquired the chicken. No one was in the kitchen, but you didn't know how long that would last. Hoisting the chicken once again on your back, you began the long journey. Only once does the giantess pass by the entrance to the kitchen, but does not enter it. Her massive footfalls reverberate through the tiles under your feet. A mountain of power, so far away, and yet for her, so close. You continue under the central table, growing ever closer to your goal. Only now, does what your planning to do start to enter your mind. Are you an idiot? You were about to voluntarily reintroduce yourself to an animal a hundred times your size, that had a bone to pick with you. You should be hiding in a hole, not walking towards it. A part of you reckoned that it might have something to do with your old life. In that one, you weren't afraid of a dog, and you reasoned that maybe some of that carried over to your small self. That didn't change that you were being dumb. Pushing the thoughts behind you and hoping for the best, you carried forward out of the shadow of the table. The husky's head turned toward you. It had spotted you...

Posey had sensed the creature, but had not spotted it until it left the shadow of the table. Angry thoughts about the pain it had caused flooded through her mind. But she did not rise to bark. The creature was approaching her, slowly but steadily. She smelled a familiar delicious scent. Chicken!

The mega beast gazed down at you, similar to its treatment of you when you were nothing but a curious insect in its eyes. You were almost within its leash range. Last chance to back out. You looked up at the silent god. It was not mindlessly trying to get at you, it wasn't gnawing at the leash. It just sat there, in a U shape, staring at you. "Here goes" you muttered to yourself, causing the husky's ears to perk up. What senses! You crossed the threshold into what had to be the dog's range. No reaction. Just the silent judgement. Unnerving. You wished you could read minds as you came closer and closer to its chest, enveloped on all sides by the creature's mass. Maybe then you'd know if you had a future. The machete was pointless here, it was only its will that mattered. Humbling.

You thought back to your earlier encounter, how it felt like a scene from a video game, or a callback to the legends of the old world. A god judging the lesser creature's offering. You slid the chicken off your back, and slowly backed up, dropping to your knees a few feet away from your offering. O please o please, kept ringing through your head.

Posey gazed down at the tiny creature that had the temerity to harm her. It was so small, so weak. Nonetheless her nose picked up what it was carrying, and leaned in. The small creature jumped back a few paces as her snout approached, but no matter. She lapped up the chicken, so good! Smacking her lips a little at the small bite, good but hardly filling, she then regarded the little insect once more.

Watching something as large as you be lapped up by the dog monster like it was nothing had sent fear through your little body. Now the husky stared down her nose at him once again. You stared down, not brave enough to meet its face. The final judgement started now.
13212121121132123231121133111132322111.title: Make a peace offering to the beast and continue...

choices: Climb the kitchen counter
Set up on the stroller
Explore the house for other solutions
Appeal to the goddess for her (unknowing) protection
Give up on this house and go outside
132121211211321232311211331111323221113.content:
Oh no. That deep rumbling is the growl of this canine colossus - she's not happy! Clearly, such a tiny morsel was insufficient to placate her, and you need to be out of here post-haste.

Posey rises as she stands, a moment of movement that buys you the time you need to get out of her reach, and then be blown across the room at the force of her jaws snapping shut. She barks, the blasts of her wrath keeping you pinned down and covering your ears, before a bigger threat puts her into perspective.

The family matriarch storms back into the kitchen, her feet raising furious impacts as she once more admonishes the dog. Just over this, thanks to the higher pitch, you can make out the crying of the child in the next room - upset the kid, make the mother angry.

"THAT'S IT - OUTSIDE!"

FIghting through the din, the shaking ground and the breeze of macro-movements you witness the woman unleash Posey and drag her to the back door, opening it and removing the dog from sight. You shake your head at the sudden peace, broken only by the siren call of the wailing toddler. The chicken idea may not have worked, but looking back, trying to live outside instead would be worse - the dog could get you even more easily out there!

The woman returns, wiping her sandals on the kitchen mat before closing the door and removing them. She then strides over you once more to quiet and reassure her child, and you are left to consider the fallout.

With a hostile dog, there's no way you can live anywhere near ground level. There are a number of alternatives that present themselves for you to think over while the dog remains outside. The obvious one is to climb back up where you just came from, the kitchen counter. Plenty of food up there, for sure. You can find somewhere to camp, and only have to remember to get aboard when the next library visit rolls around.

You could always just make a permanent base on the stroller, with the downside there being your isolation from any source of food.

This might be a good time to look into exploring the house, to find another room to spend the week. The question is, will you make it to safety before the dog gets back inside?

Looking out at the archway passing to the rest of the house, the crying baby has been replaced by a calming shush noise, the giantess displaying the gentle, maternal side of her nature in contrast to the wrath and power when the dog crosses her. You could make a pilgrimage to the foot of this goddess, and climb onto her to gain immunity from the doggy threat. Stowing away on a normal-size person can't be a permanent solution, but it'll do for now.

Otherwise, you'll have to leave this place, get out through the front door and stay in exile from Posey's domain. Maybe you could hitch a ride to the library in a few days, perhaps you'll merely adapt to pure outside tiny survival; you can think that out once you pass the near-insurmountable problem of the door itself...
132121211211321232311211331111323221113.title: Life's A Bitch

choices: Go see what crumbs have been left
Stay in place and write
Head off to scout the terrain
1321212112113212323112113311113232212.content:
You scuttle quickly away from the counter-edge, past the outlying, errant monoliths of food preparation. A shiny metal structure, akin to modern art bigger than a house, provides ample shelter as you duck under it.

Ignoring the thunderous movements of the woman, somewhere behind you, going about the business of making lunch for herself and her child, you look around. The metal bars above you are spaced equally, curving in an arc that is just part of a row of similar constructions, supported by occasional offshoots. It's... a toast-rack?

Yet held within those firm prongs are not colossal pieces of roasted bread, but far thinner, less nutritious pale slices. Paper? Looks like this family is just using the toast rack to hold their mail. Craning your neck to one side, you can make out the gigantic words printed on one surface, an address and a name:

Sarah Gillespie

Looks like you finally know the name of the goddess that has been helping and hindering you for the last day. She and her husband deserve your thanks, and should definitely get a mention in your memoirs of this experience.

Yes, seeing these words has reminded you of the journal you planned to keep, to relay your experiences to the greater world, to show people how much the world can be improved by people belittling themselves. Up to this point, you've had too much on your mind to think about it, let alone start writing it! You hadn't thought about it since Chapter 2...

Your notebook and pen are still in your pocket, but you slash a few pieces from the envelope above you to provide some more writing material. No need to pass up a chance for more materials.

Looking back, you see the shadow of Sarah pass away, as she walks back to the kitchen table to begin eating. Now would be a chance to run over and see what crumbs she left behind from making those sandwiches. Unless you want to keep out of her way a little longer, maybe wait until she is out of the room first; you could use that time to write your journal, but she may clean up after herself in that time, removing resource opportunities.

Then again, what need have you of her leftovers? Atop this counter, you could explore some more, see what you can find just on this mountain. You could, at the very least, get an idea of the lay of the land for future exploration.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212.title: D3:  A Name to Put to a Face

choices: Go get some bread
Seek out some tomato
Scramble for some chicken
13212121121132123231121133111132322121.content:
No, you can leave the documentation until this evening, when you settle down to rest.

So, you move out from under the toast-rack-cum-post-rack, and see Sarah's back turned to you, a lumbering mountain. In the foreground, you can see the remains of her breakfast preparations, and faint hints of the scents reach your tiny, ineffective nose.

To your left, the breadboard is dominated by a gleaming knife, a terrifying length of steel surrounded by fist-sized crumbs and a ragged cliffface of loaf.

Ahead, the juice of a tomato oozes across a plastic cutting board, scattered with seeds and the hemispherical offcut like a shiny, red hill. There's some green lettuce there as well, a canopy of monstrous plantfood.

And to the right, a towering construction of clear plastic, a tupperware tub with chunks of cold chicken. The lid lies off to one side, a single armslength to the woman, considerably further to one such as you. Still, no lid means you could climb up there and get some of that sweet meat.

In fact, you have three different sources of food that you could scavenge from...
13212121121132123231121133111132322121.title: D3: Correcting the Calculations

choices: Jump onto the woman
Climb back to the ground
Explore the counter more
132121211211321232311211331111323221211.content:
For all its size, the bread-knife isn't that intimidating. It goes beyond being a sharp blade, and you can't even comprehend it being used as such. It's easy to merely regard it as a piece of the landscape, ignoring the massive edifice as you head for the bread.

The main loaf looms higher than a house, so you content yourself with gathering up scraps from the crust and crumbs that lie scattered about the landscape. You stuff them as swiftly as you can into your bag, knowing that you don't have long before Sarah returns.

Indeed, before you even know it the giantess rises from her meal, and sets to tidying. She effortlessly scoops up the tupperware containter with the chicken, bearing it away to a distant home. Time to get out of here! And so you're sprinting for the edge even as the woman returns, next throwing her godlike power into taking the chopping board to dispose of the tomato waste. You are well clear of the bread area by the time she turns her attention there, one hand retrieving the blade, while the other lifts the board itself.

You watch in awe as the bread-knife scrapes across the board, brushing the crumbs into a distant bin. And, just like that, there's no evidence there was ever a festival ground's worth of food spread out before you on this kitchen counter.

Well, the bread you've gathered should last. You have several clumps of it in your bags, and while it may dry it'll remain edible for some time to a man your three-inch height. Where to next?

Mrs Gillespie towers right before you, her immense form almost close enough to touch. If you wanted, you could jump from the edge of the counter to about hip height, landing on her jeans and letting her carry you away from here.

If that seems too dangerous, you could always climb back down to the floor, retracing your path down the counter-face and retrieving your ropes in the process.

But after all that effort to get up here, why not take full advantage of it? There's plenty more to explore and see here atop the kitchen counter!
132121211211321232311211331111323221211.title: D3: Dry But Reliable

choices: Go get some soap
Begin woodcutting
Descend for some matches
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, you spent so much effort getting up here, it would be wasteful to descend so soon. And wasting energy is a big no-no in the world of tiny survival.

You're running low on the space in your bags, and probably have enough food and drink for the moment. There are other essentials you will require beside sustenance on your life ahead.

Ahead lies the towering tap that looms over the great pit of the kitchen sink. Were you to fall in there, you'd never get out again. What you have your eyes on however, is the creamy mound settled at the base of the waterworks, nestled in a brightly coloured plastic seashell.

Hygiene will be important, so gathering some soap from over there would be useful. You could cut a few slivers free for future use, and clean yourself up right now in the meantime.

Other resources around here could be some wood, for building materials. There's enough wooden tools and containers around here - a cutting board, a wooden spoon - and you could slice a few slivers of that free to take with you.

The other thing, nagging at your mind... Fire. You'll need warmth, and creating fire at a smaller scale is not something you've ever experimented with. Looking back, you probably should have done so before embarking on this odyssey.

There should be some matches in the kitchen drawer, and you could easily slip inside, maybe take a few pieces to work as firestarters for the first few attempts while you get the hang of things.

No sign of the goddess Sarah at present, so you're free to travel, but you don't know when she'll be back, so you can't take too long!
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D3:  On Top of the World

choices: Get dressed and gather your stuff
Grab a few things and run quickly
Take a plunge into the sink
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
You trek across the kitchen counter slowly, weighed down by your many bundles of supplies. After this, you'll probably have to head back to your supply base to offload some weight.

With your destination fixed ahead of you, you can marvel in your surroundings. Various spoons, whisks and spatulas hang from hooks on the back wall, like skyscrapers gutted as trophies. That they don't fall and cause massive devastation entrances you.

Also the mounds of tins, holding coffee, sugar and who knows what else. An egg timer, a toaster, all massive constructions of domestic awe. You will never experience such convenience while you remain at this size, and even the simplest tool is an apocalyptic display of power.

The hike takes longer than you would have liked, and you're sweating by the time you reach the soap dish. the ground around it is smooth metal, so you secure a hair rope to the edge of the counter and around your waist, to prevent accidently plummeting into the sink.

So you tentatively step across to the clamshell, your feet kicking through tiny remains of old soap, flakey brown crap that blows away in the breeze of your passing. Pulling yourself up, you tighten your grip on your blade and set to sawing away at the deformed mound of creamy cleanliness that sits before you.

The first batch you scrub into your own hands and face, taking a little water to get a good lather going. It's rudimentary, but after all you've been through these past couple of days, it's overdue. In fact, while returning to putting slices of soap into your sack, you realise that you reek quite badly. You having undressed since being shrunk, so perhaps the rest of your body needs a wash as well.

Stripping down, you shudder at the chill your three-quarter inch body experiences, and throw yourself at the soap, coating yourself with the pleasant-smelling substance. Scrubbing it free from yourself, you feel like a new man!

Basking in your birthday suit, you look down the incredible depth of the sink, shiny metal to a sheer stop. Humbling. Swinging your arms back and forth for a little exercise while you rest, you behold Sarah's vast form approaching rapidly, the titan stepping forward with the same casual speed of all human beings.

Her hand reaches out before you've even taken a single step back, bringing a waterfall cascading from the tap above you, splashing down that vast drop. What is she doing here? Is she washing her hands, filling the sink, or what? You'll have to react quickly, as close proximity to humans always carries the danger of instant death!
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D3: Clean Hands

1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
When surviving, the items you have gathered are of utmost importance. Having gone to so much effort to gather them - having them so vital to your continued survival - to abandon them would be both wasteful and dangerous.

This is the rule of survival you apply as you hurridly pull your clothes onto your damp body, at the same time gathering some of your sacks with your foot. Trying to do as much as possible at once.

But you've ignored the fact that there's another rule, about immediate danger overruling ongoing concerns. And the approach of a woman in excess of five hundred feet tall is a pretty immediate danger.

You've moved varely an inch from your starting point, and Sarah's hand scoops you up alongside the soap, noticing little difference. Her hands clasp together, unrelenting strength crushing you between the indomitable soap wall and her rough palm skin.

Your blade has somehow implaed you through the side in the confusion, and you can't so much as move your hand to try and extricate it. You can feel the blood leaking from you in the darkness, it's scent overpowered by the soap and the female sweat.

Sarah begins to rub her hands together, coating them in the soap, dashing your supplies apart, grinding your own self back and forth. Your body tears, your organs rupture, your mind screams.

With increasing vigour she slides her hands up and down the soap, smearing you more and more with every motion. By the time she finally brings her hands beneath the deluge of water from the tap, you've long since checked out. As the water washes the soap suds away, your dismembered corpse joins them, draining away into the darkness of forgotten eternity.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D3: No Item Left Behind

choices: Look around up here
Go for the people
Descend to the ground
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No time, no time, no time! The gods do not wait upon three-quarter inch tall insects, so you must get away as quickly as possible if you want to live! You snatch up your blade, close to hand, and shoulder a couple of bags before slipping your way across the slimy floor of the soap dish, away from the approaching giantess.

The ground shudders as Sarah's fingers close upon the soap, and your foot gives way, sliding yout to the lip of the dish, driving the breath from your body. With a wrench the monolith of soap is torn from the dried residue that glued it to the dish, shaking the whole thing and rattling you where you lie.

An optimistic, overconfident fool might think they could take this opportunity to go back and gather their things, but you know better. The crunching, squealching cacopony of the woman rubbing her hands with soap lasts only moments, then the soap is placed back where it came from.

Dropped from the goddess' hand, it once again shakes the ground, and you cling to the edge as much as you can. Now her hands are underneath the torrent from the tap, rubbing together with crushing force, and your remining supplies have been crushed beneath the soap.

Looking across at the great cream structure, you know you'll never be able to shift it. What's under there is gone forever, and you'll have to live with that. The supplies can be replaced, gathered again. The big loss is your clothing.

You are still naked, and while it's warm enough within this heated family home for the moment, someone of your size will lose body heat fairly quickly. You can't strut around in your birthday suit for any great length of time!

As you watch the giant woman finish up, turning off the tap and drying her hands, you ponder again how much outsize the rest of the world is to you now. You will not be able to find any material as fine in quality as your lost clothes. Should you gather any material, it will be thick and rough and heavy, slowing you and causing pain. But find some you must.

Where to search? There's unlikely to be anything up here, on the kitchen counter, but you never know until you look. If you don't find anything though, then that's a waste of time and energy.

The humans here wear clothes, and you should be able to cut some from them to outfit yourself: you could try getting onto Sarah, see if she has anything to spare.

Or is it a long climb to the ground, to see if any scraps are left there? Maybe you might gather enough hair to weave something together..?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D3: Bug Out

choices: Back pocket
Front for now
Underwear?
Climb down
Jump off onto passing furniture
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
You set off at a sprint, closing to the edge of the counter-top and a leap into the air before the giantess can walk out of your reach. She has turned her back, in preparation for walking away, and so your body collides with her denim-clad ass, getting a good grip.

"We have got to stop meeting like this," you mutter, and if Sarah heard you or felt your three-quarter inch self impact, she gives no sign.

As her legs begin their motion, your perch shudders, and you must plan your next move. Denim will be of little use to you, but she may have a handkerchief in her back pocket, if you can climb there. Great risk if she decides to sit down, though!

The longer game would mean climbing around to her front, working out where to go from there. Safe from being sat upon, you could make for higher ground.

Then again, knowing the source of the material you used for your bags, there is one definitely fine material underneath you. This great, rolling ass must have underwear on it, and were you to climb upward, over and into the dark, you could claim some for yourself.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D3: Just Browsing

choices: Sarah's lap
Go down to the chair seat
Climb higher on Sarah
Go down Sarah's leg to the floor
Try to get to the armrest
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
With the straps of your bags chaffing against your naked skin, you haul yourself up onto Sarah's underwear. North of the elastic, a powerful force that keeps the clothing tight against her monumental form, there is some fancy pink frill. Fancy and extraneous, and perfect for your needs! Of course, even this fine fabric is coarse and rough to your three-quarter inch self, but it'll be perfectly good at keeping you warm, and your skin covered.

Feet on the elastic, back leaning against the less-than-tight hem of the jeans, you hack away with your cutting tool while the ginatess plods along, her rolling steps adding another layer of risk to the process. Almost strange that there's nothing sexual about the process - despite the all-encompasing musk of the woman's sweat, and the knowledge that her genitalia are not too far from your present position, you can think of the mountainous form of warm flesh as nothing but an animal from which you need to extract resources.

And so you do, sawing through the thinner threads attached to the main body of the underwear, revealing more and more of the rumbling skin, rippling with each movement in a mirror of your own stumblings.

You have peeled clear several large strips, ready for your terrible fashion designs, when Sarah ceases walking and her ass plunges downward.

You are smashed against the denim, but luckily not crushed as space remains beween the woman herself and her trousers. She must be sitting, and you are in awe of how unaware she is of her sheer power. She just sat down, and almost killed someone.

Time to get out of here, somewhere where you can clothe yourself. Throwing the rags over your shoulder, you pull yourself out into the light, and see that there is a brown, leathery surface of seating below you, past the extent of Sarah's thigh. So, where should you head to begin clothing yourself, given that you can't go carrying all this stuff around forever!
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D3: Dear Lord, I'm In the Frilly

choices: Stay put and hope it works out.
Dive through a leg hole.
Crawl into the gusset.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
You'll move around to Sarah's lap. It makes sense; from there, you'll actually be able to see what she's doing. If you just drop to the chair or try to climb down her leg, it could go disastrously wrong. What if she decides to get up? What if the little girl wakes up? No, you'll be able to get an idea of what's up before it happens if you can keep an eye on her. Besides, you figure you'll sit by the pocket. Maybe you'll ride with her some more, or maybe you'll get off this ride, but it gives you options.

You decide to get around Sarah in the most efficient way, which means climbing back into her jeans and working your way around the frilly lace. You make the long transit around her hip, and you're working your way back across the front, when suddenly, Sarah decides to rise again.

You weren't prepared, but fortunately, you were holding on to lace when the world suddenly shot upward, and so you are able to maintain your grip as you head to wherever you're heading. Of course, you have no idea where that is, but you'll figure it out when you get there.

Soon enough, it's apparent. There's a crack as a snap is undone, and then the sound of metal grinding, and suddenly, the world is dropping down, acres of skin zipping away as Sarah drops her jeans and underwear, and sits down on the toilet.

This motion is too much for you to manage, and you lose your grip, going briefly airborne before landing on a soft trampoline. It takes you a moment to figure out where you are, and strangely, it's the scent that does it before your eyes manage the task. You're on a piece of cloth suspended about halfway up Sarah's shins, as the sound of a cataract opening into a pool roars above you.

You're laying in her panties.

This is...not good. Fortunately, she hasn't looked down, but you're big enough that she'll see you if she does, and you've got some explaining to do if she does. You could bail out through one of the leg holes, but given the bunched up denim beneath you, it's no telling how that would work out. Would you be able to hold on? Would you be squashed against her thigh? Or would you fall to the floor?

You could, of course, just stay very still and hope for the best. And given that even now, the roaring waterfall above has dropped to a trickling creek, that may be the best move you have. Of course, once you're zipped back up...you're not sure how you get out of that one without being felt. But one step at a time.

There is one other option that you suddenly realize exists. The panties she's wearing aren't particularly expensive ones, and the gusset of the cotton crotch isn't sewn shut. If you hurry, you could dive in there, and hide out between the layers of fabric. You'll be a bit safer, but it's probably physically harder to escape, and you might end up in the laundry if you aren't careful.

Anyhow, she's pulling some toilet paper off the roll, you're out of time, you have to decide.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D3: Front and Center

choices: Gather cleaning supplies
Head back to home base
Search for the bedroom
Return to the kitchen for food
Secure a possible exit to the outside for emergencies
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, you need to get your naked ass out of Sarah's underwear right now. As you run unevenly across the taut fabric, bags balanced unsteadily, you recognise the liquid splashed across your own thigh: the terror of those last few moments has meant that you've pissed in her pants.

She won't notice such a small splatter of urine, but she will sure as Hell notice you if you're still here, so you quiet the fear in your mind and focus on the immeasurable wall of Sarah's calf, and the pit that it very neatly plugs.

Warm flesh, but not quite flush with the leg hole of the panties. Leaning on it with your hand for balance - the thrill of pulsing life beneath your palm - you look down the sheer drop, only a folded mass of denim to cushion your fall.

Hesitation at the thought of such a fall, but then the leg jerks as a prelude to the rising of the panties, and the time is now! You spring forward, clutching tight to the pack of your supplies, and watching the skin shoot past you with speed. You daren't reach out to touch her, but Sarah doesn't share this instinct.

Ahead of you - below you - a mighty hand seizes tight the edge of the jeans, and begins pulling them upward to meet you.

Tuck and roll, and you bounces from the edge of the clothing, smashing off to one side and sliding, exhausted and bruised, to a stop on the rough bathroom rug. Tight and pained, you cling ever tighter to your bundle while above you the goddess Sarah re-clothes herself, her vast feet crashing down with force enough to shake the world.

Eyes open slowly, and you glance up at the majesty of the woman as she rises tall above you, bare toes flexing once before she takes a step, soaring over you with dread potential, so much mass carried with no effort.

Her foot stamps down out of sight behind you, and the other leg swiftly follows, the giantess walking away from you in moments like an eternity. It's over before you can blink, the fading echoes of her earthquake pace the only evidence she was ever here.

You sit up, alone in a chamber designed for gods. The porcelein mass of the toilet and bath-tub rise so high you can scarcely dream of scaling them, but that doesn't matter. What's important now is that you are alone. Sarah shouldn't be back here so soon after her last visit, so you have time to clothe yourself.

The material of her panties is thick and heavy, and with only her hair to tie it together - itself tough as nautical rope - the robes you fashion for yourself are far from convenient. It'll be impossible to find threads as fine as those you shrank with, so a cloak as delicate as mammoth hide is about the best you can hope for. At least it wraps you in warmth, and is thick enough to not easily be pierced or torn.

It may be emasculating to be dressed in clothing torn from the underwear of a young mother, but beggars cannot be choosers.

Now that you've regained what was lost, where to now? You had been thwarted in your full attempt to gain cleaning supplies, so where better to renew that quest than here, in a bathroom recently vacated?

Then there's the rest of the home, open to you but you cannot be sure where the dangerous giant and her daughter could be right now, nor how safe you may be...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D3: Too Soon For Third Base

choices: Stay at the house, scrounge as you have done
Stay at the house, aim to get to rooms you haven't seen
Go with the stroller tomorrow morning
Briefcase - spend the day at work with Alfie
Try to explore the garden
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Sarah's already given you so much, you muse as you shimmy your three quarter-inch self across her waist, toward her front. Transport, shelter, food... She even stripped you of the clothes of your previous life, gave you an incentive to struggle toward new survival challenges!

As you pull yourself atop her thigh, naked body already covered in sweat, you consider her immense, heaving form above you. A sheer cliff of woman-hood, her notice far above you, on some book or television or phone - you can't even tell, from your persepctive.

This goddess, when you write your memoir... you'll give her at least a four star rating.

You trundle along her leg to the knee, the denim rough between your toes, your burden weighing you down more and more. Looking down the length of her shin, your odyssey is far from over. Yet you persevere, swinging yourself over to begin climbing down the thick threads, careful with every step not to catch your junk and end in such an embarrassing manner.

The woman is sitting still, but no human can remain fully motionless. Imperceptible movements on a human scale rock your tiny world, minor flinches that send panic through you as your climbing surface shakes. Down and down, hand and foot, to the ankle of this goddess.

Bare flesh beneath you, warm and pulsing, and sure to pick up on you if you touch it. So you shimmy once more, dropping from the denim to the carpet below.

You avoid carpet burn, but the impact still winds you, leaves you lying on your back and panting as you look up at Sarah's heel. Dried skin at its bottom, rising into a powerful monument of weight. She shifts again, her heel rising and falling in a moment with untold crushing force, and you jump up.

Staying near her feet is just asking for trouble. So you scoot across the carpet, skipping and jumping to avoid catching your toe.

Her toes have no such problem, writhing and pulling at the fibres so casually, with strength that would tear you limb from limb.

Leaving her behind, you pass on into the kitchen, where the smooth, tiled floor has its own traversal probems. You duck as powerful feet stomp past you, the monster dog walking by to curl up in its basket with a yawn, displaying all its many, deadly teeth. You've been lucky that the creature has paid you no attention while you've been here - are you literally beneath its notice, a mixture of insignificant size and humans scent enough to keep you safe?

Well, who cares. You trek across the kitchen, the day disappearing in exertion, all notion of time lost from your mind. Beneath the table, across to where the stroller is stored, and with it your supplies. Sitting at last, you let drop your bags, the food and soap therein added to your stock.

Then you set to with hair and panty-frill, wrapping yourself in thick fabric and tying it down with weighty ropes. It's rough clothing, little more than wrappings around torso and feet, sleeves being beyond your skills. It's enough to keep you warm for now, and in the future you'll have to try to get something more advanced.

To pass the time, you settle down with your journal, writing through these first few days, your insights on what a society at this scale may be like, your discoveries about humanity and yourself. High-falutin' stuff, and who knows if you'll even ever get to share it?

You're tired, and regardless of how much time is left in the day, you need to sleep. But as you lay your head down, the dog barks fit to end the world, and comes bounding across the floor of the greater kitchen area, back and forth with tail wagging.

Then you see why. Black-shoed male feet stomp in, the man dropping his briefcase close to you as he stoops to pet at the dog, it licking his face in return. It's a handsome face, strong and chiselled, and yoiu can see why Sarah loves this man. He stands as the woman herself enters, her cry of "Alfie!" rewarded with a distant hug and kiss,

So there's his name. You keep clear of the touching reunion, for there's no hope of living through their movements. Once they're gone, you'll sleep. And you can awake to a fourth day here, planning now what you want to do. You have so many options within this house, but now you could try going to work with Alfie, get access to some new materials...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D3: At Day's End, Across the Realm to the Next

choices: Try to penetrate the briefcase
Climb the desk
Head toward some of Alfie's colleagues
Leave the room to search for food
Leave the room to search for a stock room
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
You settle down to sleep, comfortable in your new clothes and warmth, your tiny form content at last. The rumbles of the house of giants are now subtle and distant, and peace settles upon you.

Your waking is at an unknown time, but the quakes are definietly more distracting now. Preparation for the day brings you jumping to your feet, checking the secureness of your clothing and taking several empty bags for the daty's scavenge. Breakfast is brief but tasty, slaking your hunger and providing enough energy for hours. With your blade at your hip, yoi stride up to Alfie's briefcase.

It's tall, sure, but given the giants you've seen and climbed it's hardly anything. Trying to get inside would be futile, and even if you succeeded you'd be trapped for an unknown length of time. No, you'll reside in one of the exterior pockets, thin pouches that are designed only for a sheet or two of paper. More than enough room for a three-quarter inch survivalist to thrive.

And that's where you are when Alfie picks up his luggage, cracking it with his immese strength. From the smell that briefly haunts the air, you feel that he must be putting his lunch inside. It would be nice to get a look at that, but you've got time.

For now, you sit tight in your dark, narrow space and allow the noise and motion to swing you up and about, jostled by steps and then a sudden impact - following by the roaring activation of car starting. The vast machine carries you and your unwitting host onward at speeds unimaginable to you now. Maybe, just maybe, you should look into some way of constructing a vehicle for yourself back at the library - that would make navigating the stacks much easier. Food for thought.

At drive's conclusion, the briefcase is whisked away for another round of back-and-forth, and your confined space acts in your favour - no room for you to tumble about so much!

The final, world-shaking landing has you waiting for a few moments, listening as Alfie's footsteps carry him away before popping out for a look: And it's an office space.

As expected, but there's no real indicator of what business it is they do here. There's desk above you, so far, far above you, chair out and ready. Constant background chatter makes you aware of the other workers that Alfie shares his space with - he's not so high-up as to have his own office.

So, where to go? You'll need to reconvene back at this briefcase in a few hours to be taken back to the house, but in the meantime you should strip this place of as much materials as possible. Where to start in this gigantic area?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4: The Daily Grind

choices: Climb the power cables
Climb the desk leg
Climb the office chair
Climb the body of Alfie
Climb the room's wall
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
A little height will help. See what the layout of this place is, and plan your next step. Of course, each of your steps covers only a pathetic distance now, and it may take you some tme to get up there! You still have your hair ropes, but what route should you take?

Beneath the desk, you can see a smattering of power cables drooled across the ground and rising up behind the desk itself. There should be no fear of any electrical shock, and you could scale without anyone seeing you.

Another option would be the sturdy legs of the desk itself, clearly the most solid and reliable of the options available. It's wood, and not too new, so there are plenty of imperfections and damages to use as handholds.

What of the chair upon which Alfie sits? It's a swivel chair, and therefore a bit flimsy, but if you can get up its back, you will actually end up higher than the desk itself and can survey it for dangers before you pull yourself up onto it.

Of course, there will be a giant sitting in that seat, and once he gets back you could use him as a means to climb. Having done the same with his wife and daughter, it would only be fair for him to provide the same service to you.

The last choice woud be to scale the wall itself: a challenge which might be worth trying your hand at, if only to increase your skill set and get a lot more exercise.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  The Floor is No Good

choices: Grab some crumbs from the plate
Acquire some electricals from the computer
Take a paperclip or something to get some metal material
Perhaps some esoteric material, like ink from a pen?
Plenty of papers around here...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Using these dangling cables demands a different form of climbing to what you've been doing these past few days. You cannot hook your rope like a grapnel you climb up, but must instead secure yourself by the waist to the thick, cylindrical object, and bodily throw yourself upwards, trusting to your own tiny weight and the relative sturdiness of the cable.

It's almost relaxing, to be using your body again and in such a way that presents no risk. This sort of work-out is one of the reasons you decided to dedicate yourself to tiny survival, to prove your power as a person against the merciless power of an outsize world. No cares beyond your own needs, and no allies beside you.

Alfie's thunderous tread announces his return, and then the crunch as he sits and the rolling as he wheels himself under the desk. Out of sight, his gargantuan legs and knees must be approaching, but they cannot reach you here at the back.

In time you drag yourself over the edge of the desk, in the shadow of the immense desktop computer at which the galloping impacts indicate Alfie must be typing. Peeking around the edge, you see many gargantuan artifacts of this workplace, from stationery and writing tools to a plate covered with forgotten crumbs.

It's a treasure trove of loot for one with a keen eye for survival! What is it that you will grab first? Food, building materials, scientific apparatus, odd curios..?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Power Struggle

choices: Grab onto Becca for a ride
Climb toward Alfie to get aboard him
Remain hiding until both giants leave
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
A number of paper clips are scattered across the desk, no doubt torn from sheafs of paper and just thrown down casually by this giant. Thrown down with enough force to crush your fragile body, no doubt!

So, checking that Alfie is distracted by his work (as well he should be!) you scuttle over to one of the paperclips. It's thick as a steel bar, and even curled back upon itself is taller than you! Try as you might, you can't find a way to carry it with you without it becoming a terrible encumbrance.

Throwing your hands down in frustration, you notice a rack of staples, and approach them instead. Thinner and shorter than the papeclip, the only problem is how the row of staples is bonded together, waiting for the pressure of a stapler to stamp one out. However, at your size there's ample room to fit the tip of your blade between two of the staples, and... just... press...

The last staple tears free from its place, lightweight and compact enough to be carryable. Your blade has also bent a little, yet still maintains its sharp edge. Best not try such a stunt again lest it break.

Still! You have some metal, which will be very useful when it comes to constructing a shelter or larger tools.

Now, what else is here to take?

"Knock! Knock!"

The voice is accompanied by an onomatopoeia, giant knuckles rapping on the frame of the office doorway. Ducking for cover behind a standing pen holder, you look up to see that a woman stands in the doorway, powerfully dressed with a skirted business suit, a confident smile on her face. She throws her long, dark hair over her shoulder with a toss of her head.

"Coffee?" she asks, shaking the massive mug in her hand.

Alfie looks up from his screen as the giantess stalks across the room, laying a hand on his shoulder as she looms over him and you. "Earth to Alfie! You listening to me?"

"Oh, uh, sorry Becca, I didn't have much sleep last night."

"Ha! They're terrible at that age, aren't they?" Becca moves away from the giant and leans against the desk. Her normally slight weight would have little effect to a human, but the moment her ass brushes against the furniture, you feel a shudder throughout it, an almighty creak of protest. "Sounds like you really could use the caffeine, huh?"

Well, looks like this could be an opportunity to explore elsewhere. With Becca in contact with the desk, you could hop aboard her to go along for some coffee yourself - a few beans could be a stimulant that might be helpful in keeping yourself awake when needed.

Then again, if Alfie accompanies her to the break room, you'd be more free to explore and loot his desk...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Heavy Metal

choices: Jump onto the coffee table
Stay where you are for the moment
Climb higher for a better view of the room's other occupants
Descend to the floor to find somewhere to hide until they leave
Take some of this fine skirt to make better clothes
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Becca's ass dominates your view, and in the last few places you've been worse places than outside the ass-side of a skirt. Stowing your staple securely, you reach out to grab onto the thick fibres, digging in deep enough to be held in place easily.

"I need to finish this e-mail," Alfie says. "I'll catch you up."

With that, Becca launches herself upright, and every successive step she takes shakes your world, the tremendous mass of ponderous flesh on the other side of this material juddering.
