You can't help but wonder if she's putting a little extra sway in there for Alfie's benefit as she walks away, but he's a married man!

Holding as you are, you can't really see much when you crane your neck to see around Becca's vertical horizon. Enough to see that Alfie works in one of an insane number of cubicles in whatever this office is. Nice carpet, needs new paint on the walls.

Soon you are awash in new noises, as Becca approaches the break room. Chatter and gossip from a bevvy of giants, all female from the sound of things.

"So, Alfie isn't joining us then, huh?"

"Don't doubt me," Becca returns, stopping to face the speaker and thus turning you away from any hope of seeing her. You are, however, now within easy reach of a table, set against the wall and home to several mugs, a coffee maker and more delicious sights! Not only could you get on there, but there'd be plenty of cover for you to hide from these beings while you gather! What are you waiting for?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Coffee Break

choices: Get some coffee beans
Get some sugar
Get some biscuit
Get some attention on those wounds
Get more information from the giants
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Yeah, sure, you think, there’s no risk here. With so much cover, you’ll be able to have free reign across this place!

So, you release your death-grip on the skirt and throw yourself backwards. The landing is more awkward than usual, as that massive staple refuses to roll with the rest of your gear – with a painful twinge, you realise that you may have hurt yourself.

Standing hurts more than it should, and you lean up against a coffee mug to take a few breaths and check how bad the damage is. Unable to see your back, your probing fingers are your only providers of information, and they feel tender skin that burns at their touch.

Nothing you can do about that at the moment though, other than try to cut down on the physical exertion for a short while. Early experiments showed that wounds should heal quicker at your new stature, but you’ll still be slowed for a while, and another hit like that could leave you immobilised or worse!

Sneaking through the forest of crockery, smooth obelisks sporting slogans taller than you, you soon sniff out potential scavenging sites while listening to the drone of comments above you. Seems like Alfie, sole male in the office environment, is the subject of quite a few of his fellow employees, and ones such as Becca don’t seem too concerned over his marital status…

Those are matters above your concern, but you’re still forced to listen to the innuendos and giggling as you narrow down your targets.

The coffee sits upright in a sealed foil package, almost as tall as the mugs around you. The spoon beside it alone is a massive artefact, and if you could get close you could cut open the bag to get a bean or two. The caffeine they provide would be useful for dealing with long-term projects in the future!

Of to the other side – not far for most people, but a good few seconds’ walk to you – lies the sugar, both piles of massive cubes on a plate and sachets of ‘sweetener’. Neither is too healthy, but can provide short-term energy boosts that again could be useful.

A plate of biscuits has been laid out, beside the rumbling, steaming engine that heats the water. They wouldn’t be so good for keeping for later, but could be snacked on now for a quick pick-me-up after your wound.

Thinking of which, you could rip some material from one of those paper napkins over there, bandage yourself a little, maybe create a better carrying sling for the staple to avoid future accidents.

Or if all this pesky ‘survival’ business is just too annoying to you, you could approach closer to the edge and devote your attention fully to the discussion outside. Want an excuse? Just say you’re ‘resting’ after that poor landing. Yeah, that’ll do.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  A Fine Spread

choices: Run back amongst the coffee mugs to hide
Crawl inside the coffee packet to hide
Jump to the floor to hide
Dash behind the percolator to hide
Collapse and play dead, hoping they'll leave you be
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
It does means venturing out from the cluster of cups, but the talk above has shown little sign of slowing. Who’s even going to be looking down here, huh?

Limping only slightly, you duck around the spoon and brandish your weapon as the foil looms. Then you consider what it has already been through, and put it away. Time to get some use out of this damn’ staple! So, you pull it out from where it was stowed and press it firmly into the metal before you, tearing a hole with brute simplicity. A little further flailing and it opens up wide enough for you to tease a whole coffee bean out.

The scent is already almost enough to get you up and running, but you stash the great lump away for later – there will be times when you can’t afford to sleep, and chipping small slivers from it, this should last for months!

Quite a find! Imminently pleased with yourself, you can only stand and gape when someone above you gives a great shout:

“Ew! A bug, right near the coffee! Would someone kill it, please?”

Not good. You turn and look up, seeing a cluster of concerned and disgusted women. Not an unfamiliar sight before you became a survivalist hermit, but now it takes on a new, wholly terrifying dimension.

None has moved to kill you yet, and you hope that disgust and surprise will keep them occupied long enough for you to get away, to survive another day! Prepared for a sprint, you wince as your back protests yet again. Circumstances aren’t on your side…
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Seen As An Insect

choices: Stay where you are and hope to be passed over
Double back the way you came
Run through the mugs towards the edge of the table
Run through the mugs towards the wall
Grab onto a mug and hold tight
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
The forest of brightly coloured cups and mugs must be the best option - there are more items to hide behind, after all.

"Where's it going?" a voice screeches. There are roars from the other giantesses, alternately of fear and disgust or of confusion, with one confident voice taking command.

"It's trying to hide. Don't worry, I'll get it."

At Becca's commanding tone, you look over your shoulder. Through the corridor of mugs, you behold her delicate yet massive fingers lift the spoon from where it lies, the titanic monument merely a tool to her, one capable of smashing the life from an invading bug with one impact.

With your injury, you can't run at either great speed nor for a long time, so instead you hare off around a 'corner' between two other mugs, hoping that avoiding a straight line will give you that much more time before you're found and crushed.

A grinding noise disturbs your peace, confusing and out of place. When it is followed by a crash and a quake, you realise that Becca is lifting and returning mugs in an effort to find you. For while these mugs may be impossible barriers to your three-quarter inch self, to a regular human they're tiny objects to be moved aside with minimal concern! To survive this, you'll have to overcome a foe with a vast physical advantage, in terrain that offers little aid, and with an injury to boot!

Good luck.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Mugging Off the Giants

choices: Remain where you are, wait until Alfie has failed his search in turn
Drop down and hide on foot amongst the mugs once more
Untie yourself and try to get onto Alfie so that he can carry you back
Climb up into the mug
Work your way to the floor
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, no, you have to play this smart. Wherever you run, she'll see you from above, as the woman is picking up cups faster than you can run between them. You have to hide in plain sight, and Becca will overlook you.

Unslipping that pesky staple again, you hurriedly tie a rope about it and heft it aloft, where it soon clang into place hooked around the handle of the mug above you. Another mug slams down not far away, and you climb with desperate strength, lodging yourself on the handle, propped up by the staple and tied securely with the rope.

Then the world lurches, and your stomach gasps. Looking up, you see the colossal fingertips of Becca's free hand, gripping tight to the rim of the mug as she lifts it up, her eyes casting far below for any sign of the tiny intruder. For long moments you are almost in freefall, grateful for the hairs binding you in place - you'd surely have fallen were you merely clinging on with your own muscles alone!

The mug slams down again, and you are rattled where you sit, alive but with your bruising agitated. Gasping as you probe the wound again, you sit tight as Becca continues to lift and drop cups, snarling like an angry god far above.

Her entire fist slams down just at the edge of sight, a flesh and bone structure almost as big as the massive mug above you. Each cup clatters in response to her rage, and she screams to her colleagues, demanding they find you, that they kill you, that you not get away -

"What's all the hubbub?"

Alfie's voice is a moment of calm, and as you check your attachment, the female voices in the heavens calm somewhat and become more distant, as they flock around him. You can see Becca's fist unclench, long fingers stroking at the tabletop for a moment before withdrawing upwards.

"Oh, Alfie! Thank God you're here! There's a gross bug on the table, and we need you to get rid of it!"

You can well imagine her getting uncomfortably close to the man, and must put the overworld from your mind as you focus on your next step:
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Shell Game

choices: Jump across to Becca to give her a piece of your mind
Remain on Alfie's belt
Try to find a place in Alfie's pocket
Climb higher on Alfie
Descend to the ground
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, this adventure in the office has already been too costly to you in terms of bodily harm. You have to get back to your transport, to rest and heal, and Alfie is your ticket back there.

Untying yourself, you drop from the mug handle and respool your rope and staple while Alfie gives his reluctant agreement to Becca and lumbers closer. You head toward his shadow, threading through the throughfares of the crockery.

"You want me to kill it, or just get it out of here?" the giant sighs above you. Looking up, you see that he is turned away, facing the gaggle of goddesses in the room, and so he can't see you. And thus you jump for him, leaving the edge of the table and heading for his belt.

Again, you impact heavily, but the staple is secure enough now that you don't get any more damage. You can hook yourself around a belt hole, and stay secure here.

Alfie does as Becca did at first, lifinig mugs and crouching low to see where you could have gotten to, before concluding that the bug is long gone. He shrugs an apology to the ladies, and then gets about making coffee for everyone.

Becca is grateful for this, as you can tell my her increasing proximity. Her gargantuan form closes on Alfie, pressing tight enough that you fear for a moment she may crush you between them! She talks up his achievements, saying how the bug must have been scared off when he arrived, and how she feels so much safer with a strong man like him around...

She's laying it on pretty thick, and with your admiration for Sarah you feel indignation rising up within you - how dare she try to come between these two loving parents! You're mad enough, you ponder for a moment jumping across to her body: you could climb onto her and give her some annoying pricks whenever she tries flirting with this married man. A little negative reinforcement to get her to back off? It would be cathartic revenge for the terror she's run you through over the last few minutes.

Then again, you do still smart from recent exertions, so perhaps attacking a woman ninety times your size isn't the best idea right now. You can find somewhere better to sit while you recover.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Okay, I give up

choices: Rest on Alfie's belt
Climb to the desk to rest
Go back to the briefcase to rest
See if Alfie has a more comfortable spot
Climb to the chair's armrest to see what he's working on
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, no, you're done with physical exertion for the rest of the day. Alfie's office job means that he's not going to be running around too much, so here you can rest safely.

You have to endure the deplorable temptations that Becca's lays your host's way, but he gallantly turns aside her preying. His other worker colleagues seem almost as uncomfortable as he is, and they do manage some more gentle conversation over how his daughter is doing, what tv they watched the night before, and other harmless co-worker conversation.

The remainder of the coffee break passes calmly, and then Alfie wanders back to his cubicle, you sitting pretty on his belt. He sits, and doesn't have enough of a gut to threaten you when he does so. The chair scoots under the desk, and thunderous typing opens up above.

Yes, rest is what you need now, but is here the best place? Or should you retreat back to the briefcase or elsewhere just to be on the safe side?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Sit This Out

choices: Go pay Becca a threatening visit
Remain in the briefcase and just sleep
Go back out to see if you can get more stuff from the desk
Harvest some more sutable clothing from Alfie
Take some coffee, as an experiment to see how it works
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Yes, you need to rest and recuperate. Pulling yourself from the belt hole, you climb across to Alfie's powerful leg, the thick black material of his trousers so easy to scale. Down onto the seat, you pause to look up at the giant, just to confirm that he's not planning on standing up and subjecting you to the irresistable force of his movements.

No, no, he's content to be typing away at whatever he's paid to. So, you haul out some more of your hair-ropes and set to slowly lowering yourself to carpet level. Once there, you retreat to the briefcase, and sit, and rest.

It feels so good to be doing nothing. Even the noises of the giant world are almost calm, for the first time in your tinty survival adventure. At a lack for other occupation, you stash your coffee bean away safely and get down to writing some of your memoirs.

As you progress over the harsh environment that work provides for a shrunken individual, you find the immense contrast between the gentle, nurturing care you experienced with Sarah and the predatory nature of Becca. Sitting idle, your righteous indignation stirs within you! She can't get away with what she's trying to do, and she has to learn not to mess with that true love!

You are feeling quite a bit better now - fast healing, after all - and consider the possibility of hiking out to find that woman, leave her a message not to try to get involved with Alfie. It feels like a small amount of payback, and you have taken so much from the family that you fell guilty for not giving in return. Annoying a giantess seems like the most you could hope to achieve.

It would also pass the time - there's a lot of day to get through here, and gathering resources has proven difficult. There is a risk of not getting back to Alfie for your return trip, but that's merely a factor you need to account for in your planning.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Back to Base

choices: Press on, climb Becca up her tights (she won't feel you!)
Keep away from the living being, and climb the furniture
Settle for writing a message on the floor somehow
Steal from her - is that material better than what you're wearing?
Back out and leave, wasting your effort in getting her
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
You feel well enough to travel, and you really shouldn't lounge around without need; it won't affect you much to start, but if you get too used to it, your laziness will lead to a lack of readiness and health!

So! You leave the briefcase - taking your equipment but leaving the staple and coffee bean - and head off toward the doorway. Strolling through this worn carpet is still like a field of high grass, and the only noise to accompany you is Alfie's typing high above. Almost relaxing.

At the open, gargantuan doorway, you peek your head out before moving, and see no giants about. Of course, given the speed at which they move, it would not do much good if you did see them coming!

Hugging the wall, you progress toward the next door. As you pass by a gigantic potted plant, only now do you consider the craziness of your plan. You couldn't even travel to the bathroom in the library, and now you intend to search an entire office building in just a handful of hours? This was stupid.

Then the ground vibrates, and a giant moves past. High heels and tights are all you can see of the legs as they smash past you, crushing the carpet and bearing along an impossible form. Only as the being pauses in the doorway opposite Alfie's do you see who it is: Becca.

Of course! She's obsessed with him because she sits opposite, able to look over her shoulder at him whenever she wants! Her gaze lingers for a while, moving up and down before she bites her lip and strides into her own office.

You're already in motion after her, but by the time you get to the portal she's already sitting at her desk, focussed on the computer much as Alfie is. This won't take as long as you feared; what luck!

She grows as you get closer, and soon you're looking up at her as a statue in motion. One foot is planted solidly, an impressive monument to femininity, while her legs are crossed at the knee, the other foot rotating at the ankle idly, a casual movement that none-the-less sends a thrill of fearful intimidation through you. That massive weight, so easily moving through the air...

Maybe this was a bad idea? Still not too late to turn back!
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Vengeance on the Giantess!  ...Maybe

choices: Sabotage Becca's underwear
Stab Becca with your sword
Navigate to Becca's desktop
Ascend to whisper in Becca's ear
Search Becca's pockets
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
The red surface of these round-toed shoes aren't as smooth as they'd seem to a regular-sized human. Thus you can pull yourself up them with hardly any effort, standing on the end of her foot and looking up at her leg.

Again, the tights probably look fairly solid to a larger eye, but from your perspective it's a mesh wall, plenty of hand- and footholds there for your use. Your rope will not be needed here, and you stow your pack securely before setting to.

The warmth of the woman's skin is very distracting as you pull yourself up her shin. Even sitting motionless, beneath the skin her body is a frenzied factory of activity, rivers of blood gushing at incredible speeds not so far from where you climb.

At times she presses down with this leg, pivoting her chair around it so that she may look through the door at Alfie; in those moments you stop moving and concentrate on holding tight to the mobile mountain. These infrequent surprises mean that you're unsure how much time has passed when you finally crest Becca's knee, able to run along her upper leg to the safety of her skirt.

Well, you've gotten this far, now to decide how you'll take this path of revenge. What can a tiny like you do to a massive woman like this one? Something that will annoy her, but not something that will earn her notice and return murder.

Here, you could get some more clothing from her underwear - she might have materials that would serve as an alternative to Sarah's. While there, you could saw part of the way through it, so that her movements as she walks might tear it fully, dropping her underwear at an embarrassing moment.

If that's too subtle and delayed for you, you could always stab her a little with your tiny prick of a sword. Draw some blood?

Would that really send a message, though? Such pranks would not make Becca learn the lesson. From here, you could go up her knee and get to her desk. From there, you should be able to write a message - her phone, her computer, you'll improvise - and let her know to stay away from Alfie. The mysterious origin of the message should scare her straight.

But the best way to get the message across would be to whisper it in her ear. You could climb further up - all the way up this gigantic, monstrous woman - to her ear, and shout your threat and warning to that dark cave. Again, a disembodied voice should be scary enough for her not to argue with.

Those are just the obvious options - there may be something somewhere in Becca's jacket pockets that you could use against her, and the only way to do that would be to go diving within them...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Too Deep to Back Out Now

choices: Tag along to witness Becca's humiliation
Leave her to it and grab stuff
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
So, with a slightly dull blade, what can you do? Well, for one thing, the net-like arrangement of these tights is a perfect material. Your current, plastic sacks are good for what they are, but a net... That has great potential!

So, before you head deeper in, you stop to slash away, cutting a neat patch out to fold up for later use. It's probably almost inconsequential to her, but to your tiny eyes a vast swath of her warm, thick skin is revealed, and you step hurriedly away lest she feel your presence. Lord knows, you feel her imposing size all the more now...

Further up her thigh, there's ample room for your less-than-ample frame to squeeze under the dark skirt, and reveal to yourself what she wears down here.

It's certainly sexier than what Sarah had - all black and lacy. Just the sort of thing a shameless homebreaker would wear! With such judgemental thoughts floating through your head, you set to harvesting a second set of clothes. This stuff is lighter than what you currently wear, and you're not too proud to have an entire wardrobe constructed of panties. Slash, slash, and you have enough for a change of clothes, summer garb, maybe? You stash it in your new net sack, and then get down to the serious business of sabotage.

At the apex of the hip is where the waistband is thinnest. Again, you are careful to avoid touching that mass of flesh, the musk somewhat distracting as you do so. Carefully, you saw away, back and forth, ripping thread after thread of the elastic, but stopping shy of parting it completely. No, just enough that the simple movement of her legs when she walks will wear away some more, bringing the whole shebang crashing down.

For its part, your blade has cut its last. It is now little more than a heavy lump of metal, and you toss it to one side once you step back out into the light, looking upward toward the unseen face of Becca, who doesn't know what righteous retribution she's in for.

Only question now is whether or not you wish to stick around to see her suffer this revenge - do you want to be carried about with Becca so you're present for her embarrassment, or get off her now and see if you can get any materials from her office once she's gone?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  A Little Man Can Still Do a Lot of Damage

choices: You need to apologise for what you've done
You need to watch and glory in all the suffering she endures
You need to get off and back to Alfie ASAP
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Your hands drag you higher up the woman's body, but you can't get beyond her waist - strangely, about the same height as you were when she carried you to coffee! - before the world quakes, and the goddess rises.

You cling tight, remaining vertical as her thighs drop away, pushing her torso up higher. You rise as she stands to her full height, a hand going to her hair to sweep it out. No expert, you reckon that's probably a sign she's going back to Alfie again. Will she strut enough to finish off your demolition work? Time to find out!

Becca strides from her chair to the open door of her office, and the familiar rolling of her thunderous tread threatens you not at all. You don't have the best view of what's transpiring, but as she rolls her hefty hips just so, you grin at the thought of the stresses her underwear is being exposed to.

"Hi, Alfie!" she says as she - presumably - enters his office. "I didn't ask earlier, but that little one's not causing you to lose too much sleep?"

Oh! It gets worse! She even knows that's he's got a child! You're fuming so much, you don't hear Alfie's reply, but you do catch Becca's next statement:

"You really need a break from it all. Me and a few of the girls, we're going out tomorrow - Friday night! - and you're welcome to come along."

"Flattered, but it's the anniversary Saturday, so I need an early night before that!"

"Oh, surely you want to have a little time away before that, let some stress off? I'll be there, we can have some drinks, do a little dancing..?"

Her steps become sideways sways, as she performs a little preview of her dance moves. Those hips move, rippling the massive being to which you cling, gyrating and grinding and finally snapping the threads you weakened..!

Becca screams as she notices what has happened, and in that moment of embarrassment and fear you feel the regret hit your own heart. Have you gone too far? Isn't Alfie capable of defending himself without your aid?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Down It Drops

choices: Becca smacks you away with the back of her hand
Becca lays a hand out for you to walk onto
Becca faints
Becca screams and runs out, leaving you trapped
Becca brutally grabs you in her fist
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Becca stoops - probably to retrieve her ruined underwear - and you are swept along behind her. She stands just as quickly, and then dashes away, and your clinging to the rear of her skirt becomes tenuous. Her panicked steps rock you side to side as the mass of her ass vibrates and jumps. And she's only panicked because of what you did to her.

Movement ceases as Becca turns to lock a door behind her, and you look around to note the clean, expansive surfaces of a small restroom, the space shared by a toilet for the gods and a sink at - whaddaya know - hip height. As the simple lock clicks into place, you take the short jump from your doomed position to the slippery porcelain.

Skidding to a halt, you look behind to confirm the wisdom of abandoning your position: Becca slams her bottom down on the closed lid of the toilet, flinging her underwear to the ground as she begins to weep loudly. Given her immense stature, it's quite the experience, watching a behemoth shudder with sorrow, gasping and venting torrents of tears. Looking down, she notices the hole you've cut in her legwear, and a groan echoes throughout this enclosed place.

"Great, Becca! Just fucking perfect! Tear your tights on top of EVERYTHING else! Fucking why?"

You caused this. You cannot make it better, but you can clear your conscience by coming clean to her. Looking up at that monster, trying to kill you not that long ago, you gulp. The only previous time you have been in the presence of a regular-sized person aware of your shrunken self was in laboratory conditions, with your assistant Violett. Aside from the clean white surfaces, these are far from laboratory conditions.

You stand tall, summoning all your courage as you look across at the being that could annihilate you at a whim. She couldn't hear you even were you to shout, but if you stand here, distinctive in your panty-robe from the white sink, she'll see you as soon as she looks up. Such an act of revealed vulnerability should elicit some sympathy, or at least enough surprise to buy you the moment you need.

Sure enough, Becca looks up, red-rimmed eyes focussing on you as her colossal brain rolls through the appropriate reaction to take:
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Pray for Mercy

choices: Stay with Becca for now as she leaves the rest room
Return to Alfie, still a secret
Have Becca reveal you to Alfie
Have Becca place you on the floor while she goes off with Alfie
Tell Becca to send Alfie away; you have more to discuss
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Becca leans closer, her mouth gaping open. "What..."

You give a little bow, more proof of your humanity, and the woman tentatively raises a hand, palm spread like a platform for you to step onto. Obligingly, you walk onto the warm flesh and tense as she brings you closer, looking all over you. You give a twirl, hoping that the first question does not concern your choice of dress nor your bundle of survival supplies. You almost wish you still had your blade, for comfort if not practical use.

"You're... You're a tiny little man.."

Her breath washes over you, and you mime a phone call, emphasising the placement of your hand realtive to your ear.

"Oh! Oh, sure, let's see what you have to say..."

Seems surprise has stunned her enough just to roll along with what's happening... Maybe her emotional distress is stopping her from thinking too clearly right now, and that's all that's keeping you alive. Hopefully it'll last long enough...

The ear of the woman is a cave, of course, but you settle for sitting as best you can in the outer curve. To begin with, you give your name, Becca returning the courtesy clear evidence that she heard you.

Communication with a giantess. It is possible.

"I'm here to apologise," you begin, "See, I've been staying with Alfie, and I've come to care for him and his family. I don't want you to break that up, and that's why I sabotaged your underwear."

Okay, you pretty much admitted everything fairly straightforwardly. Was that the best choice? Damn, you're not thinking at your best right now.

The finger and thumb of Becca snap onto you, lifting you from your seat before her face. She's sobered up some now, and her face, makeup streaked as it is, frowns at you. "You did this? You embarrassed me here at work, in front of everyone, because of Alfie?"

Maybe she can see your nod? She definitely smiles wryly in response, shrugging and throwing her head back. Maybe she just thinks she's gone mad and is rolling with this insanity. Well, whatever gets you through this experience alive.

"I... I suppose I did kinda deserve that. But do anything more like that, and you're getting flushed, buddy."

Seems more than you deserve. Does cuteness buy a lot of forgiveness? Becca is looking at you rather like a woman would a pet, or a beanie baby.

'We good?' you mouth to her, and Becca rolls her eyes in mock thought. Both of you jump at the knocking on the door.

"Becca? You okay in there?" Alfie asks. "I'm worried."

"Poor, sweet boy," Becca sighs, then looks down at you. "But I guess that he is taken. So, what do you want now, little guy?"
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  An Apologetic Ally

choices: Take what you can, give nothing back
Touch nothing, have a little rest
Forget everything but your own immediate survival
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Becca looks down at you impassively as you attempt to mime your intentions, eventually cottoning on only when you jab the forefingers of both hands toward her handbag.

"Ah! You wanna stick with me! No problem, just let me..."

The hand upon which you sit rises, while the other digs in the depths of that distant bag, emerging with some gigantic tools of feminine face decoration. Only then are you lowered into the bag, a voice above you echoing:

"I'm okay, Alfie! I'll be out in a minute, don't worry!"

You jump the hand into the unknown, the woman's personal possessions towering over you. Her hand withdraws, and you can ony imagine her applying herself to fixing her face before going out to face the world again. So, you've been left unsupervised with a bag full of giant treasures... Perfect for scavenging!

Of course, Becca could take it badly if she discovers you stealing from her, so perhaps you should just sit tight here and wait to see what transpires.

Then again, maybe you've already done enough to make Becca really angry, and once she's had time to think she may turn her wrath on you. While she's distracted, you could climb out of here and escape from her...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  First Class Accommodation

choices: Stay with Becca tonight, have her bring you back to Alfie tomorrow
Decide to stay with Becca instead of Alfie and Sarah now
Have Becca leave you in the office overnight
Have Becca take you back to the library
Have Becca take you back to the laboratory
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, no, you're probably overburdened as it is, and still not fully recovered from your injuries. Best not to antagonise a woman that literally has you in a bag.

So you settle down and try to make yourself comfortable, enough padding here from tissues to make a soft bed. In moments Becca opens the sky and her eye make-up drops down like a bomb, thankfully nowhere near you. Her immense face smiles, and she says: "See you after work? Sit tight."

The rocking as she lifts and carries her handbag is relaxing enough that you can catch a little sleep, dream a little dream...

***

"Hit it," you say, and step into the size reducer.

As it shrinks you, the cicular platform beneath your feet rises telescopically in time with your rate of shrinkage; despite an ever-decreasing height, your eye-level remains constant, and the disc beneath your feet always proportional. Your tapered pillar ceases rising as you stop shrinking at three-quarters of an inch, and you speak into your head-set. "It's safe to come in now."

Violett almost runs into the room, her face alive with joy, and you freeze as you witness your first giant. She's still your youthful lab assistant, you tell yourself, dark hair still cut just short enough to brush the collar of her white coat. Yet, magnified to those proportions, she's a terrifying beast that rakes your primordial fears.

"You know," she says as she stops in front of you, "it's quite tempting to pick you up."

"Best avoid that for now, just to be on the safe side," you tell her. "The important thing is that we know a living human can survive the process."

"No trouble breathing? Not too cold? Memory just fine?"

"As far as I can tell. No ill side-effects. Works like a dream."

"Then we can contact some of the buyers, let them know -"

"No. We keep this a secret. Don't you remember what I told you? I'm going to use this to see if I can survive, test myself in the giant wilderness."

Joy leaves her face, replaced with a mild annoyance that her size amplifies to a raging tornado. "Really? Think of what we could do with this! We could make food last longer, reduce prison populations to manageable levels, fight pollution! We could really help the world! Hell, you could RULE the world with technology like this!"

Violett pauses for a moment at her last statement, and raises a finger to point directly at you. A finger thicker than your body, more than capable of crushing you. "But no, you want to use the greatest invention of the millennium to go through a fucking mid-life crisis? Maybe there have been a few side-effects here, screwing with your mind..."

You stand fast. "Violett, no. It's not all about me. I need to see what it's like at this size, what a shrunk person has to live through. I can't let others go through this without being fully aware of the risks myself. And lab conditions are no fair test; it has to be out in the wild, with fully unwitting participants, to account for every variable. I'll keep a journal, note what I discover, and come back once I'm certain that this process is one I can live with subjecting my fellow humans to. Okay?"

Violett folds her arms. "If you come back. I don't know if you've realised, but you're small enough to swallow whole. Lotta animals out there'd like to make a meal of you, and let's not get started on people just stepping on you by accident."

"Like I said, I've got to experience the full range of threats and dangers, really stress test this scenario. You just keep things quiet here, and I'll be back before you know it."

Violett rolls her eyes, but still smiles. "Little kiss for luck, little guy?"

She stands on tip-toes to reach you on your perch, lips pressing together to blanket your vision -

***

You wake with a start before Becca's face, sitting on her hand as she puckers her lips, blowing a strong current of air across you.

"Okay, you're not dead," she says. "That's a relief. Well, I'm clocking off now, so I wondered what plans you had? Alfie's off-limits, I get that, but I know of one man that can't object if I decide to take him home. Still, better give you a little say in the matter..."

She lifts you to her ear, and you can let her know where it is you want to go:
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Violett

choices: Ask for some supplies of food
Ask for some building material
Ask for something to make clothes from
Ask for a replacement weapon / cutting tool
Ask for nothing, since that would be cheating!
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
"Could I, uh, just stay the night with you? Bring me back here to work tomorrow, and I'll head back to Alfie."

"Oh? And why not just go off with him tonight as well, huh?" When Becca speaks with you in her ear, the rumblings through her skull are like a mountain is talking to you.

"I just fancied a change of pace for one night, and it would be rude to just abandon you after putting you through all these shocks. I want to make sure that you're okay."

"Awww, you're sweet. Sure there isn't some other reason you want to go home with an attractive, single woman..?"

"Oh, uh, well, given out current size discrepancy, I don't think it would be too safe to think any further in that direction..."

"Oh! I imagine you're blushing now! Sorry!" Becca's laughter rocks you where you sit. "Well, you won't be much trouble to put up for one night, and I doubt you'll eat me out of house and home. Why not?"

Back to the bag you go, and this time you can't sleep, too riven with thoughts of what may happen now. Putting everything in the hands of this woman - literally - is risky beyond belief. Certainly not something your scientific mind should be doing! As you go over all the ways this could end badly, you are subjected to every movement of the handbag, as she walks and swings it. The shudder as she places it down is the last for a while, but still you can't rest, pacing back and forth and examining all the outsize items in the bag, looking but not touching out of politeness.

In the dark, you still have time to catch up on your journal, describing your latest curious change, and wondering what subliminal thoughts might have directed you down this path. You are not choosing the path most dedicated to preserving your survival; is the human mind too cluttered to dedicate itself thusly? DO the thoughts and drives of your previous, giant life skew your decision-making? Behaving like an animal may not be possible for a great scientist, with decades of casual life behind him. Is a shrunken survival test just too extreme for someone above a certain age?

Musings for another time, as the bag opens after hours, and Becca's hand descends to bring you out.

This must be her home, as she walks across a bare wooden floor, most of the furniture for both a kitchen and a primary living space together. Not a big place, and probably one she lives in alone.

The hand crashes down on the back of a couch, and you scuttle off as she strides away again. She removes her jacket to hang from a wall-hook, rolling up the sleeves of her blouse as she moves to the kitchen. She heats a pan and begins chopping vegetables, the delicious smell of a stir-fry wafting across to you. After so long on subsistence, even this simple meal is like a gourmet feast.

"So," Becca says, not looking up as she casually lifts and destroys food bigger than a house, "little guy like you, there must be some way I can help you in your crazy, survivalist crusade. So, I'll be a generous giant: ask for one thing, and I'll give to you. Just whisper it in my ear."

She casually strolls over, crushing carrot between her teeth as she crouches down, her immense ear dominating your view again.

Well, what will it be? Some more materials to subsist off would be good, as would some materials you could use to build. Maybe just some material to make something other than panties. Your hip still feels naked without a weapon for protection: she must have something that you could replace your machete with.

Unless... Unless this is a test. Maybe you should ask for nothing, and Becca will like you more? Again, not a pure survivalist instinct, but that seems to be where your mind is leading you...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  A Night Off From Survival

choices: Stick to the plan, get back on schedule
Give in to temptation, and live here with Becca
Sneak away from Becca to live like a bug in her home
Ask Becca to return you to the wild
Demand to talk things out with Becca
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
"Well," you begin, dubious of the skin-cave dominating your view, "I did recently lose my blade, which I use as a weapon and for cutting things, so if you could get me a replacement..."

Becca withdraws, and you windmill your arms to prevent from being sucked off the couch by the breeze she creates. Rocking back where she squats, she raises an eyebrow even higher. "Oh? You use it for cutting? Like what you did to my underwear, you little perv? Like what you did..."

She stands, rising in terror as much as stature as she looms, and her hand descends to her thigh. A giant finger pokes through the hole you cut in her tights. It wasn't so big when you made it, when you cut out your sack, but as she pokes through, it tears even wider. To think, it took so much effort to carve through the thread, and now she rips it apart accidentally!

"TO MY TIGHTS!?!"

Her hands move to her hips, and she must be looking down at you sternly from her great height. Now do you realise how different things are between this random encounter with a giant, and the laboratory condition conversation with Violett. How you miss your headset, and the ability to talk back to a creature so immense and powerful!

Laughter booms out from the heavens, and Becca walks back to the kitchen to continue her cooking, lifting and tossing the contents of a pan. "Don't worry about it. But if you want me to arm you, then you're going to have to do me a favour; after we eat."

Becca hums to herself as she cooks, and you cannot talk to her with your diminished voice. Instead, you sit and watch, in awe of her strength as she cooks, marvelling at the sheer quantity of food she intends to devour.

And when she actually begins her feast, you are even more impressed! Sat at her elbow on her small, fold-out table, you can barely take your eyes off her as she forks immense quantities of noodles and vegetables into her maw, crushing then with rapid movements of her jaw, compressed bundles passing through her throat with a noticeable bulge.

For your part, there's no way you'll finish what she has lain before you. With her knife she cut off what she sees as a tiny portion of her own meal, but the oozing food that lies before you must be almost equal to you in mass, more than enough to last you several days!

You pull hunks off with your bare fingers, stuffing your mouth with the first proper food for ages, ignoring the mastication of the gods going on over your very head. It looks no smaller by the time you're finished, and as you sit back Becca's fingers snap around your leavings, lifiting the mass with a simple flick of the wrist to send it tumbling into the oblivion of her stomach.

Giving a burp that rumbles through the table you sit on, Becca pushes her chair back and looks down at you. "So, if you're finished, you can get on with that favour you owe. Just a little thing really, which is just as well for someone as small as you!"

You want to ask more questions, but instead she scoops you into her grasp, and you fight to keep your meal down as she whisks you away at great speed. She crouches over the floor as she lets you tumble free, and raps her knuckles on the floorboards.

"I lost an earring through a hole here. I don't want to go tearing the floor up just to get it back, but skinny little you can climb down and grab it back up for me, cool?"

You look up at her smiling dominance and then to the hole between the floorboards and back. "I'll get you that weapon you wanted if you get me that earring."

You shuck off the greater amount of bags you carry, just yourself in your panty-robe for lightweight ease of movement, and pantomime up at the giantess. Lasso, your waist, pulling on an invisible -

"Rope! Ah, you want me to tie a string to you, so I can pull you out? Sure, I can do that!"

The string that Becca ties around you is almost as thick as your arms, and she pulls it tight enough to leave you gasping. Such is the strength of a simple woman! Well, should be more than able to pull you up when you tug though, right?

Looking down the darkness, it's not too far to the dusty ground. "It's gold, with a dragon design," Becca advises, as if there'll be some Last Crusade variety of artefacts for you to choose from. As an afterthought, she lifts the string, and you with it; you dangle before her face as she nods; "Okay, looks secure enough. Down you go hero!"

Becca crouches, and lowers your lifeline into that darkness with no care. For your part, the unknown holds countless terrors, which you prepare for even as your feet touch the ground.

String continues to feed down, and you have enough to walk along the dusty ground, lit by cracks to the greater world above. Becca shifting her weight - even minutely - creaks the ceiling above, and sends more dust showering down. You hurry onward, knowing that you're safe but still subject to an instinctual fear.

Ahead, the glint of gold, and the earring - shorter than you, must surely heavier than you can carry. Well, Becca can pull it out once you tie the string to it. All you have to do is stride through this particularly thick heap of dust and -

Huh. Your leg is stuck. You shake it back and forth, and while that throws dust aside, it does not break free, merely revealing the thick thread to which it's stuck. Thread... like that of a spider's web!

As if on cue, a near-silent clicking announces the return of the web's creator, alerted by your stuggles. You can still turn your head, to see the many-eyed horror stalking closer, gyrating it fangs. While it's less than half your size, with those mandibles on its side and you lacking a weapon, even were you not webbed you're not confident of victory!

It gets ever closer, in no rush even as you struggle to free your arms and legs, that pink panty clothing a truly shameful death shroud.

Wait! This spider may be able to catch many insects in its web, but not a human, someone who is capable of removing their clothes! You wrench yourself out of the fabric, leaving it hanging from the web while your naked self drops down before the earring. The spider pauses briefly to poke at your discards with a forelimb, before all of its eyes focus on your movements and it hisses.

It advances, deadly intent in every move of its powerful grey legs. You've bought yourself moments, nothing more. You back off on your ass, until you meet the cold metal of the earring, a dead end.

The spider pounces, but you shift, pulling at the jewelry to bring its pin to the fore, piercing and slaying the beast. Odourless fluid leaks from it as it thrashes, before the legs curl in on themselves, and it remains still.

You're owed a few moments of heavy breathing before proceeding. Then you heave the dead arachnid off, pull enough fabric from the web to cover your modesty, and tug on the string, hopefully hard enough for Becca to notice.

The behemoth above dutifully pulls at the string, and you cling tight to the earring as it is dragged along, tearing through the spider-web as if it were tissue paper. You snag some of your clothes as you are whisked by, and duck instinctively just before you would hit a wall, only to lurch upward into the light, and hanging once more before Becca's deific countenance.

"You did it!" she shrills, and pinches the earring from you. You are sent rocking back and forth by her small claim, and then dropped onto a tabletop.

"Well," she says, "I do owe you something, so here's a 'weapon' for you. Hope it isn't too big!"

You look up from your efforts to untie the string, and something metallic flashes before your eyes before thudding down with great weight. It might be a shard of a razor, snapped and broken until it's merely the length of your forearm. It is indeed pretty chunky, a good deal thicker than your own shrunken machete, but it does give you confidence.

Hefting it, you cut through the string in seconds, and beam happily down at the thing. Might this be your new best friend?

"Glad you like it," Becca says. "Now, it's been quite the day, so I think it's just Netflix and chill for me. You don't get a say in the matter, buddy."

This time she does at least lower her hand to the table and wait for you to step aboard before carrying you somewhere, so maybe you're growing on her? Regardless, you are placed on the arm of a chair while Becca settles her gargantuan form into the seat itself, wriggling into comfort while shaking your very world and leaving you fearing she could knock you off. While she sorts through the programming available, you go over your next steps in your head.

You'll stay the night here, a holiday in the presence of a giant knowing of your existence, and then be taken to work tomorrow to get back to Alfie and through him Sarah. You need not get used to this sort of treatment.

But why shouldn't you? This hasn't been bad so far, and what's so bad about living in the care of a giant woman? You could tell Becca that you want to stay with her, and still have your library exit strategy present in case you tire of being small.

Wait, what is this bullshit? You started this to endure tiny survival, not be waited on hand and foot like a Roman Emperor! This is a slippery slope indeed! Perhaps you should cast aside all human aid right now. You could sneak away from Becca now, while she's distracted, and forage from her home without her help. Seems a bit harsh, and if you do care for her feelings, you could just ask her to take you outside, to live in the hostile outdoors.

Or, just forget all these thoughts. Get Becca's attention right now, insist that you both talk rather than 'chill', and determine between you how this is going to go. Now that she's seen a shrunken person her whole world outlook must have changed, and you could help her come to terms with it.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Descent to the Underworld

choices: True to her word, Becca has dropped you off in Alfie's office
For a little payback, Becca has dropped you off in the men's toilets
In disgust, Becca has dropped you off in the garbage
Thinking she's helping, Becca has dropped you off in the cafeteria
Not willing to say goodbye, Becca has dropped you off in her office
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Stretching out, you relax as Becca settles on some exclusive, binge-worthy series and selects play. She's several episodes in, and you had your mind too full of building a physics-defying shrinking machine recently to have been caught up, so most of what happens is incomprehensible to you.

Still, the lost familiarity fo seeing people on people's scale, interacting with each other from a relatable viewpoint, goes some way to salving what little loss you may have felt for your previous existence. It's window into the past, a time before you were a bug to be crushed underfoot by such attractive, successful people.

Becca talks little during the show, content to remain fixated upon it aside from brief swigs of her drink. She was kind enough to provide a thimble-full for yourself, but the strength of the alcohol is too much for your tiny body mass, so you abstain.

Hours pass in chillaxation, changing only when the screen blinks black and Becca roars a yawn of pure exhaustion. Her hand carries you to her bed, but you are placed safely out of sight within a drawer, hope of an escape utterly smashed. It's comfortable here, with unidentifed soft objects in the pitch dark, but you smother any idea of looting from here and get down to sleep. Dreams trouble you with the possibility of Becca simply not releasing you, under no obligation to such a tiny personage, but you only scream yourself awake once during the night.

True day greets you as the floor rumbles, Becca pulling the drawer out and allowing you to see the light, backlighting her beatific smile. Five days now since you left the library, and your three-quarter inch self still has more to experience!

You are left on the dinner table to eat over some crumbs while she gets ready for her day. Effectively a captive audience, you cannot reply as she runs through her routine, her plans and thoughts. None is of interest, and you're glad you're too small to have to nod or grunt agreement with some of her more outrageous opinions. All she is now is transport, and you're glad you didn't give too much consideration to the idea of staying with her forever! You'd have been begging for death within a day!

In time she's applied her face, selected the correct suit and offered her hand for you to climb up. Her last words before you are set into the darkness of her handbag - new weapon and old bags of supplies tucked alongside - are: "Now, keep out of my pants this time."

Indeed, she's wearing a trouser suit today, and some pretty tight-fitting boots over that. It's come to something when a woman goes to such lengths to keep herself safe from you!

Your darkened journey is one of faith, as you have to trust that Becca delivers you to where she had promised - back to Alfie to get on with your life. As it is, when she drops you out and hurriedly walks off, you look about in astonishment.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Downtime to End the Day

choices: Go and bunker up in the briefcase until home time
Approach Alfie with the intention of communicating with him
Steal stuff from Alfie's office
Leave the room to find some more stuff to take
Go and check in on Becca
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Yes, Becca dropped you quite literally. She uncoiled the fingers of her fist, and you rolled off the sloped palm to the carpet, your gathered goods and new weapon in tow. She stomps off immediately, and you look up at the almost-familiar office space of Alfie Gillespie, the man himself dominating your view as he sits at his desk. He turns, so far above, probably wondering at Becca's brief presence, but he never looks down at you.

Past his feet, under his desk, his briefcase sits waiting for you, a means of travelling back to the house, ready for your connecting flight to the library in three days. You can stow goods there, and there's still stuff you can loot from this office before the work day ends.

But... you've already risked so much here, and maybe you'd be best ducking for cover and staying there just to ensure you don't miss Alfie's leaving; it's the weekend tomorrow, and that's a long time to wait here alone.

Why not reveal yourself to the giant? Becca helped, so why not just tell this dude all about you, and make this a lot easier? It would be breaking the cardinal rule of your tiny survival, but Becca has already proven that that isn't the end of the world. Of course, sitting at his feet getting his attention is easier conceptualised than achieved...

The possibilities, man.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  A Gift to a God

choices: Cross through this traffic to get to Becca
Scuttle back into Alfie's office space
Climb aboard the mail-cart
Climb aboard the post-girl
Head off into the post-girl's wake
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
After all she's done for you, you should thank Becca, apologise again. If only there was something you could do for her as a show of gratitude and contrition, but your current condition leaves you unable. Looking across the aisle at the woman in her cubicle, settling her immense ass into an office chair, you have to hope that words will be enough.

At the moment, the only suppliers you carry are your hair ropes, the bundle of material from the woman's tights and your new razored blade - you're not weighed down much at all, and have plenty of space to carry any new supplies you happen across. Let's go.

What would take a human mere moments to walk is a brisk journey for you, and you're not even out of Alfie's doorway when the sound of the world ending brings you to a halt. Thunderous wheels roll across the carpet, crushing all in their path. You dash backward, and the cart rolls to a stop neatly blocking the way between the two workers.

It's not like the stroller you rode a few days ago, with its wheels smaller and thinner. In shape its an immense wireframe cuboid, a pair of shelves connected by towering poles at each of its corners. You cannot see the upmost surface, but the lower holds a smattering of large, flat sheets, mostly dirty brown, a few white -

It's the mail trolley. The person pushing this contraption is here to delivers internal and external letters to the staff. Looking to the left, you see the gigantic shoes of the lowly employee who pushed it here, stooping to retrieve letters to give to either Alfie or Becca. She's young, just starting out in this business - whatever this business may be - and yet another awe-inspiring obstacle for you to overcome. Running past her to get to Becca does open up the possibility that she may step on you, or roll the cart over your fragile form.

Maybe you should just head back to Alfie, play it safe...

Then again, you've got a whole work day to play with here, and a light inventory. You could scale this vehicle and ride it out, perhaps even rummaging through some of the letters yourself. If that's too risky, perhaps you could get onto the post-girl herself! Or else roll in the opposite direction to where she's going, to explore the office in places that're definitely safe from her rolling path of destruction.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  The Morning Post

choices: IT Department
Management
Accounts
Human Resources
None of the above
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
The still structure is simple to scale: your hair-rope allows you to scramble up to the lower tray easily enough, and there's even a metal wall around the edge to keep you from falling as the mail-girl begins pushing the vehicle again.

As the world speeds by, you sit back and think about how this could affect the new world your shrinking device will create. Having regular-sized humans serving as transporters will be very efficient; think of the mass-transit possibilities! You're already scribbling a few ideas into your journal, but you stop once you realise you've begun doodling the uniforms these titans would wear - a mixture between a fairy-tale giant and a bellhop.

Bringing yourself back to real-life, you note that the cart stops several times, but each time the massive woman in control takes only from the upper surface of the trolley. As you watch her enormous trousers walk away to another desk, you wonder why that is. Clearly the contents of this trolley are organised so that she works her way through first the upper tiers, then this bottom row. Given that you can't see the top of this strucutre, you don't know how much there is for her to go through, before she stoops down here and her hands invade your personal space.

Oh well; you can't affect it, so no need to worry! Instead, you consider the gigantic envelopes looming over you, seeing who has post on their way. A large manilla envelopw bulges with some large item within, no doubt shrouded in bubble wrap. Large, simple letters address this to the IT department.

A more formal-looking white envelope is addressed to management, neatly printed text wasting no space.

On its way to accounts is a gridded re-usable office envelope. Many addresses before that one have been scrubbed off with powerful strokes of a black marker, and it stinks of the dozens of sweaty hands that have passed it around over the months.

Lastly, a box of office supplies seems to headed on its way to human resources.

If you wanted, you could secrete yourself atop one of these pieces of post, and be taken to that department with it. What materials you could harvest could be deduced fairly easily. Wow, this is like the transport system working in your favour already!

The risk - besides that of being spotted by the mail-girl, or the unknown of these office rooms - is that it may prove difficult or impossible to get back to Alfie before the end of the work day. Mabe you should just play it safe, and not go off to these paces...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  Just Off to the Post

choices: Becca spots you, and points you out to her friends
Becca spots you, and gets the others to leave
Sandals spots you, and stomps on the bug she sees
Boots spots you, and kicks away the bug she sees
Alfie walks in, and redeems yesterday's failure by stepping on the bug - YOU!
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, you're deep enough in this giant office complex without adding a further vertical layer to things. You'll take what you can from this cargo and be on your way.

You carve into brown envelope, the thick material strong and sturdy. Below, clear plastic bubble wrap covers a precious cargo, and you carve away at that as well. Besides a roll of helpful plastic, you recover a complete bubble; should you manage to store and keepm this safely, you look forward to it serving as a pillow in future!

As the vehicle shudders to a stop, and the giant driver stomps away again, you drop over the edge and to the carpet. With the simple design of the cubicles, there's a wide, clear aisle to walk back down toward your origin. The giants are mainly concerned with their recent deliveries and so don't venture out from their lairs.

Of course, what took the mail-girl moments will take three-quarter inch you a lot, lot longer.

You're barely a quarter of the distance and the ground quakes. You duck low as two pairs of feet smash by around and over you, two giants that you can only identify as 'boots' and 'sandals'. One impacts right beside you, a near miss that sends you skittering through the carpet strands before being lifted up in the wake of the woman's next step, carried on the wind for moments before she outdistances you with her tireless, titanic tread.

They are shrinking into the distance as you struggle to your feet, and by the time you feel up to resuming your hike, they've vanished from sight. Just a reinforcement of your conclusion that the office is too populated for tiny survival; a handful of people you can handle, the dozens of individual god-beings stomping around this realm is insurmountable.

Yet no more crash past you, so maybe the ordeal is over for the moment. Panting, you complete your journey as you lean on the corner of the entrance to Becca's cubicle. You peer around to see what she's doing.

Boots and Sandals made it here before you, the two giantesses standing as they talk with the seated Becca. Their words thunder above you, but you can make out words here and there, and the longer you listen, the higher your heart rises.

The two newcomers are surprised by Becca's announcement that she's giving up on chasing Alfie! Good for her!

"But why?" asks Sandals.

"Well, Sophie, let's just say that I had a little meeting with another man last night..."

"Oh!" laughs Boots, "don't leave us hanging!"

You feel a grin form on your face. A good impression. You step forward, ready to meet again with the woman you spent last night with. Just to say goodbye, or something more? You're not thinking too clearly as you walk across the floor...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  I'll Walk Back, Thanks

choices: You turn and run out of the room
You run to Becca, the one giantess you can trust, or at least know
You wave up at Sandals, hoping she is placated
You run to the knee of Boots for shelter
You collapse and play dead
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
"Speak of the devil!" Becca exclaims. "Were your ears burning, love?"

You freeze, looking up at the trio of women. Becca's eyes are focussed directly on you, having watched you walk across the open floor. The eyes of the other two are cast far above you, looking to the doorway as if expecting to see a regular human male walk in to the cubicle.

"No, no, girls," Becca laughs. "When I said I had a 'little meeting' last night, I was being literal."

The floor quakes as Boots and Sandals shift position, looking around before finally following Becca's gesturing finger down to little ol' you. Their immense feet flex, and twin gasps whistle down from overhead.

"No, no, he's not a bug!" Becca claims. "Take a closer look!"

Boots takes one crushing step forward, the better to bring her towering body down on one knee. You back away, only to be thrown into shadow as Sandals simply crouches on the spot, her toes pressing firmly down as they support her looming over you. You turn to look up, and your humanoid movements bring another gasp from her.

"Oh, wow!" she exclaims. "I want one!"

That's not good. This is just the reason why you planned to keep your shrinking secret; should you be exposed, you're fully at the mercy of these giant beasts. Revealing yourself to Becca was a mistake.

But how can you get out of this situation?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5: Exposed to the Giants

choices: Go and see what it is she's typing, get an idea for what this busienss does
Look around the desktop for stuff to salvage
Try to scale the giant, to get to her ear and communicate
Throw caution to the wind and try to get down from here and escape
DO as you're told, and sit quiet and meek, watching her strength and speed
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
You dash towards Becca's gigantic feet, and hear her chuckle above you as she stoops down, throwing you into shadow. "I know buddy, you like me. But it's about time you got out there and met new people!"

Her fingers pluck you from the floor, but even as you are whisked into the air by her fathomless power, you realise the truth of her words. She leans forward, and as her fingers release you drop onto the warm skin of Sandals' cupped palm.

"There!" Becca says triumphantly, as you roll onto your back and look up into thedelighted face of a gargantuan stranger. "Say hello to Sophie, who'll be looking after you for a while!"

Sophie grins down at you with large, uneven teeth, probably not knowing what to say to a three-quarter inch tall man in her hands. You're equally at a loss, all thoughts of fighting for your own survival lost as your fate is entirely given over to these gods, these giants.

Sophie begins to walk, and you roll in her loose grasp, a creased plain of blood-warmed skin. The passing office world is hidden from you by the wall her fingers form, and you must simply sit and wait.

In time the giantess sits, and the back of her hand crashes down on a tabletop, the fingers lowering and splaying like a ramp. Jogging down from your living vehicle, you marvel once again at the humungous office equipment looming over you. Sophie scooches her chair forward and leans over to resume typing away at her keyboard.

"I'm a little busy right now," she informs you, "so just try to keep yourself out of trouble. I don't want to have to explain to Becca that I had to call a vet for you!"

She pays no further attention as her fingers smash into the keys with thunderous forcre and rapid pace, but then she does have a birds'-eye view of the area, so if you try to sneak away she will spot you doing so. So, what are your plans now?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  Strive to Survive your Own Stupidity

choices: Tell Becca that you don't want to leave her
Tell Becca that you want to have a second date with her
Tell Becca that you want her to take you to the library
Tell Becca that you want her to go shopping
Tell Becca that you want her to go ahead with her original plans
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
You just stand there, in the middle of her cubicle floor, and gaze up at the indomitable form of Becca as she holds court. She is blushing at Boots' comment, lowering her eyes as she does so, and those optics widen as she clearly spots you. A gasp, and she looks up to her colleagues quickly.

"Well, back to work, girls. Can't sit here chatting all day!"

Somewhere far above, the two standing goddesses exchange a glance. "Wow, this man really has changed you! Unless you're just getting us out of here so you can spend a little facetime with him..." Boots says.

"Anyway, we'll see you tonight, yeah?" Sophie adds.

"Well, no, something else just came up."

"Ooh!" the two chorus, before turning and stomping out of the cubicle, their gigantic feet passing dangerously close once again, before they are gone.

The world continues to shake though, as Becca jumps to her knees before you, clasping you in her cupped hands before she sits again, all over the course of a second or two of time. Your head spins as she spills you onto the surface of her desk, and then her elbows slam down either side of you.

Her face lowers before you, her tongue licking at the back of her teeth before she speaks. "Couldn't stay away, huh? Well, since I just cancelled my plans for Friday night, you'd better have a good alternative in mind, big boy!"

Looking up into her huge, expectant visage, you run over the options. To go with her, to commit to a life with a larger lady rather than one of tiny survival, would be a massive commitment. Maybe you should just start small - no pun intended - and paint tonight as a 'second date' of sorts, where the two of you can decide if you can truly stand each other.

Of more importance than that, your shrinking machine is still in the library. Maybe you should first set your sights on securing it before you worry about your life in the future!

Or are you committed to your fate of tiny survival? This is but a brief detour, and you will return to your small life of loneliness soon enough - you'll just take advantage of this chance to have Becca buy you some supplies.

This is all very selfish, of course. Why not ask Becca to continue with the plans she had for tonight, and just tag along with ehr on her girls' night out? No reason for you to dramatically change her life, right?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  I Can't Keep Away From You

choices: Set to the Herculean task of making a sandwich for Becca
Make a small sandwich for Becca
Climb down from here and go about surviving
Climb down from here and travel to Becca on the couch
Sit and do nothing in protest until Becca awakens again
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
"Ooh!" Becca smiles. "Glad I cancelled my plans, then! Now, you sit tight in here, for now!"

Her hands funnel you into her handbag, out of sight of any other giants and safe. As before, you restrain yourself despite the treasure trove of loot around you; you need to be on best behaviour for your date!

Using the humungous hand mirror in here, you look yourself over. Your clothes are rags, and you hair is a mess. Hopefully, your three-quarter inch stature will hide most of these details. Even if it doesn't, there's nothing much you can do about it now!

In time, the world shudders around you as Becca hefts her bag, but it's not until you're placed down beside her in the passenger seat of her car that she speaks with you.

"Well, I'm guessing you don't have any cash to wine and dine me," she correctly states, while keeping her eyes fixed on the road, "so I think we should take this back to my place. Normally I wouldn't do this on a second date, but you've already been there once before!"

At her home, she removes you from the bag, transferring you to her kitchen counter. While you orient yourself and catch your breath, she casually strolls around, opening cupboards far above your reach. "I cooked yesterday, so it's only fair you feed me tonight. Now, I don't expect much, so I'll have a quick nap while you whip me up a sandwich! Deal?"

Interspacing her words, she slams items down on the counter, until you are surrounded by gangantuan cutlery and food. Through a small gap you can see her kick off her shoes and stretch out on the couch.

Looking up at the great loaf, you wonder how she expects you to accomplish this task. It would be so much effort to cut through that bread, let alone get some slices of that ham, or of that tomato! Maybe it's the effort alone that she wants to see, of your devotion to her?

Or you could have a joke with her. She never said how BIG a sandwich to make, so you could just create one sized for you and offer it up! Surely she'll see the funny side?

Why play along at all? Now you're in her house, and she's asleep, you could sneak down from here and get to looting her home, perhaps making a little nest for yourself and continue your tiny survival.

The possibilities stretch before you more than even that great boiwl of salad.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  Man, the Provider

choices: You use the machine to restore your size
You use the machine to reduce Becca to your scale
You ask Becca to leave you here and go
You ask Becca to take you and the device home with her
You ask for Becca's help in relocating your camp for better survival
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Becca withdraws her ear, and her face is quizical as she looks down at you. "The library? Hardly the most romantic spot I could think of. Oh, well, what's the harm?"

Her thick fingers pinch you up effortlessly, bearing you toward her monitor. They release you to drop onto a furry surface, some googly-eyed mascot whose adhesive feet stick it the side of the screen's frame. You sit there in comfort as the giantess gives you a thin smile and returns to her work.

She makes and answers calls, rummages throug paperwork, types at her keyboard with bone-breaking power. You hope you're doing the right thing here. It's a big step, trusting someone with the secret of the super-science that you created. And why? Is this all just guilt over what you did to her? Or is this just another layer of your experiment, seeing how someone may react to such news?

These thoughts and more whirl through you as you take a rare moment of rest, content to just observe the ordinary in the immense.

The end of the work day is heralded by Becca reaching toward you, plucking you up to be whisked once more to her carvernous ear. After so long without communicating, you give her a brief "Thank you," as you settle down.

Then she's walking, and you split your attention between the dark, hair-lined cave of her ear and the blurred outside and outsize world passing by. When at last she slams into her car seat and pulls across a seatbelt, you have a proper chance to relish the skin ledge to which you cling, and Becca can finally speak to you without fear of an audience.

"This better be worth it, little guy. Spending Friday night without getting myself totally shit-faced is going to ruin my weekend."

"It'll be great, don't worry. You've got to see what I have to show you."

"I'm all aquiver," she whispers, gyrating for a moment where she sits before keying the ignition and setting off.

The journey is swift, and soon you are witnessing the great opening of the library building from another angle, an impressive number of giants passing in and out, no doubt eager to grab a new novel to see them through the next week.

"Adult Romance," you instruct your ride, and Becca can't suppress a giggle. "Something to get me in the mood, huh?"

Soon you can the stacks passing by as if you were in a helicopter flying through skyscrapers. The new angle takes a bit of getting used to, but soon enough you get your bearings and stop Becca's walking with a sudden kick.

"Ow!"

"Sorry; Werewolf Lovers IX, that's the one we want."

"That's some freaky shit. The series went downhill after number four."

Still, her hand reaches up to the second-from-top shelf, grabbing both the book and the small device sitting in its shadow. "And what have we here?" she queries.

"A machine capable of altering the size of people and objects," you say simply. Her stunned silence is all the reply you need, and indeed expected.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  An Example of True Trust

choices: Violett leaves you here and leaves the library
Violett picks you up to take with her
Violett grows you back to normal, but retains control
Violett shrinks you even smaller
Violett tries to kill you
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No need to keep track of days anymore; you have no deadline for returning to the library, as here you are! At your direction, Becca places you and the device on the floor, her immense feet stepping backward so that she can can a better view.

Cranking a few dials, you smile at the surprise she's about to get. A little perspective should help her appreciate what you go through daily, very important for a three-quarter inch tiny survivalist.

You smash the big, red button and jump aside as the shrinking beam lashes out, enveloping the titaness before you. The bright light blinds you, and so you miss the process of her decreasing in size, seeing only the result as she has dwindled to under your own height. You dash across the carpet toward her, through the small valleys created by her previously massive feet, and help her up.

"Hey, you're big again!" she laughs, and for once her face is a complete delight. Previously even her glee had been terrifying, but now she's on equal terms, no longer an all-powerful being.

"Look again," you tell her, pulling her forward to take in the skyscraper bookshelves.

"I've shrunk? A little warning would have been nice, you jerk!" Mockingly beating a tiny fist on your chest, she stops to examine your panty overshirt. "What is that you're wearing?"

"Hey, I had to make do," you say, resolving not to show her the sack you made from her tights.

"Well, we'll have to see about getting you some decent duds! No man of mine is going around dressed in rags!"

"No man of yours..?"

"Don't play dumb," Becca says, taking charge and smiling up at you with lidded eyes. "Why else would you get jealous of Alfie and me? Why would you make us the same size? Why would you do all this on a Friday night?"

Admittedly, you have no answer, but you can say nothing as she sweeps you into a kiss. The woman is smaller than you now, but still she wields far more power. Following her lead, you lose track of time as your mouths explore each other, backing into the machine as Becca peels your sorry clothing off you.
