With the panty-rag serving as a blanket, the two of you sink into the horizontal, wasting no time with words. The world moves for you: but that could just be the tread of passing giants, as the two insect-people, so far beyond the world's notice, find comfort in each others' arms.

***

You open your eyes. All that exertion must have tired you out, sent you straight to sleep; tiny people don;t have the greatest amount of stamina. Scratching idly, you look across to Becca, snoring contentedly. This was certainly not a result that you had forseen when you began this experiment! You'll have to make new plans for where to go forward here, and reach for your notebook.

As you look away from Becca, you notice the immense eye looking down at the two of you, focussed intently. Instincively, you freeze, and the burning breath of the giant washes over you as it talks.

"I knew you couldn't resist using the device again! Gave me a chance to narrow down my search a lot!"

It's Violett, your young lab assistant. She hadn't been too happy with your plans for the device, which is why you didn't tell her you'd taken the machine last week. Perhaps she's not too happy about that? You need to reach the machine-

Violett's gigantic fingers lock around the machine and effortlessly lift it from the ground. "Yoink," she says. "Now I can put this to some proper use. Who knows what might have happened if you'd gotten yourself killed, lost this thing? You're a shitty scientist."

She settles her gaze on you, her brow furrowing. "But you did teach me so much. Hmm. What should I do with you..?"
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: Be Small Together

choices: Tell Becca flat-out
Distract her with sex
Offer to take her hunting for food
Lie about the machine needing time to charge
Tell her that you don't want to grow back
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Violett considers for a second more, smooth brow creased in thought. Then she brightens and smiles. "Hey! No need to do anything, right? You wanted this, to be small, and now you have a little buddy to share it with. Good for you! You get on with that, and I'll get back to saving the whole world. I'll be sure to credit you when I accept my Nobel prize."

She rises to her impossible, intimidating height, and rips off a salute with her free hand. "Best of luck to you in your new life."

The ground rumbles as the woman's steps stomp away, and behind you a far smaller female mumbles as she is woken by them. "Huh? Whazzat?"

You cross to Becca, and once she focuses on you she kisses you. "Hmm. Might be the size that makes you so hot."

"All that weight you lost looks good on you."

Laughing, she bats at you with one hand. "Well, unless you've got some food stashed among these dust bunnies, what say we grow backand catch some breakfast?"

Hmm. How to break the news that you're both stuck like this forever..?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: No More Safety Net

choices: Let Violett grab you
Run away from Violett, abandoning Becca
Draw your weapon and cut Violett
Run to Becca to wake her
Dodge Violett's hand, try to get her to listen to what you have to say
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
"Well, we never did finish that battery of tests, did we?" Violett smirks. "And with two of you now, I can compare results, see if there are any differences based on an individual's physiology. First up, let's see if you're tough enough to resist being picked up..."

The woman's free hand descends toward you, fingers and thumb spreading wide to grab you. She's moving slowly, maybe to avoid startling you, but if she gets her hand on you you'll be nothing but an experiment. You should run - but then you'd be abandoning Becca to suffer in your place! What to do, what to do?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: Test Subjects

choices: Keep Becca asleep and follow Violett
Awake Becca while you follow Violett
Stop and demand that Violett restore Becca
Sneak away with Becca while Violett's back is turned
Leave Becca here while you follow Violett
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
"Well, you are a half-decent engineer," Violett mulls, standing with another great rumble through the floor. "You might be useful to have around if something goes wrong."

Once again you are blinded as the machine's energies coil around you, your vision clearing to find yourself looking down on the woman again, restored to your original height.

"Now," she says, holding up a finger, "before you think of trying anything, bear in mind that I hold the power now, this lil' machine in my hand. Let's get back to the lab and work on the next step of my plan. Don't forget your little friend!"

Becca! You crouch over the tiny woman, still somehow sleeping blissfully. She's so delicate, you hesitate to pick her up, cupping your hands around her protectively.

"Can you please restore her as well?"

"Not right now. She's a wild card, might not be as docile as you. Bring her back to the lab with us and we'll see."

Violett's already heading toward the exit from the library, and you spare one glance down at the fairy-like female in your palm. Her breathing sends the tiniest thrill through your skin...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: Demotion

choices: Run, run away from here
Push forward to get to Violett
Remain calm, adapt to surviving this new challenge
Concentrate on calming Becca
See if you can call in your drone
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
"Tell you what," Violett says, standing to her full, towering height. "I won't kill you. In fact, I'll give you an even bigger survival challenge."

The device is far out of sight, but you recognise the movements of the woman's wrists all too well, and how futile it would be to scream your defiance at her. Yet still you shriek, and Becca grabs at you, rudely awakened and wondering what's happening.

"I'm sorry I dragged you into all this," you tell her, hugging her close as the size-changing energies engulf the two of you. You dwindle, smaller than ever before, and as you stumble to your feet, you can barely recognise your surroundings. Carpet fibres loom like close-packed skyscrapers, and the even greater form of Violett is out of sight above them!

What can you do now, smaller than is visible to the naked eye?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: Survival in an Even Bigger World

choices: Run for your life beneath a bookshelf
Dash to wake Becca up
Fall to your knees and beg before Violett
Activate your failsafe
Hold Becca in your arms, accept death together
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
"Well," Violett says, rolling her eyes in thought, "you did leave those e-mails automated to let everyone think you're still out there. No-one will miss you, thanks to the effort you yourself put in. No-one but me, worried sick this past week, unable to tell anyone, with our co-life's work gone!"

She's looking down at you now, great tears goring at the edges of those vast eyes. "You didn't spare a thought for me, did you? It was your experiment, your machine, your desires that mattered! Well, now it's mine, and I can move on with my life without you in it. You want to vanish, to be forgotten? I can help you with that."

With exaggerated slowness the woman rises to stand, and you are all-too aware of how massive her shoes are, and the weight they can bring to bear. You could run, now, a slight head start maybe enough to save you from being crushed. But Becca is still asleep, and you can't abandon her!

Can you?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: Inevitable Betrayal

1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Sophie does not telegraph her action. Why should see? She spots a bug on the floor, and merely deals with it, a subtle shift of her foot all that it takes.

From your perspective, the sky is briefly shadowed by the immensity of the sandal's sole. In the fraction of a second that it takes to descend, you have no time to reflect on the terrible idea of moving so openly while attempting tiny survival.

Then you are crushed utterly beneath her weight.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  End of Days

choices: Back to the briefcase
Off to see Becca
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
You've been too secure in the assumption that your three-quarter inch form is invisible to the naked eye. You are brought crashing back to reality hard by the quick snap of Boots', well, boots. She lashes out one foot with a speed too quick for your eyes to register. Yet your body registers the impact all too well.

Your body crumples in reaction to the immense power of the woman, bones shattering, organs bruising and bursting, senses overloading your brain. Consciousness shuts down for your own protection as your shattered form is carried through the air by the godlike force of Boots. When you crash down on the carpet again, you finally pass out.

***

Awakening, you find blood dripping from your face. You can move, but every motion is agony, and when your eyes open your vision is blurry. Lying on the office floor, you're all but inviting someone to step on you, either purposefully or just by accident. You've got to move, as much as it hurts! If you can get back to the briefcase, you can shelter and recuperate within its shadowy confines.

Or... You could head back to Becca. If she sees you like this, she's sure to help you out!
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  Pain Beyond Anything Heretofore Known to Man

choices: Dispense tiny justice to Alfie!
Climb into Alfie for transport
Head through the office back to Alfie's briefcase
Climb onto Becca for transport
Head off into Becca's handbag
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
So focussed on the talk of these three women are you, you forget that your three-quarter inch self is far from invisible. The ground quakes beneath the tread of another giant, and Alfie's voice cuts in above:

"I didn't get that bug yesterday, but I can make it up to you by getting this one."

It's enough of a warning for you to get moving, sprinting full-out toward the distant form of Becca, soon blasted off your feet at the incredible impact of the man's shoe stomping down behind you. You tumble forward in the wake of Alfie's step, rolling along the dusty carpet while the macro world above explodes above you.

"A bug? Ugh, call me when you've got rid of it!"

"Hey Alfie, maybe we'll leave the two of you alone..."

"No! Don't kill it! You don't know if it might be -"

The world shakes more as those massive people move, and the only one you can really see is Becca, lifting her immense form to step over you, leaving her and Alfie behind you now, the others leaving. Rolling onto your back, you take in the conversation of giant man and woman...

"It might be what?"

"Oh, nothing, Alfie. Good thing you came by, though... I wanted to apologise."

"For what? What do you ever have to apologise for?"

"My behaviour... When I tried to... Um. You and me..."

"Oh? Why would I mind that?"

"Well, you have Sarah, and it's your anniversary tomorrow..."

"No need to remind me. It's so stifling... Just for one night, I'd like a little freedom..."

Looks like those two living skyscrapers are almost... embracing? Can it be? After all that effort you went to to 'punish' Becca for this, now Alfie himself is encouraging this extra-marital activity! At least it seems like he's no longer interested in crushing the bug at his feet, so you're safe for now.

Balling your fists as you stand, you feel like you should do something. Staring up at the immense form of Alfie, you let your rage be tempered by your fear; still, you could pay him a similar visit to the ine you gave Becca, crawl onto him and somehow embarrass him as payback for this, push him back to Sarah.

Without that risk though, you could just climb aboard the behemeth and stick with him, let this cheater take you home with him to Sarah and the familiar house. No need to get onto him personally, though: you could scamper back to his cubicle and mount the briefcase again.

Or do you need to talk with Becca again, now? Her foot is right there too, and you could climb onto her for a discussion a little later. If you don;t want to get between these two conspirators right now, you could just head off to her handbag, where it lies beside her empty chair.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  Betrayal?

choices: Check on the workplace gossip
Scavenge some more supplies
Just go and sit quietly in the briefcase
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, no, you can't get involved with this. Rvealing yourself to Becca was already a step too far for a tiny survivor. You have to place yourself above these giants - as weird as that sounds. Their soap-opera lives are meaningless compared to your raw struggle just to live! You must stick to the shadows, and not concern yourself with what petty matters the society that you abandoned treasures so highly.

So, you creep at the edges of the cubicle, well clear of the immense, stomping feet of both Becca and Alfie. Who knows why they're standing so close, what they're talking about in the heights of the sky? Who cares?

Not you! You stride purposefully out into the corridor, Alfie's cubicle just across the way, and the briefcase that will deliver you back to the house is within. You just have to climb up inside and let the work day end.

Chatter still thunders out here, and looking to the left you see the gigantic boots and sandals of Boots and Sandals. They are pretty distant, but on their scale haven't walked far, and must be discussing what is going on behind you. Such juicy gossip you could spy on...

No! What are you thinking? You're not one of them anymore, not one of the big, powerful creatures who have so established themselves as dominant that they have nothing better to do than indulge in trivialties of relationships.

You have your survival to think on. And turning to the right you can see a discarded coffee carton, alongside a crushed peanut packet. Some lazy asshole dropped their rubbish here! That's something you can look through for some supplies, and just hope that no danger comes along again...

Is that, too, a temptation you should resist? Play totally safe, head back to the briefcase, exit with as much grace as possible...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  Back Off, Never Engage With Giants

choices: You go to see how Sarah is
You get ready to steal some food from the giants' dinner table
You follow Alfie, to learn more about him
You head off to a place you have not yet explored
Still in isolation, you just hide on the stroller
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, this was all a mistake. You have barely gathered anything from the office, and exposed yourself to the greatest danger yet. A perfect lesson in avoiding populated areas. Best you keep your head down in Alfie's briefcase for now, and get transported back to a house of three giants.

It's calm as you re-enter the man's cubicle, and stride across to the massive form of his luggage. It takes quite a while at your size, plenty of time to think.

Is the library itself too populated? The unpredictable nature of the giants that frequent it poses just as big a risk as this office space. Add to that your foolish first choice of camp space, and maybe an argument could be made for packing up from there and moving on. Once Sarah takes you back there, why not re-locate, taking the shrinking device with you elsewhere?

Are you just getting overly fond of the small giant family? Looking for any excuse to stay around them for longer?

You creep into the dark of the briefcase's exterior, the growing hunger of your belly causing you to seek out the lunch that was packed for Alfie by his loving wife. The loving wife whom he has just betrayed.

As you use the blade that Becca - the very woman with whom Alfie's betraying Sarah - gave you to slice open the clingfilm, you wonder how much you should care. The giants are both above and beneath you. Above, due to their size and power, and beneath since their petty concerns matter not to your quest for tiny survival.

You nibble away a the sandwich, the quantity you take impossible to be noticed by the giant. He will remain oblivious, as you engorge yourself on this free meal. Let him remain ignorant... and you should probably resist the urge to inform his wife of his misdemeanour. It will do nothing to aid your survival chances. Their relationship does not matter to you.

Burping and wiping crumbs away, you scuttle back to your hiding spot as a god cracks light into your dark world, his great hand reaching down to grasp the giant sandwich, to eat in a few bites what would last you months. Your view of him is limited, but you can imagine a shit-eating grin on his face, the after-glow of his liason with Becca lighting it up. The very thought sickens you!

Sarah has helped you so much, even in ignorance, while Becca went so far as to make you feel pity for her despite being everything you assumed she was. Sarah deserves your pity, your love! She deserves to know this!

The briefcase clicks closed, and trapped once more in darkness, you curl up and force yourself to rest. Cast these thoughts from your mind, lose yourself in slumber to conserve energy. Looks like the biggest detriment to your survival chances is the same as your biggest asset: your human brain.

Sure, your mind allows you to think in ways that no mere animal would, but it also has a tendency to wander, to become fixated on irrelevant matters to distract you from the important matters!

Strangely enough, this debate in your mind leaves you no time to rest. By the time Alfie lifts your world on his journey home, you are running circles in your mind, and when everything thuds back to the ground again you grab up your prizes - your replacement weapon, the coffee bean, the metal - and exit.

Back into the Gillespie household, you watch Alfie stride away, the monstrous dog leaping up to get his attention, earning a pat to the head, much scratching behind the ears.

You have a few moments to yourself. You should stow your supplies up on the stroller, but what then?

What then?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5: Lessons Learned

choices: Cut the girl with your blade
Try to squeeze yourself from her fingers
Make an effort to communicate
Reach for your rope, tie yourself securely
Leave what follows up to the giant
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
With your ropes you return to your perch on the stroller, adding to your stash your office souvenirs: the metal staple, the coffee bean... The bags of Becca's tights you keep close, far better quality than the plastic ones you've been using up til now.

All the while, the backing track to your exercise, pulling yourself up to a height with a mighty load, and descending again once relieved, is the thunderous movement of giants. They continue with their ordinary lives while you struggle with yours, and long, long minutes have passed by the time you re-enter the kitchen, timidly poking your head out to see what's going on.

The dog has returned to its basket, and Aflie stands by the counter, no doubt cooking dinner for the family. How caring of him, as if that small act can make up for what you've seen him do!

Simmering where you stand, you watch Sarah's immense feet stomp over to her husband, no doubt putting her arms around him as she gets so close, maybe nuzzling at him from behind in appreciation. Sure, it's their anniversary tomorrow, but she doesn't know what he did.

You do. You know, but you force yourself not to care. The lives of these giants are of concern only where they can be of benefit to your tiny survival. Their feelings you shouldn't care for. You can't eat their feelings, can't keep yourself warm with their emotions.

You leave the loverbirds to what they imagine to be their alone time, beginning your trek across the kitchen. There will be food here soon, but only at the same time as hungry and dangerous giants whose danger will outweigh the benefit. Better to scavenge from this area later; there will be plenty of scraps for you to pick at in the aftermath, once the room is empty.

No, now is the time to explore a greater area of this house. There must be treasures untold of, waiting for your keen eye to find!

The vast portal to the hallway is the first step, the living room across the way, and the bedrooms further down the end. Sarah steps over you as you cross the threshold, swiftly pounding vibrations through the ground as she walks back to the living room. Picking yourself up, you turn to move away from these two giant-inhabited areas, down toward the bedrooms and bathroom, where you can be alone and free to steal.

More rumblings ensue behind you, but you pay no attention. Giants will be giants, and giants are noisy. You focus on the door at the corridor's end, already running over the method you will deploy to bypass it. You pause at one point for a brief rest, such is the length of this trip!

Still, you struggle onwards, ignoring the noises until a foot suddenly explodes right before you, heel slamming to carpet before launcing off and bearing its owner to the end of the corridor in mere seconds. From your hands and knees, you see the being that has overtaken you stumble against the door with a crash, swivelling one eighty and laughing, clapping her hands.

That's right, Sarah's daughter just toddled down this corridor faster than you could walk! Her clap is echoed, and you see the mother crouched at the other end of the hallway, encouraging the girl's stumbling, world-shaking steps.

Dear lord, the girl is going to head back again!

Prostrate before the child-god, you pray that she misses you with her feet. As a two-year old, she's under three feet in height, hardly the most intimidating of creatures. But with your own six foot three frame shrunk to three quarters of an inch, the world about you has swollen to one hundred times its normal proportion. Thus: terror.

Her steps are not the predictable, easily-avoided straight path of an adult, instead wavering side to side with the uncertain mind of a child. The feet still shudder down with enough weight to annihilate you, but with no hope of predicting which way in which you should dodge.

But all is not well. Her swift turn at the door has unbalanced her, and the towering toddler falls, her shadow swallowing you up!

The floor shudders more than ever, but you live. The girl looms above you, her hands planted either side. She caught herself just in time, but her great, flabby face is right above you, her ignorant eyes widening at the sight of you.

Crap.

She pushes herself back, and you turn to run, but her clammy hand clutches around you, clapping shut like a vice. From the shoulders up you protrude from her grip, your arms hammering helplessly against her iron-strong skin.

Again she giggles, and in the background you can hear some mild concern from Sarah at the thought of her fallen daughter.

You need to get out of here. You do have the weapon Becca gave you, and could cut away at the girl. The pain should get her to release you, but can you bring yourself to harm a child, even one as gargantuan and dangerous as this?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  In the Clutches

choices: Look in the wardrobe
Climb the bedside table
Explore under the bed
Check out the electronics on a cabinet
Spell out a message to communicate
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
That massive face looming above you, blooming with ignorant joy, is not a child. You have to throw that impression from your mind, and see her as the pure destructive force that she is. To a three-quarter inch tall man, she's a monster, a beast to be avoided if one is to survive.

While the girl's fingers hold you tight, your own grip the blade that Becca gave you. With all your strength, you rip it across the clammy skin of this giant, gouging through skin cells that explode into the air before your tiny eyes. Yet once it's done, you can barely see a mark; you certainly haven't drawn blood, perhaps nothing more than merely scraped her slightly! Wow, you're so pathetic now that you can't even hurt a child!

The hand around you releases, and the mouth above rips open to blast you with sound, a great scream of pain and confusion.

You smack into the carpet, luckily not having been held too far above it. You roll onto your back, watching in awe as the immense toddler above you bawls loudly enough to end the world. Looks like her resistance to pain isn't too high at this age, and even the small scratch you gave was enough to really upset her! Once again you must choke back the pity and guilt you feel for having hurt a two-year-old; it was necessary, as now you can get away and -

A mountain thuds down just above your head, and you roll away to see that a towering mass of denim has smashed down, only narrowly avoiding crushing you. Sarah's mom-jeans-wearing knee supports the giantess as she comforts her crying daughter, and your conscience whispers that you deserved to be crushed for what you did.

"Shut up," you tell yourself, standing and dashing away from the two huge females, your ears followed by the sounds of one crying, and the other shushing and comforting. "She could have killed me. I was only defending myself."

You repeat the mantra as you move up the hallway, toward one of the open doorways, stopping as more giant feet pace toward you from within. Four, furred feet, carrying the dog forward to stop over you. Her head swoops down, the damp, dark nose directly before you. A sudden exhalation knocks you onto your back again, prostrate before this great canine. Having been ignored by the bitch for so long, you wonder why this is happening now...

Lips peel back, revealing gigantic teeth, and a low, rumbling growl grinds out toward you. Is she going to eat you? But no, a moment later the dog raises her head ahead and walks onward, stomping over you to go to the mother and daughter.

You can hear the delighted giggling of the girl as the dog licks at her injury, and Sarah laughing "good dog!". Such a loyal creature. Was that... was that a warning she gave you? A threat that she had ignored you up until now out of kindness, but if you dared to hurt the girl, there would be no mercy?

Could a dog be that smart? You right yourself andf turn to look back, watching Sarah stand to her full height, effortlessly cradling the immense weight of her daughter. "Come on, let's get some dinner," she says, striding away with ground-quaking steps. The dog pauses to look over its shoulder at you, baring her teeeth again for a second before jogging off at its master's heels.

You nearly run on, into the master bedroom of this home, a bed looming above as a humungous landmark. Yet for all the massive objects you've seen, it is the sight of a simple pair of slippers that puts you in your place.

Such normally insignificant items, now big enoiugh to contain houses. You don't know if they're his or hers, but the fluffy material at the toe end is something you want - it would be a comfortable substance to warm yourself with in the colder days.

Now that you're here, there's a lot of stuff to take in. You no doubt have a few hours to spend, as the family has their dinner, and they're likely not to come back to this room until they want to sleep. Even with hours, clambering around these giant pieces of furniture will take much of that time, so you're unlikely to be able to explore everywhere before the giants return.

Where to start...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  Big Girls Do Cry

choices: Examine the book for anything useful
Climb across to the bed
See if the plant can offer anything
Investigate the inner workings of the clock
Climb along the power cord for the light
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No hesitation. With so much recent danger as a direct result of being on the floor, at the perfect level for giants to threaten your very life, you turn your attention directly to the gargantuan piece of furniture nearest to you.

With your climbing ropes, you pull yourself up, slowly and surely, taking no risks. The front side of this cabinet is a door that can be easily opened by a regular human, but you lack the power to do so. To you, all the door's knob is is somewhere to hook a rope, somewhere to stop and take a rest halfway through your climb.

When you do rest, you flex your fingers and regard the blisters on your palms. You really should have brought gloves with you, you're doing so much work with ropes! It's unlikely that you'll be able to make any for yourself from this scale, either. Building some form of pulley or winch system that would be safe and portable enough would be a lot of work, but maybe it would be worthwhile? Last thing you want is to slip and fall at some point.

Either way, you clamber on to the top of the bedside cabinet, and look around at the massive items scattered here. A digital alarm clock, a well-thumbed paperback novel, a pot containing a flower and a lamp. All very useful things for a giant in bed, but not a lot of material for a scavenger such as yourself. Still, you're here now, and should make the most of it. From here, access to the landscape of the bed is easy enough, if you wanted to travel those rolling plains.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  Above it All, Beside the Bedside

choices: Descend to the bathroom floor
Cling tight to Sarah and wait for her to carry you back
Scale Sarah's lofty heights for a better position
Transfer across to the bathroom furniture
Hack away at Sarah's clothing
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
As you close on the tremendous book, its footprint greater than that of a house, your assumption is proven wrong. That is not an author's name writ large on the cover; instead a smiling woman holds a fan of bank notes below words declaring it to be a puzzle book. Crosswords and sudoku a-gogo! And, unless you miss your guess...

Yes! On the other side of the tome, hidden from your original position, is a pencil the size of a tree. So, one of these two adult giants likes to keep their mind working with some brainteasers before they go to sleep. And a pencil is a great resource for you! You can use it to create fires for keeping yourself warm, cooking food and warding off predators. You eagerly advance on it, drawing your weapon as you do so.

Sharpened at one end, covered in yellow paint, the blunt end has been chewed. This indomitable structure bears the crush marks of a god far above you, and you quiver at the thought of what those teeth would do to your pathetic form. Still, they have weakened the structure of the wood enough to give you a start, and you set yourself to sawing away.

Much time and much sweat is spent as you assemble a small supply of logs - or what might simply be miniscule splinters to a larger eye! Still, you're happy with the lumber you've harvested, and pack them away in sacks.

You only get a final inkling of how much time was lost climbing, searching and cutting as the ground shakes, the tremendous approach of the gods of this house getting closer. Clearly they've finished their meal and evening activities, and now head to bed. You scuttle back to behind the clock to observe them as they enter.

Even at thigh height, their sheer size is intimidating, mobile mountains that speed past like racecars. Alfie is the first, and he passes around to the far side of the bed. He strips down to his trunks, and you are mesmerised. You had long ago given in to treating these regular-size humans as gods, but with the flawless physique of his chest he surely looks the part. No wonder the asshole thinks he can get away with cheating on poor Sarah!

For her part, the wife is more demure, a long nightdress her sleeping clothing of choice. Both titans sweep back the sheets before sliding their gargantuan weights into bed, and you can do nothing but watch, mesmerised by the spectacle. Such power, such speed... Your plan to leave here in three days' time is looking better all the time, as to remian in this house would be so dangerous to you!

Alfie scooches closer to his wife, reaching an arm out, but Sarah bats his approach aside. "Cool your jets," she tells him. "Tomorrow's the anniversary, and it'll be a lot more special if we just wait a day. 'Kay?"

She humours her husband with a kiss to his forehead, smiling as he turns away and pulls his covers tighter. Her arms rises, fingers splaying as she reaches toward your position! But no, her great grasp merely lifts the book and pencil, her vast might rendering those objects almost incoinsequential. Here you are, your bags weighed down by the little slivers you collected, and she's taking the whole great lump!

You watch her page through to find her place for a few seconds, before turning your attention to more important matters: where you're going to sleep tonight. Staying up here may be easiest, but there's a great chance that a giant may wake before you tomorrow morning, and spot you while you're helpless! It might be better to -

Sarah screams, and captures your attention once more. She is pulling the end of the pencil from her mouth, and you realise that she must have been chewing it, and got a splinter left over from your exertions stuck in her lip! Amazing, that your pathetic self can manage to cause harm to such a behemoth!

She explains this to Alfie rather quickly as she rises once more. The gust from the sheets being torn back is terrific, and you duck for cover behind the clock again. That was close, it almost blew you off the table!

Then Sarah slams the book back down, and the crushing impact blasts you from your feet regardless, spinning into the air helplessly!

You tumble, but the giantess steps past you, pulling you along in the wake of her mighty motions. You have but one hope of saving yourself as you descend, reaching out your arms to grab the thick fabric of her gown - got it! Your already blistered palms are rent anew by the roughness of the threads, but it beats falling to your death!

Sarah continues stomping on her way, lighting her path as she goes, you swaying side to side and back and forth with every movement of her legs. Just an insect, along for the ride!

She slows to a stop - her gown continuing to swing for several perilous moments, slamming you against her rock-hard thigh - in the bathroom, reaching out to get some tweezers and lotion to deal with the piercing injury you inadvertantly dealt her.

The giantess will be occupied for a little while, which gives you time to decide your own course again, however briefly. Should you continue your journey to the ground, get away from her and hope not to be stepped on? Or stay where you are, wait for her to walk back to the bedroom?

Of course, you are rather low on her body right now; perhaps you should climb higher, get to somewhere safer, even if such motion risks you being thrown off if she begind moving before you're in place.

Sarah has opened a bathroom cabinet for you; you could jump off of her onto nearby furniture, and use this rare chance to look around high ground in this most secure of rooms.

Finally, you could concentrate purely on gathering materials right in front of you; why not cut a little of this gown for yourself, to replace your current pretty rubbish garb? Sarah owes you now after this little incident, so why not?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  A Great, Big Brain on a Great, Big Lady

1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, it's bad enough having to hold on with this giantess's movements making her massive muscles shake the entire surface you cling to, without trying to climb up or down at the same time!

Thus, you remain where you are, making use of Sarah's brief stillness to wrap yourself deeper, more securely, into the threads of her robe. A moment too to whisper an apology to this goddess for causing her such pain through your behaviour - she did nothing to deserve this!

All too soon, she is done with ridding herself of the splinter, and the bathroom light clicks off before she walks back to bed, thighs lifting back and forth, rocking your world, shuddering you to your core.

"All good?" Alfie asks, and his wife affirms. Sarah then sits down and swings her legs up as she tucks herself back into bed.

The three-quarter inch man holding on to the back of her thigh is crushed beneath her weight, and then torn apart as her body shifts, ending any hope he may have had of persisting in tiny survival.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  Wrapped Up Warm in Bed

choices: You head toward the foot of the bed, to try and get off the bed
You head toward Alfie
You head toward Sarah
You go for the head of the bed
With your weapon, you burrow downward into the mattress
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
The thighs are perhaps the most mobile part of a human as they walk, not only being swung back and forth, but every impact shuddering the flesh. This is not a safe place to stay. So upwards you climb, digging your hands into the gaps between the fibres, holding tight as Sarah shifts her weight every now and then.

Up you toil, reaching the overhang of that ass, steadier ground for your climbing. A long way to the top, but that's not your goal here, you just want to off those deadly, deadly legs!

You are cresting the buttocks when Sarah finally triumphs over that tiny splinter and turns to leave the bathroom. Now you can relax somewhat, free of the threat of being thrown free, no chance of being crushed underfoot.

Her husband checks with the giantess before she re-enters the bed. You are just north of the deadly area that touches down on the mattress, and thus not caught between her immense weight and the unforgiving fabric. Soon the woman will lie her whole body horizontal, and that will certainly be an end to you!

So you throw yourself away, drifting through the air for a moment before the goddess reclines, her impact blasting you through the air once more.

You rebound from Alfie's midriff, bouncing to a stop on the mattress between these two behemoths. You pray as earnestly as you ever have that they choose to refrain from intimacy tonight - should these two tectonic titans meet, you'll be utterly smashed.

So, where to from here? This may be the most dangerous location you've yet entered, the sheer heat and scent of these monsters overpowering, the sound of their breathing in time with the regular quakes through the ground beneath you. You are little more than a bed-bug in the presence of these domestic deities.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  Deeper Into Danger

choices: Get clothes from the wardrobe
Look under the bed
Explore the pillow region of the bed
Go fight a trapped fly
Leave the room
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, these married giants are just too powerful and too unpredictable to risk any travel across their mattress, no matter the direction. All it would take is the smallest shifting of position, a slight roll to one side, and you'd be annihilated beneath them. Rule one of tiny survival, don't get in the way of giants!

Instead, you turn the Blade of Becca - as you've come to think of your razor shard - on the ground beneath your feet, sawing through the fabric easily enough and dropping down into the next layer of the mattress. At only three-quarters of an inch tall you don't need to tunnel very far, and slump down in a small pocket, where the worst a giant can do to you would be to lie over the opening.

It's warm down there, surrounded by thick fabricand with two colossal people above, and dark, and it stinks of their sweat. Their breathing echoes throughout you, and every little move they make shakes your world from side to side.

It's Hell.

And yet, you still fall almost immediately into a deep slumber, your body utterly exhausted from all your physical activity. You only wake at the greatest movement yet, as both husband and wife stand, the removal of their weight together springing the mattress with enough force to propel you directly into the air!

Gasping, you flail your arms futilely before you slam back down again, laughing at the silliness of it all. The dawn of your sixth day in the company of this family, and you've finally slept with Sarah and Alfie!

Remaining in your foxhole for now, you peek out only with your head, watching the titans embrace and wish each other a happy anniversary before dressing. Once they're done and stomping away to see their daughter, you feel safe enough to pull yourself out and look around for what you can do in their bedroom now you're left to your own devices.

For one, since you've already dug into the mattress, you take a section of the lining for yourself - it was quite cosy, and should make for good bedding for your camp. Looking around, you can see the wardrobe again, where some clothes could be salvaged. Perhaps there's something secret stashed away under the bed that you can use. Or even ON the bed - looking toward the hills of the pillows, there's a great length of landscape to search through.

You bask in the quiet while you puzzle things out. But there is a sound, something that you can't quite place... Looking in the direction, you see a fly buzzing its wings helplessly in the web of a spider, in a low corner of the room about knee height to a regular human, beside a cabinet.

This could be a chance to test yourself against an insect in battle, see if you could triumph in a relatively controlled situation, You'll have to do it at some point, you reckon. Maybe you could even take some of the meat, see if there's anything edible there that you could use to supplement your diet.

But why linger here? You could go check up on the family, see how you want to spend your Saturday!
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  Subterranean Slumber

choices: Lie in wait to ambush the spider
Check out the wardrobe for clothes
Head off to the bathroom
Go in search of the family
Try to cook the meat now
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
One day you may have to fight for your life against an insect, a foe of your size or slightly larger. To work yourself up to these life-or-death struggles, you had best prepare yourself, and that helpless creature will be a great test subject.

Climbing down from the bed is easy enough, although time consuming. Your trek across to the corner is even longer, with the only sound the frantic buzzing of the doomed beast as it attempts to free itself, futilely. You sure don't want to get yourself tangled up in the spiderweb, so you'd best tackle this smartly.

You hook a rope up the side of the cabinet and climb up to the fly's level. Becca's Blade is a bit unwieldy to go swinging while also trying not to fall off a rope, so you settle for sawing at the web strings. It's difficult to apply too much pressure, but the sharpness of the razor makes up for it, and the fly thuds to the ground far below.

The beast can't break free still, its wings held in place, and it can do little but drool and paw at the air. You're taller than it is long, but its bulk is greater than yours, and as you close your lip involuntarily curls at its hideous visage. Strrange, that this insect is the nearest to a peer that you've yet met at your scale, and yet all it is to you is a target.

You swing your weapon at its compound eyes, smashing one open as you carve into its head. It twitches once more before falling still, leaving you to carve it apart. Within the gore are several chunks of what you hope passes as meat. You're not going to eat it raw, but look forward to cooking it as a test.

As tests go though, it wasn't much. You know the blade is effective against an insect, but what of your combat skills? Should you wait here for the spider to come home so you can slay it as well? Or is that hopeless overconfidence?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D6:  Battle Practice

choices: Use your flashlight to guide yourself
Burn your old clothes for light
Try to lever the door open more
Search without any extra light
Give up and go elsewhere, naked and strong
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, you have no need to prove yourself against a spider just yet. The memory of the monster you faced beneath Becca's floorboards two days past swims to your mind. Sure, here is a great wide room rather than a cramped tunnel, and you have a weapon in your hand, yet still you tremble at the thought.

No, you put the web to your back, leaving the scattered remains of the fly blow it, and stride masterfully toward the wardrobe. You've had enough of these rags in which you're dressed, and the scent of the giants that slept above you has seeped into their fibres, a constant, distracting stench.

It's a tiring trek across the room to the wardrobe, and you find yourself nibbling on the fly-meat en route - not tasty, but filling, and not requiring cooking at all. Certainly, such a substance will serve well as a supplement to your diet.

When finally you stand before the impossibly tall furniture, you find relief as it seems that the left-hand door stands ajar - whoever closed it last managed to trap a shirt sleeve. It's not much, but to a three-quarter inch man it's plenty of space. You guess if that had not been the case, you would have found it quite impossible to get these doors open!

So, you slip inside, taking the chance to rip your clothes off as you do so. The less time you spend in this stinking robe the better!

Above you, a set of shelves holding smaller garments like socks and such, and beyind that the mighty metal coathangers with their vast fields held up amongst the heavens...

Only a thin line of light is available for you to see by, so you won't have the luxury of choosing a garment by colour! Not unless you wish to use some of your precious flashlight battery on such a little trifle.

Unless you wanted to make light instead by using your lighter to burn those hated clothes - although that will be using yet another non-renewable resource!

You could try and push the door open further - it would be an act of strength, but maybe there's a way to get a lever working?

Or you could sneer at such human weakness as a need for light! As a mighty tiny survivalist, you have senses enough to guide you to what you need!

If you think clothes are even necessary - why not leave this place and go elsewhere?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D6:  Well-Justified Timidity

choices: Go up to some of these shoes, and get to carving
Climb to the next highest layer, with the socks, scarves and such
The very top of these pigeon holes, where sweaters and jumpers are folded
Make the epic journey to where the shirts and dresses hang
Screw this, feed more stuff into the fire to get a better view of the area
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
It would be symbolic to burn away those clothes, the ones that you stole from Becca, to draw a line under that chapter of your survival expedition. So you take your lighter to them, and in a few moments they spring aflame. WIth your shrunken lighter, the fire that ensues begins as one to your scale, before spreading and growing to a single, giant flicker. It burns slowly, and should take a good while before it consumes the robe entirely.

Unfortunately, while it is long-burning, the area it illuminates isn't great: it allows you to make out the general shape of the shelves ahead of you, but not much else.

Within that closest alcove sits a great, ominous shape, wide and flat and hollow, and a mirrored twin. Looks like they keep their shoes on this lowest shelf, of such massive size that you gulp again at the thought of the feet that wear them, and how deadly they can be.

So, further above will be great wooden caves containing smaller clothing items: socks, scarves and such, with the shirts and dresses suspended so far, far above.

So much choice for where to raid for clothing material! And, annoyingly enough, the easiest to access is also the hardest to work with. Sure, some clothes of shoe leather would be very strong, but also a difficult material to work with, while the desirable silks are suspended hundreds of feet above your head. Where is it you will go?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D6:  Red Flower

choices: Hide, hide, hide!
Dash past Sarah
Use Sarah as a ride out of here
Make use of the greater light to find better materials
Dispose of the evidence
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
Shoes, no. Jumpers will probably have too thick a material (wool?) to be wearable by someone as small as you, and you don't hold out any hope of being able to scramble up to the heights of the coathanger rails.

Up just one 'floor', you tell yourself, swinging your rope up there. These people probably have a seperate underwear drawer somewhere, so you don't fear finding more underpants to clad yourself in. Indeed, as you pull yourself up into one mega-garage-sized alcove, by the slight light of your fire you can see that there are indeed socks and scarves here, smaller items of clothing that are neatly folded.

Running your hand along some of the pieces, you stop at the feel of smooth silk. Of course, given your tiny size it's much, much rougher than it would be to a normal person, but still far finer than any other material.

You slide a length of the sail-sized sheet out, and with it lacking any stitching or ornamentation, you reckon it must be a silk scarf, probably belonging to Sarah. Well, you needn't feel bad about hacking it up, since this is the sort of thing that moths do all the time.

At that thought, you freeze - what if there ar emoths in here with you? Those silent beasts would easily be the death of you! Best proceed as quickly as you can!

Thus, you slice several sections of silk scarf, roughly shaped to your body, roughly roping the results together with thicker threads hacked from nearby socks. The colour combination is probably quite hideous, but you're not aiming to win any fashion contests here. You ponder whether it would be better to have a camouflage that would make you blend in over a bright colour to warn away predators as if you were poiisonous, but since you have no choice it probably doesn't matter.

It's crude work that you do, and lacking any fine tools it takes some time, but you do manage to fashion crude trousers and shirt, a skirt, a smock, a cloak, a sleeping bag... When the fire finally gutters out, you take that as a sign to stop, pulling on a comfortable set of clothes before bundling the rest up to take back to your camp.

You are heading back to your rope when an almighty cracking sound spreadsthe light further, almost blinding you as the doors are pulled open. Blinking, you gaze out of the wardrobe at a pair of intimidating shins, as Sarah stands tall, backlit like a true goddess illuminating the dark of your world.

You duck back instinctively at the sight of such a powerful creature, but your rational mind calculates that she must be here to select clothes for the anniversary this evening - has so much time passed already? Well, it did take time to get form the bed, trek to the spider-web, cut up the fly, head back to the wardrobe, make all these clothes...

Yes, hours have easily passed, and the day is all but gone!

As the woman stands before you, you must react quickly, before she does something unexpected and removes the blessing of choice from your tiny self.

Should you head to the back of this shelf, and hide yourself as deep as you are able? Wait until she's gone, and pray she doesn't want her scarf.

Or you could rush forward, to get out of here as quick as possible while she's got her attention fixed so far above. Leave her to find her clothes, and pray she doesn't step on you as you pass her gargantuan feet.

Why pass her feet, when you could use them? Surely, you could hitch a ride on the giantess. If you wait here for an opportune moment, you could rope over onto the woman and have her carry you from this place.

Of course, you could instead treat this as a blessing, and the woman herself as irrelevant. Use the light she provides to see what else you can find here to take, paying her no mind whatsoever.

Finally, you could try to conceal your presence by hiding or destroying the damaged silk scarf that you have here.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D6:  Just One Step Up

choices: Head back to stash your recent collections
Return to the baby's room
Return to the bathroom
Return to the living room
Inestigate the potential of the outside world
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
You decide to leave the rope as you shimmy down it - you have plenty, and you don't want to waste time trying to retract this one. Jumping the last little distance to the thick carpet, you turn to face the valley between Sarah's immense feet, naked toes rising and falling idly. Your own bare feet skim through the dust - you really should have thought about making some slippers for yourself at some point!

You resist looking up the towering form of the woman as you scurry between her legs, the door leaving the bedroom mercifully wide open! With your new selection of clothes on your back, you jog gently forward, looking forward to getting out of here!

Your exit is blocked as a great form smashes down directly ahead, dust gusting into the air in a huge cloud. Sarah's huge heel has been brought down in your path, your brief run only half a backward step for this giant! Coughing, you back away from that living landscape, awaiting her next move.

"What do you think?"

But she's not talking to you. A brief glance upwards, past the vast length of leg, you see that she holds in each hand a garment, lifting them before herself for the opinion of her husband, distant at the other side of the room.

Phew, she hasn't seen you, it was merely an accidental almost annihilation! While Alfie hums and haws, you edge your way past the wall of flesh and bone, even at a distance gasping at the heat it gives off. Once around, you give up all subtlety and sprint flat-out for the exit.

Back in the hallway, you ponder where to go next. Looks like the adults will be occupied for a little longer yet, but the further the distance you travel, the more likely they are to be mobile again before you reach your destination. So, if you head right back to the stroller to stow your clothes, you'll probably be overtaken by the fully-dressed gods.

Nearest to you is the bedroom of the child, and you haven't fully given that a look-around yet. Next would be the bathroom, which you also haven't explored, although there's a good chance that Sarah or Alfie will visit it before too long.

Maybe a stop-off in the living room, again a place that you need to fully shake down for goodies. Then again, there is that old dream of taking a look in the garden...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D6:  A Whole World to Explore

choices: Resolve to head home with Taylor when she leaves
Tag along with Alfie and Sarah on their anniversary date
Stay with your stash, stay out of the way of everyone for the night
Go out and watch Taylor, but keep out of her way
Head into the house to grab some more food for your stash
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, with all these logs and clothes, you need to offload before you start getting investigative. While Sarah and Alfie dress, you begin your pilgrimage across the vastness of their home.

The trek across the hallway is exhausting, struggling against the thick carpet fibres, expecting at each moment for a giant foot to interrupt your journey and end your life. But no, you are left alone with your burden and your thoughts, which is to say you're very tired and very lonely.

Still, as you pass through the impossible portal to the living room, you espy the other half of this building's occupants: the child sits within her caged playpen, while Posey the dog stands outside, wagging her tail as she licks at outstretched fingers. The baby chortles, but the moment you enter, the fun stops.

The dog turns her head to look at you. She does not get any closer, does not bark or take any offensive action, yet her eyes follow you as you step forward. Watching you, letting you know that she hasn't forgotten. The child follows that gaze, her little hands holding the bars with a crushing power that you know all too well.

Yes, not intimidating at all.

You plan to use the couch as cover from the pair, but then the elder titans enter, Alfie striding over you first before Sarah's bare feet pad in, delicate steps that could still annihilate you should you get in the way. Fear lends speed to you, and you dash to safety under the furniture even as the two walk over to their companions.

"Down, girl!" Alfie says. "This here's a fancy suit, and I've got a hot date tonight!"

"Oh, hear that Sophia?" Sarah says, finally revealing the giant toddler's name. "I think I'm getting jealous!"

The two descend into lovey-dovey noises as you progress through the darkness, and you slow down again. You're safe, they have no idea you're here!

A crash above, and dust showers down. The ceiling has caved slightly, somehow supporting the massive weight of one of the giants. Sarah, as her voice thrums through the structure:

"Now come on, these toenails aren't going to paint themselves!"

Alfie's legs stomp around to the front of the couch, and he plops down onto a pouffe with another cacophonous impact. Out of sight you can imagine the giant woman proffering her feet to him, and hope that should keep them occupied while you escape.

You scuttle to the far side, and see empty space between you and your destination in the kitchen. You step back out into the light, and another strenuous trek awaits you. You daren't look back for fear of seeing Posey and Sophia watching, and let the idle chatter of the adults wash over you like weather, nothing that you care for.

Across the kitchen, wolfing down the last of the fly meat as a snack with some water from your canteen, and to the nook where the stroller lies. You take the time to organise what you've stashed so far, to congratulate yourself on your cleverness.

You have your sacks, some shards of soap for cleanliness and bottles of water fro drinking, a big metal staple, a single gigantic coffee bean, a net of Becca's tights, some clothes (poor-looking in comparison to what you wear now) made from Becca's underwear, some comfortable and un-popped bubblewrap, alongside your newest acquisitions of splinter-logs, mattress lining and clothes and sleeping bag. You're running a little short on food, but you're fairly well-set otherwise, and the other thing you might want to consider is some form of wheelbarrow or cart to enable you to transport more items.

A harsh knocking brings your attention back to the giant world around you, and you remain in the shadows as the gods react. "Down, girl!" Sarah cautions, while Alfie strides over to the door, crossing right in front of you before he opens it.

"Right on time! Come in, Taylor!

Wait, can it be? You peer out a little more watching as Alfie moves back to allow his visitor to enter. Massive mustard and black sneakers bear them inside, feet far smaller than the man's. You crane back as you look up, past a brief flash of skin before black tights follow lengthy legs up to heights, skipping past further details in your quest to see that face.

She speaks before you see her mouth, and while the voice is far louder and more distant than you've ever heard, you recognise it immediately.

"Thanks, Mr Gillespie! You're looking very smart!"

The door sams shut and she walks on to joon everyone else in the main room. That was Taylor Anderson, the eighteen-year-old girl whose family lives next door to you! Well, you lived next door to them back when you were six feet two and a quarter inches taller than you are now. When you were deliberating over where to carry out your shrinking experiment, the Anderson residence was one option. Mainly because you'd been too lazy to travel far!

You'd planned to break in, shrink yourself to an eighth of an inch and survive amongst them. Now knowing how difficult three quarters of an inch is, being six times smaller again would have been a terrible idea!

Still, you look longingly after Taylor as she interacts with the other giants. She's a link to your past, a familiar face now rendered into a terrifying monster by this disparity in scale. She must be here to babysit while Alfie and Sarah go spend their saturday night celebrating their anniversary.

That means they must live close by. Taylor doesn't drive, so at worst this house must be a short bike journey from where she lives. From where you lived. If you wanted, you could latch onto her, and go home with her, and see your old place...

Then again, why not have a night out yourself with Sarah and Alfie, experience some of the high life, get some quality food in a night off from survival?

Many are the temptations whirling through your mind now...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D6:  Reunions

choices: Take some food from the child
Move across to the dinner table to take some food from the parents
Climb down to the ground to get back to exploring
Just hide out of sight for the moment
Transfer to a kitchen counter for the cooking aftermath
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, to fight such beings as these is to invite death. The most you would achieve is startling the girl enough for her to crush you. At the moment, you are sitting comfortably enough, and give the top of the hand a pat with your free hands while evrything beneath your armpits swelters in the heat of a fleshy prison.

Looking up at her face, you see idiot wonder written there, before her eyes roll upward and she smiles. Then the whole monster is hefted into the air, as an even vaster being lifts her as easily as you are trapped. "Let Mommy kiss it better," Sarah booms, and now you cling tight to the child as she is whisked upward, her mother standing to her full height.

Sarah begins walking, and you are trapped in the hand of a girl held in the arms of her mother. Humbling, and somewhat terrifying: where is this going?

"Food's up!" Alfie shouts, and your question is answered.

You are borne back into the kitchen by these gods, although you can't turn enough in this grip to see the path ahead of you. Instead, you just grip tight and hope for the best. The child is lifted higher, then brought down, and your blood is slammed all around within you.

Rolling your head back across, you see the child seated, and above, the looming form of her gargantuan father. He leans over, placing a gigantic bowl in front of her, resounding loudly on the feeding platform of her high chair. Then the hand finally releases, cold air rushing past you as you plummet to the platform yourself, hitting it hard enough to smash all the air out of your lungs. Gasping, you look up to see - and hear - the girl smashing her palms together in glee at the meal before her.

Feeding time. And you remember how well things went last time you tried stealing her food? Looking around, you can see that the adults are seated as well, their own plates of steaming food before them, scents tantalising your nose. There's a better option, even if it does mean somehow bridging the distance between this high chair and the table. At least the food has wholly captured the attention of the momster toddler...
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D5:  Along for the Ride

1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
No, to try and exact revenge on Becca is insane! You're three-quarters of an inch tall - almost nothing before her power. Thus, having spent so long getting here, you turn your back on the woman's foot and begin to trek back across her office, toward Alfie.

Yes, you feel proud of yourself for having quashed a petty need for retribution. Such things are for giants, not a tiny survivalist like you! That would be a waste of energy and resources. Almost as big a waste as your jovial jaunt around this office.

The floor quakes, and you stumble as Becca steps over you, her feet smashing down far distant as she strides to the door in moments; a journey of minutes for you.

The immense door slams shut with a crack of doom, and the giantess looks directly down at you as a sneer crawls onto her face.

"I'm glad you showed up again. I get to make you pay for showing me up in front of Alfie."

Of course! Looking as she is toward the opposite office throughout the day, she'll have seen you heading out! The door is now closed not to prevent your escape, but to keep Alfie from seeing her murderous glee.

You get only a few seconds into a sprint before Becca takes the small effort needed to plant a foot in front of you, her shoe an impossible wall that brings you stopping short. Digging the high heel of her shoe into the carpet, she swings the toe-end like a golf club, putting you on your back, where you can look up the full height of her body, its peak the smiling face a cruel god.

The other foot strikes suddenly, blocking out the light just before it presses down upon you with enough force to explode your body.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  A Waste of Time is a Waste of Life

choices: Climb to the top of the bag
Stay where you are, brace for impact!
Attack the wall of flesh with your weapon
Start eating coffee for some energy
Scream as loud as you can
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
It's right here, so you duck through the hole you cut in the coffee packet. The rich aroma of the beans is all around you, and you perk up almost immediately. Intoxicating!

Of course, while it is a convenient place to hide, you were in plain sight to all those women, and they saw exactly where you went. Moments after you hid, you hear a voice bellowing:

"Ew! It went right into the coffee!"

The world lifts, tipping you over alongside the beans. The massive seeds batter you, driving breath out of your body as the packet soars into the air, grasped so easily by one of those giants. The hole you entered by is sealed by a great palm, the barest hint of light passing by.

This bag's probably going to be thrown directly into the bin - what is your course of action?
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Beaned

1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.content:
You ever see that movie, 'The Witches'? There's a scene, where a lot of women devote their time to stomping their feet in an effort to killing a mouse.

It flashes through your mind as you drop to the floor. Your minimal mass prevents you from taking damage from falling such a height, but once you land you find yourself at the mercy of a whole bunch of large ladies. And you're nowhere near as fast or nimble as a mouse.

Sure, you roll aside from the first thundering shoe, but your injury and baggage is slowing you, and Becca brings her heel down directly on you, the thick spike piercing and crushing your leg, tearing you apart as she gives a savage twist. She pulls back, but you still live as another woman moves in with her immense flat shoe, entirely covering your remains and mercifully obliterating you in a single smash.
1321212112113212323112113311113232212113.title: D4:  Stomp Stomp Stomp

choices: Climb up inside the rubbish bag, to the open top
Cut through the bottom of the bag
Accept your fate of being trash
132121211211321232311211331111323221212.content:
Mrs Gillespie sits at the table with her daughter to enjoy her sandwich. You have plenty of time to feast on the red fruit cut-offs that are not enough to satisfy her vast hunger, but more than enough to feed you for a few days, at least. Even should it begin rotting, there's enough of it that you should be able to find still-succulent sections no problem.

Your stripping of the edible hill takes longer than you imagined, and the rising of the giantess reminds you that you don't have unlimited time. She steps back to her place, shading you with her bulk, and snatches up the tupperware container of chicken with ease.

As she takes it to the fridge, you breathe a sigh of relief at having dodged that fate. She'll soon be back for the tomato - still a mound of discarded produce, which you have made an almost insignificant dent in - and so you move backward, piling what you've managed to scavenge into your sacks. A little damp, but nutritious and tasty for sure.

All too soon the gargantuan hand of Mrs Gillespie descends, crushing finger and thumb effortlessly plucking up the pathetic remains of the tomato, whisking it heavenwards with the merest effort. You pause in your work to watch her at hers, the merest motion of an unseen foot opening a pedal bin into which the mound is dropped. it's distant, but you can hear the impact, a solid crash that would crush your pathetic form were you beneath it.

You lower your view of the awe-inspiring woman, not wishing to be too humbled by her powerful physique, her head swaying as far above the counter on which you stand as it lies above the floor. She covers distances in moments that would take you minutes, and could hold you and all your weighty supplies in the palm of one hand...

One of those hands descends now, throwing you from your feet as it lifts the chopping board beneath you, lifting your world, and you along with it! You slam against the hard plastic, and raise your head to witness a dreadful sight you had hoped never to witness again:

A piece of kitchen towel, vast enough to cover a house, backed by the phenomonal power of the woman's fingers and thumb. Of her other hand, all you can see is the thumb, its titanic majesty paling as it presses down on the floor beneath you, dwarfing you in mass and strength.

The cloth sweeps down to wipe away any tomato juice or seeds, and once again you are swept up with the woman's zeal. Held tight within her crushing embrace, you find yourself unable to even struggle, gasping for air a the thick paper towel tears at your exposed skin. How could one man suffer this same fate more than once?

Your prison is crumpled in the fist of the goddess, and luck alone can be the only explanation for how your three-quarter inch self is not annihilated in her grasp; not that it's good luck that got you into this situation in the first place! She's clearly not that bothered, and as the pressure is relieved on you, gravity takes its place as you fall...

Now you're grateful for the paper, as it cushions your landing in the bin. Your blade cuts an exit, and in the dark you can breathe a sigh of relief, although doing so sucks in foetid air, redolent with the decay of whatever waste you're sharing this space with. Oh, to have had the foresight to bring a light source with you!

Knowing as you do that the bin collection has only recently passed, you can't hope for rescue through that means any time soon. There should be enough rubbish in here that you could survive for a while, but it would be disgusting. If you should try to carve your way out of the inner lining here, should you make your way upward, or to the bottom?
132121211211321232311211331111323221212.title: D3: History Repeats, on a Larger Scale

choices: Wrap yourself in the chicken for warmth
Exert yourself with exercise to keep warm
Endeavour to escape from the tub you're in somehow
132121211211321232311211331111323221213.content:
You spare one glance to see that Mrs Gillespie is still distracted before dashing out across the kitchen counter top, The chicken box does have an overhang where the lid would click into place, but that just means you've got somewhere to hook your climbin' rope on to!

And hook it you do, allowing you to clamber atop the structure with a minimum of effort. Once perched atop the lip of the container, you leave one rope in place and tie another for your descent inside. Soon you are beside a heap of butchered meat of various sizes, and run a hand across its fibrous texture. Funny to think that now, even a chicken would be a titanic, impossible monster that could kill you effortlessly. At your tiny size, you would not be able to harvest this sort of meat without help!

So you luxuriate in this privilege, tearing off as much as you can to stash away in your bags. Who knows when you'll get to eat like this again?

A shudder disturbs you and you stumble. In the time it takes you to look up, the ceiling snaps into place with a deafening crack of sound, severing the hair rope that you had planned to escape on. No time to react before the whole container lifts from the ground, shaking wildly for several seconds. Luckily, the mass of meat is too solid to fall on you, but the thought of the possibility is still terrifying!

The plastic walls aren't clear enough to give full detail, but Sarah's fingers clearly block some of your view, and ahead is a glowing mountain, as if you were being carried to Heaven...

The shaking ceases as the container's movement becomes a slide across ground, throwing you fully off your feet and squealching into the chicken. You stand up, hoping for a closer view of this shining landscape, only for an even louder crash to accompany being plunged into darkness. Darkness... and an increasing cold.

Oh, no. The chicken has been placed back into the refridgerator, trapping you inside an impervious structure designed only to keep everything inside it as cold as possible!

Your tiny body has a bad time retaining heat at the best of times, so things don't look too good for you. You're already shivering, and have no idea how long it will be before the fridge is opened again! You'll have to do something, and soon!
132121211211321232311211331111323221213.title: D3:  Tastes Like...

choices: Check out the kid's room for supplies
Venture into the parents' room for material
Go to the bathroom for some water
132121211211321232311211332.content:
Well, this is a chance to explore more of this house. Making sure with a long glance that the giantess and her daughter are fully absorbed in their book, and another that the dog is fully occupied in the kitchen - padding over to sleep in its basket after its drink - you stumble through the thick carpet fibres, down the hallway.

The doors are all open down here, and you can take a peek in through the Olympian entrances to get the gist of what each room contains. The first door on the left has walls painted in bright, rainbow colours and has a mobile hanging above the barred crib that sits amid a sea of giant toys. Kid's room.

Opposite is a more austere chamber, a truly massive bed with bedside tables obviously that of the parents.

Beyond the kid's room you can see hints of the white and blue decoration that can only herald a bathroom. You crossed paths with this family when trying to gather water from a restroom, so to do so here would bring your mission full circle!
132121211211321232311211332.title: D2:  A New Room

choices: Head to the bowl
Head to the dog
Head to higher ground
132121211211321232311211333.content:
Water is your most pressing concern. Never mind the fact that a dog big enough to find an elephant a bite-size snack is bent over the bowl. Your steps slow more and more the closer you get, the echoing sound of that tongue lapping the liquid into the beast slapping fear into your heart.

Is it better if the dog stays there, or moves away? It'd be risky to get between the creature and its drink, but if it walked away, it may step on you! Neither is a hopeful prospect!

If only you could distract it somehow! But there's nothing you can do at your size. No, you'll have to brave the approach.

Should you walk directly to the bowl, head held high and fear filed far away? Should you instead climb the dog again, confident that it can't step on you in that instance? Or should you use your rope to climb somewhere out of its reach until it wanders off?
132121211211321232311211333.title: D2:  Need...  Water...

choices: just a few minutes later, when the woman sits in the chair.
a couple hours later; there's no sign of anyone around.
a few hours later, when a man you haven't seen yet sits in the chair.
132121211211323.content:
You decide that this would be a good place to rest for a moment. You've kind of been going nonstop since the library; it's been an exhausting day. Besides, from here you'll have a good view of the household -- you can see the mom and toddler clearly, and get a sense of what their daily routine is like.

You watch for a good long hour, even more glad of your decision when the mom hands the dog off to a dog walker and begins vacuuming the living room -- you would have hated to end your adventure inside a vacuum! Soon, the mom takes the girl into the kitchen and feeds her,and it's not much later that she takes her down the hall, muttering something about a nap.

A nap. That would be nice, you think. You stretch out, and close your eyes; the chair really is comfortable. You'll just take a catnap.

You awake....
132121211211323.title: D1: The Comfy Chair!

choices: Climb down and get to the water bowl
Climb down and head for the stroller
Climb down onto the woman
1321212112113231.content:
Just as your eyes finally close, the ground shudders and you almost fall from your perch with the speed of your sitting upright. Looking up, you see the back of the woman.

The ground continues to shake, and the head of the woman sinks closer toward you. As you cling tight to the back of the chair, you see that she is scrunching down in her seat, raising her feet up from the floor as she gets comfortable. By the time the quake has subsided, you are looking down at her, her scalp level with your own.

In her lap she opens a book, no doubt the same one she checked out from the library this morning. Seems that she's planning to camp out here for a while during her daughter's nap-time, so if you wanted to head off around the house, now would be the time to do so, free from interruption. You have your rope, so getting to the ground will be easy!

Of course, the food has all been packed away behind impassable cupboard and refridgerator doors, so the only resource you'd be able to gather would be water from the dogbowl, but you could still rendezvous with the stroller.

Or, while the goddess relaxes, you could get aboard her, and allow her to carry you around. You could even try harvesting her clothing and possessions for whatever materials you can scavenge! Right now would be the best time, as the only movements she's likely to make in the near future are turning the pages of a book, nothing so dangerous as to smash your fragile form.
1321212112113231.title: D1:  Book of the Gods

choices: Climb atop the man to get to the dinner table
Climb to the floor to do a little exploring
Stay on the chair even longer to see what the giants do next
1321212112113233.content:
A shudder runs through the world, and you rise from your slumber, to behold the back of a strange, giant man. From the white shirt he wears, it seems he's come back from work, and his well-proportioned, handsome face seems a similar age to the mother. When that giantess walks up and plants a kiss on his forehead, you can pretty firmly confirm their relationship.

She assures him that dinner will be on the way soon, and strides back into the kitchen. Rubbing your hands, you look forward to the feast yourself; supplies will literally be served up on a plate!
