Upon acquiring the 'spear', you observe some small droplets of water hanging from the distant plants. Looking up, you notice a large black cylindrical object hanging from the roof of the terrarium. A sprinkler. So that's how she simulated fresh rain. Knowing how you'll get water, you begin looking for a place to create a makeshift shelter. This open area was likely not the safest, but you feared going into the jungle so soon. So involved are you in your tasks, you fail to notice the woman has placed her notepad back on the nearby desk, and begins to leave. She reaches the door and with one quick look back towards where her new fascinating study subject resides, not visible from across the room, she smiles and turns off the overhead light, causing the room to go dark initially, before automatic lighting kicks in in some of the terrariums. Instantly the artificial lighting that filled you world is replaced by a dull, bluish, moon style type of lighting, and you turn to see the distant shadowy outline of the woman in the yellow lit doorway exiting, shutting the door behind her with an audible click, even with the distance and through the glass. Returning back to her house and her life with her casual normal concerns, cutting off any connection of you and the human world, and leaving you to your desperate survival concerns.
143121122121.title: A large glass terrarium spanning the length of ...

choices: To the thuds of a human.
To the tongue of a predator!
To water filling up your hole!
1431211221211.content:
Shelter is a must. You’ve no idea when the woman will return, or if she’ll provide any sort of escape or relief. You doubt it. You set out towards the treeline of the jungle some two hundred feet or so away.

You quickly find that at your decreased size, scuttling over the beach ball to car car sized pebbles towards your destination seemed a little easier than you’d expected. The air felt thicker at this size, but seemed to buoy your movements, not hinder them. It was hard to describe, but you felt more agile at this size. Even the world seemed just a hairs breadth slower. The drops of water off the plants, the deliberate Even ponderous movements of the woman, the roll of loose rock. Perhaps something to do with the distance electrical neurons had to fire in your head. Such investigation would have To come later as you reached the first of the plants.

Approaching, the plants grew greater and greater in their domination of your sight. From your perspective in the woman's hand they seemed low lying tropical bushes. But from within the tank right at their base they are several hundred feet tall behemoths and quite wide. A plant that to you could fill in much of a stadium. Now it could be a source of tools and materials, or it could contain a plethora of threats.

The unnerving blue glow of the lamp casts large deep shadows beneath the multitude of leaves. The darkness is so foreboding, and past the first layer of plants the jungle for lack of a better word becomes much more dense, closer to a wall of vegetation, full of the unknown specimens the woman keeps locked in here, some large and terrifying you're certain. Is that rustling you hear? Youd definitely heard ambient noises of some kind approaching here. Or is your terror deceiving your senses. You calm your breathing, which had unconsciously picked up these last moments. You can’t beat yourself or this is all over.

Stepping slowly over to a lower hanging stalk, you reach up and fill the texture. Surprisingly tough at this size, but the leaves are certainly more brittle in general due to reduced water flow, they must have adapted to rely on rain from occasional ocean squalls, which worries you that fresh water may be more scarce than you first thought. You reach into your pocket and pull out a sharp blade you'd intended for your original survival plans. You weren't expecting to need to cut plants on the beach however and the knife cuts through painfully slowly. More than once you stop progress. Certain you’d seen something out of the corner of your eye. regardless of any creature’s presence, you are happily unmolested as you now have a few brittle leaves to use.

After such thirsty work, you cautiously approach the base of the main root, deeper into the darkness. While more damp, you don’t see a reliable source of clean water until you glance upwards. Along the main stalk are several droplets of water, each more than enough. You hoist yourself onto the lowest stalk and move higher and higher, keeping close to the main stalk until you reach a droplet almost as large as you. Eagerly you plunge your head in, only to be bounced off by the surface tension, like a rubber ball. Rubbing your head, you decide on a more cautious approach. Grabbing both sides you lean your head in and bite into the water like ice cream. You are forced to chew hard to break up the mouth sized drop into several smaller ones, then gulp them down one at a time like wet candy. You’d have to find a better way of doing this in the future.

As you return steadily towards the base of the plant, you are hit by the realization that you are already planning for the future here, not thinking of escape. You shake the thought, it was a short term solution before you hatched your master and no doubt cunning escape plan. Right?

The earth below is lukewarm as your shoes touch down. It might get colder in here and that wouldn't be good on your first night. Your contemplations are interrupted by a faint series of thuds in steady motion. You hear rustling in the great plants.. Just beyond your vision, a great creature pushes aside the impenetrable jungle like paper. The whipping of the stalks and plants reminds you of a strong rushing wind. You rush to the base of the bush a pray whatever this creature is doesn’t see you, smell your, or hear your whimpers. The sound fades and you are none the wiser of what the creature is, but at least it is no wiser of you. You hurriedly gather up your supplies and rush for the only area you believe may be safe for tonight. The glass.

Yes, you decide to stay along the edge of the grassline, but you won't have time to construct a shelter or safe place in just one night. The glass is impenetrable to the denizens of this world, it would protect an entire wall from attack, save time, and allow you to watch the larger world beyond. Hopefully the woman would return and bring anything you could use to survive whatever she locked you in with. Using one of your leafs as a makeshift shovel, you dig into a patch of semi soft dirt and sand and after some hard work you have a hole. A little extra effort to expand it and you hop right in. You dig in a bit more once inside, in order to pack your entrance closed.

Exhausted, you drop your shovel on you chest and lean up against a thin patch of dirt still separating you from the glass. Wearily, you wipe away a few particles for one last look outside your box. Its hard to make out much in the dark, but the woman's computer with a dull blinking standby light is the nearest large structure on her nearby desk. Dozens of other little worlds line the shelves. The thin outline of the door frame, lit by whatever light was in the hallway beyond. Nothing happens as you stare out, and exhaustion, and maybe a small hint of accomplishment, though for what you're not sure, overtakes you.

———
Your dreams are of eyes in blades of the jungle outside. First one pair then two then dozens. Finally you hear a loud thunder and two enormous eyes eclipse the others!
You awaken in surprise!
1431211221211.title: Nighttime, Find Shelter or Die.

choices: Optimism. Show up and hope for the best!
Pessimism. Hide away from her.
Subterfuge. Make it look like you’re dead.
14312112212111.content:
A fitful sleep is interrupted in an annoyed snort as a small clump of earth smacks into your knows before rolling onto the floor of your hole. You rub your eyes, hoping for a little relief. Your back would be complaining all day you figure. And what would you do with that day, you wondered?

Lost in your thoughts and your aches, you’d ignored the dull thumping, but you finally recognize it and the white light pouring through your small hole to the glass. You look outwards, initially squinting at the artificial light until your eyes adapt. Beyond was the woman, pacing from shelf to shelf, nearly on the opposite end of the room, clipboard in hand, and covered in a white lab coat. You notice also that she appears to be wearing tight grey pajama shorts and slippers. You glance at your thankfully still working watch. 7:17 AM. She must be doing the her morning rounds, having just woke up.

You find it astounding that she hasn’t come to check on you. You KNOW you’re the most incredible sight she’s ever witnessed, and she'd captured you to prove it. Yet here she was checking on insects, lizards, and small mammals and not you! What if you were dead!? You’re a bit miffed. But then again, would her attention be a good thing? The more she treated you like another animal, the better your chance to escape.

Such machinations are shattered as the woman pivots and comes directly towards you. Well, your end of the terrarium that is. The previously dull thuds become louder and more jarring with each of her steps collapsing more bits of dirt in your hovel, and your restricted view sees less and less of her. You are mesmerized as the skyscraper sized being reaches the edge of the table. Your limited vision can see only her right leg covered in grey cloth where on the right it connects to her hips, and the left disappears behind her coat. She’s standing roughly where she dropped you off yesterday. You figure she must be looking for you. You get a little red for the moment given your perspective on her body. You feel bad for a second, but then you recognize that shes unaware and either way you’re not capable of being a threat to her, so maybe a few looks isn’t such a bad thing...

A bit of movement confirms her search and snaps you out of your lewd thoughts as the hips bend and the coat drapes onto the edge of the table. She’s scanning for you. You don’t move. Rationally you know the size of the opening is just larger than your head. Your head on your 1/4 inch body. Noticing that and the person within would take the eyesight of the god Apollo. But instinctually, your brain believes that this thing with the seeming power of a god is one, and you stay still as stone in your shelter.

A few moments later the woman stands back to her full height, still not saying a word! Another thud suddenly rumbles through you, but coming from above as reverberating through the glass. Had she slapped the glass? No, you’d have felt that alot more, your hole would also probably collapse. Within a second the leg steps away to your left, followed by the blurry quick movement of the rest of the woman as she walks down the length of the aquarium. Occasional pauses in her thumping indicating that she must be observing other denizens of your home.

Cautiously, you pull down some dirt and peak your head above ground. You can’t see her, indicating she’s at least several steps away. A look at the jungle offers no evidence of any creatures. You glance up where presumably the woman smacked the glass. There about halfway up the wall is a large yellow billboard. A sticky note! On it in large letters with blue ink is the message “Meet 8 am.” As if on cue the giantess moves into view as she crosses in front of your position, but at a greater distance, heading to her desk. She places the clipboard down and walks towards the door, leaving it open on the way out and leaving you alone for now to think about her note. You sink back into your hole to contemplate.

You are a bit miffed with the note. Yes it was precious communication and gave a meeting time, but it sure felt like a uncaring command. Maybe it was just done for expediency but would a “please” hurt? How about an “are you ok in there!?” You force yourself to be calm. Getting angry would not hurt her or help you. But now you gotta decide whether to show yourself. Yes, she represents a lifeline, supplies, and potential restoration, but she seems to be completely apathetic to your well being beyond your value as a test subject for her observations. And who knows what she may have in store for you. She may give you food at 8, or she may pluck you up and use you for some sort of tests!

Whatever her intentions, if you stay here, tear some clothes, you can eventually convince her you'd been gobbled up you reckon. You could leave some sign you are alive but avoid her, blend into the terrarium until you figured a way out. Maybe your absence will change her approach? Or you could show up and hope for the best. What do you do?
14312112212111.title: To the thuds of a human.

choices: Her desk, experiment time.
Another terrarium.
Somewhere else entirely.
143121122121111.content:
For all the callousness the woman has shown, you still know that on some level she values you. While you hadn’t given up on convincing her that you were an equal, you needed to show value to get any sort of possible aid. Maybe even talk her into more. She seemed analytical, if nothing else. With that slim thread of optimism you make up your mind to be there on time. You set an alarm on your watch.

Digging out of your hole you take a moment to collect your leaf shavings, then stretch hard. A pop and shooting pain shoots though your back. Not happy with sleeping on the ground, it is being extra cranky this morning. You suppose you should head directly under the nearest opening to the terrarium above.

A rustle and movement out of the corner of your eye catches your attention. Your heart rate spikes and you grab the stick, your only protection. Your mind imagines the terrifying creatures that the woman keeps in here.

Your terrors are confirmed as two antennae pole out followed by a terrifying, 6 legged, brown, grotesque, slow...waddling...and entirely unthreatening creature. It was about 14 or so feet long with a flat wide back that looked like a giant shovel and just over half your height. It pays you no heed and continues walking along, pecking at little edible things, to it anyways, along the ground, before moving along. In the distance you see a few more doing the same. Must be a routine. If your correct, thIs is a stinkbug. You’re almost disappointed, but mostly relieved that your first encounter is with a leaf eater. The thing lumbers by 40 feet away. Pausing for a moment to take stock of you, then resuming its journey. You couldn’t even intimidate a stinkbug. But the brain that compelled you to shrink in the first place kicks in. You could kill it and eat it, use its carapace for armor, ooh or ride it like something outta a sci fi movie. It could probably be a great transport animal. You approach steadily, spear at the side. When you close within 20 feet the creature takes stock of you again, now you're threatening it. It rears up and you fear your about to be smelling rotten for weeks. But you drop your spear and fall to the ground, your leaf sheddings falling too.

The creature falls back on all legs with an audible thwump. Slowly it makes its way towards you. Should you run? Stick it in the eyes? It pauses before you and begins gobbling up the shavings. You resist the urge to yell or attack. You do slowly stand though. Seems that your tools made a welcome meal for the creature. It waits for a moment for more, but noticing none slowly waddles away, but not straying too far. Maybe this is an opportunity...

Such thoughts are placed aside as your alarm goes off, coincided with the memorable thumps of a giant attract your attention towards the outside world. The woman approaches the glass, now seemingly cleaned up after this morning. She rips the sticky note off and crumples the movie screen sized object in her hand before casually tossing it hundreds of feet into a small bin. A casual and likely unintentional reminder of her power. She gazes down looking for you, you presume.

Covered in dirt against a dirt backdrop, you decide to wave for her attention. Those big brown eyes lock on, and a genuine smile comes across her face. For what you're not sure. Happy you lived, yes, but why. Or maybe just amused or surprised. She reaches up and pops open the glass door. Her other hand comes in, only now do you notice it contains two long metal bars that run into her fingers. Tweezers! This could hurt like hell! You wave asking her to stop, but no response from the face outside the glass. You see the tweezers much closer now and instinctually bolt. The wide as you tweezers follow you then suddenly crash down right behind you, sinking into the sandy dirt several feet. You fall to the earth and turn to see the mildly annoyed face of the woman, a bit of her tongue out as she concentrated on getting you. As you stand the tweezers retract from the nearby earth and in a swift motion latch around your upper chest. It's hard to breathe. Despite her expertise in this and her care, the force her fingers exert on the metal is far greater than your ribcage can exert on it.

Your feet left off the ground as you are hailed swiftly up from the spot of last night's adventure. Through the glass you go and stop before one of those same analytical eyes you were fast growing accustomed to, and resenting. It darts all over your form before you are lowered into the woman’s waiting palm.

She turns and heads for...
143121122121111.title: Optimism. Show up and hope for the best!

choices: Further explore.
Begin devising an escape.
Prepare your shelter.
1431211221211111.content:
The woman reaches her desk in a couple of strides. You notice objects strewn about, tools, tweezers, measurement sticks, a magnifying glass and even a digital microscope. These objects soon tower about you as you are once again dropped by her palm to desk level, then rolled off. You weren’t sure if the tweezers or this were worse, but both were painful in their own ways.

You are still rubbing your sore hands that you used to slow your fall and don‘t pay attention to the woman as she moves a few items around on the desk. That is, until the magnifying glass to your right is suddenly grasped by her building sized hand. Lifted up, it takes position ominously above you and her already large eye now appears several times larger. You see the little red veins in great detail, her pupil expanding and contracting like an unstable black hole, poring over you and processing visual information into her great mind beyond.

“SEEMS YOU SURVIVED THE NIGHT WITHOUT NOTABLE INJURY.” Her words are even more jarring with her face so close to your sitting position. “DAY ONE: SUBJECT ZETA, A REDUCED HUMAN MALE, HAS MANAGED TO SURVIVE OCEANIC PRIMARY HABITAT, WITHOUT INJURY, NOTED USING SPLINTER AS WEAPON, SHOWS SIGNS OF CREATIVITY IN STRESSFUL CONDITIONS. WILL CONDUCT MEASUREMENTS TO TRACK ONGOING PROGRESS.” She must be speaking to a recording device, likely her nearby computer, her analytical nature is confirmed, but it leaves you cold with its lack of concern for you as an individual or human being. Did she say measurements?

You see her other hand maneuvering the long metallic measuring stick you saw earlier. With a thump it is placed uncomfortably close to you. “LIE BACK.” She commands. Despite all you’ve witnessed of her power and personality, that spark of resentment and desire for freedom prevents you from obeying. You continue to just sit there, trying to avoid the eye and stare across the desk. A frustrated sigh emanates from the giant being and without further attempts at wooing you, you see a pair of micro metallic strands attached to a similar system as the tweezers fast approach you. You are barely onto your feet when the arm width mandibles latch onto your right shoulder, and with amazing precision you are forced into the air then steadily onto your back next to the measuring stick. You squirm and grunt in pain as gentle but firm pressure holds you down. You are also cowed by the realization that the force exerted is the gentlest a human being could probably manage. The micro strands retract but hover menacingly close.

“STRIP.” You glance up despite the dull pain in incredulity at her latest command. The immense eye rolls. Finally modulating her tone for you and not the computer, her voice becomes softer. “I need accurate measurements of your body, your clothes throw off the data just a little.” You don’t fully believe her purely scientific rationale. “SIGH, if it makes you feel better keep your boxers. I don’t need that measurement, for now at least. But if I must remove your clothes, I will” The finality of the threat forces reluctant compliance. You shudder at what the tiniest slip of her fingers with those metal bars could do to you, and you are soon in your boxers lying flat, this time without command. “.258 INCHES” the booming recording voice returns, and lasts as she measure arm and leg length , torso width and so on. Soon a tiny scale made to measure creatures and objects your size is placed nearby. Graciously, the woman does not pick you up onto it but makes a ‘bridge’ with her pinky finger. You oblige, happy to not be tweezered, and grasp the whorled surface of her pinky’s underside and climb up. Even here you can feel the gallons of blood pumping through her warm flesh as your bare feet climb up.

The scale is relatively small and you reach it quickly at the woman’s knuckle. Hopping off, you walk to the middle and her finger lifts and presses a button on the device. A loud snort and giggle radiates around you as the woman gets the measurement. “Wow the machine isn’t even registering your mass. I’ll have to purchase a new one.” You put your hand on your hips and look up with frustration. Noticing your little display the woman replies “What? Come on, its not my fault you shrank yourself so small.” Another snicker, but she does have a point. You got yourself into this situation.

“Anyways, weight can come later, now we need to talk about your activities last night.” A large microphone the size of you is placed nearby and angled down towards you. Judging by its size it was designed to record barely audible sounds, like your current voice. The woman taps a key on her keyboard and resumes her study. SUBJECT ZETA WILL RELATE DAY 1’s EXPERIENCES NOW.”

The woman stares down expectantly. Ok, you figure, this may help in the long run, cooperation. “First, my name is Stephen, not zeta. But as for my experiences...”

Your story ambles on with one or two flourishes, and the occasional question from the woman for clarification and to insert plant and animal names for purposes of the recording, but is without incident. The woman picks up the microphone and places it away. She speaks to the recording one last time. “SUBJECT ZETA WILL BE RETURNED AND FOLLOWUP OBSERVATIONS WILL BE MADE AND RECORDED. GOAL OF THIS EXPERIMENT IS TO STUDY AN AVERAGE HUMAN BEING’S ABILITY AND EFFORTS TO SURVIVE AND THRIVE IN HOSTILE ENVIRONMENT. AT THIS TIME IT MAY BE PRUDENT TO RESTRICT SESSIONS SO AS TO AVOID CONTAMINATING SUBJECTS NATURAL BEHAVIORS AND PATTERNS.” Another tap of the keyboard and her full attention is on cleaning up her desk.

Did this mean she was going to limit her interactions with you? That was good and bad you supposed. Out here you were safe from predators, although maybe being around giants was actually worse. Particularly this one. Did she also mean that avoiding contamination meant no free food or supplies? As if answering your question the woman uses the micro tweezers to pick up your pile of clothing and unceremoniously drop them into a tiny plastic bag. “You won’t be needing these anymore, it's climate controlled in there. 90 degree days and 75 at night. You’ll be just fine, in fact these could slow you down or get caught on something. Plus, they introduce outside elements not natural and contaminate the experiment.” She stands to store the bag in a nearby box. Once again you are angered at the complete disregard of your opinion and the lack of trust you had in her. You could only trust her commitment to studying you, whatever that entailed.

Returning before you her palm smacks on the surface. “Easy way or hard way?” She probably can’t see your glare, but you do it anyway as you walk over to her hand and climb on. “I’m Devya.” You stare up at the first real time she's treated you with a modicum of humanity. “I think this whole experiment is going to be quite fascinating little guy.” With that she goes through the motions of returning you to your new home. As you roll off her palm back onto the dirt, you stare back at her. The self-satisfied smile remains before lifting up to her great height. Without so much as a goodbye or good luck she strides away. You are back to survival Day 2.
1431211221211111.title: Her desk, experiment time.

choices: Return to the attack area and scavenge from the remains of the beetle.
Further into the jungle for food and knowledge.
The sprinklers start!
14312112212111111.content:
Placed back into the open area of the terrarium you notice something has changed. It's not just that the sun lamp has shifted in its position, somewhat mimicking the actual sun. Nor that everything feels different without your shoes and clothing. The bugs from earlier are gone. You take note of this. If your weeks of reading up on survival habits of insects told you anything, it's that wildlife follows a pattern for a reason. If the bugs are gone it's either because there's food elsewhere, or there's danger. You suddenly feel very isolated and vulnerable. Ironic considering the titanic woman you now know as Devya is no more than a half a dozen strides from your position, examining a terrarium at chest height that your earlier observations seemed a desert one, complete with some sort of shiny lizard.

You’ve no idea whether a similar creature inhabits your area, but you recall the incident from last night. Frustratingly, Devya had not provided the creature’s species, and merely noted the incident on her data pad. It was possible she wasn’t sure. Depending on how many larger animals were in here.

You find your discarded spear nearby, no worse for wear. Grabbing it you bound across toward the glass, then along it to your hole. None of your leaf chippings remain, likely all consumed by the damn stink bugs or some other inhabitant. This place was at best temporary, and hopefully only an emergency shelter. With little reluctance you depart and move back into the jungle, which seems only a little less foreboding with the ‘daylight’. You move in cautiously at first, every step considered. However this won’t work. Most everything in here was likely stronger and faster than you, and with better senses. You remember your beach strategy. Quick brief bursts from cover to cover, like tiny spiders. You are up against the base of the plant from last night when you make your first sprint into the jungle to a nearby thick mound of soil. You scan around and above, 360 degrees. Nothing but some ambient sounds, no movement. The next sprint is to a low bush with longer pointer stalks with a little needle at the end. You recognize the needle as the same you carry now. A good source of armaments for the future you reckon. Then you detect movement near your dirt mound you just came from. Slowly moving to get a better view, you catch sight of a black beetle lumbering along. Its not particularly big, maybe twice your height and 25 feet long. It pauses briefly at your former location, likely trying to figure out the different scent or however it detected you. Before you can worry whether it's carnivorous, you detect small vibrations in your feet. Within moments the twig you stand near jumps a dozen feet in the air as a massive grey creature plants its weight upon it and shoots out of from behind a low hill covered by undergrowth and steps on said twig as it squeaks so shrill you are forced to drop your spear and hold your ears. The beetle has no chance to escape as the monster grabs it with its pink hands and grips it tight while using sizable jaws to tear at its head.

Your heart is through the roof as you fall to your ass. From the speed and violence of such a creature, and you finally get to see the now mostly stationary beast. A shrew. A frikin shrew was what terrified you, and it wasn’t even particularly big. Using quick math you estimate its size at about 3 inches along, or nearly 75 feet to you, and 30 or so tall. Basically a Beast of legend then. They often ate insects, and while its attention was focused on the beetle, you had no doubt you’d be a tasty easy snack for it once done. Glancing one more time at the monsters locked in a death embrace, you turn and proceed deeper into the jungle. So that was your roommate? Well one of them. That’s what you heard last night right? You didn’t think so. Unlike the other creature, this thing had moved and struck silently. Even lumbering along if would not make as much noise as last night you figure. Still, a creature of its size and power would overwhelm you. You needed to be smarter, stealthier. Strength would not be any more than a mild speedbump to such a predator. You fall to your knees at the base of a nearby bush you've fled to and rub as much wettish dirt on you as possible.

The shrews presence also likely explains the bugs leaving the easily spotted nearby opening from earlier. You decide to forge on, the known dangers may have grown but the need for materials to survive was growing too. That and a need for food. What to do next?
14312112212111111.title: Further explore.

choices: Tell Devya where the machine is
Tell Devya you have to be with her to show her where the machine is
Tell Devya a lie about where the machine is
Tell Devya the machine was destroyed
Refuse to tell Devya anything, and show her your latest developments
1431211221213.content:
By the time the rumbling of the macro-beings shudders through the world, you've already been awake for three hours. You've performed your morning exercises, eaten your breakfast and pried one of the bugs from your traps.

It hadn't been as dead as you'd suspected - another lesson learned - and had tried to decapitate you with its mandibles. A thrust of your spear put an end to that, and you'd set to carving it apart for its meat and its armour-plated hide.

You're not sure what manner of bug or beetle it is, and while the world's owner, Devya, has tried on occasion to educate you on the features you share your habitat with, their names haven't held any value for you. No, all you care about is how easily they die and how good they taste.

Exposed in the open, there's no point to hiding as the daytime light is flicked on and the giantess approaches your glass prison. You stand and wipe some dark haemolymph on your trousers, trying to look presentable as she looms over you, hips at ground level.

She smiles and gives a little wave with her gigantic hand, still so timid when interacting with a quarter-inch man. As different from her mother as night and day.

Izna stoops to bring her eyes level with you, and you marvel again at how similar her face is to her mother's, differing really only in expression: her eyes are wide with wonder rather than cruel curiosity, and when she smiles it's at the comfort of others and not herself. How did this girl manage to avoid being so twisted by her psychopathic mother?

"Mother's late up today, so I thought I'd better get here quickly to make sure you got your light," she says. "That's why I'm such a mess, sorry."

Apologising, to the likes of you? And for something that doesn't even matter! If her clothes are ruffled, or her hair less than perfect, you can hardly notice. The fact that she even thinks of that though...

Or is this a trick? Is this wide-eyed teenager just playing a role assigned her by her mother, acting as 'good cop' to see how it affects your behaviour in her great glass petri dish? Gaaah, that woman has already got you doubting everything around you!

"Well, seems like you've managed to feed yourself, so no need for a supply drop today," Izna giggles. "Um, well, I've got to head off, but I'm sure mother will be along soon to see you. Is there anything you need, before I go?"

She wouldn't be able to hear you anyway, so you don't even attempt to bellow about how you desire your freedom, that as a human being you have the right to go where you please, to challenge yourself in the game of tiny survival in the manner of your choosing.

No, you just smile and give a salute, watching as her smile grows wider, her eyes narrow and she rises to leave.

Well, it was a distraction, but you've got to get back to it.

In an hour or so you've sliced the insect into steaks, the salvageable shards of its exoskeleton tied together to be used later for building materials, tools and armour.

Back at your makeshift shelter, you stash your supplies away before taking another slice of leaf to chew on for refreshment. Devya hadn't lied about all the plantlife here being edible, although climbing high enough to harvest from the house-sized leaves was quite a challenge, and the taste was rather bland. You couldn't live by this alone, hence the hunting.

Devya hadn't shown any annoyance at your killing of your room-mates, but she had other things on her mind.

As if summoned by your mere thought, the ground begins quaking with approach of a titan being, and you swallow down the last of your sustenance before heading out.

Devya strides across to you in far more terrifying aspect than her daughter, not smiling at all. She gives a cursory glance at the other terrariums before slamming a hand down on the glass roof of your world, shuddering the very air itself.

"Well," she says, "looks like you've adapted fairly well. But let's not beat around the bush here: are you ready to tell me where your shrinking machine is?"

Yeah, she's had other things on her mind recently. She's set her sights a little bit higher than just keeping one shrunken man as an experiment. "I could let you out of here, you know," she continues. "That's what you want, isn't it? I'll get a replacement, you can go on your way, we'll all be happy!"

Yeah, that doesn't strike you as a particularly good idea. She's been quietly asking about it for the last couple of days, and getting steadily more annoyed at your silence. Were you to refuse her again, it would not bring any great anger from her, but tomorrow..?

What approach should you take to this situation?
1431211221213.title: A Vast Prison

choices: Your planning is disturbed as someone walks in
You endeavour to find a new home first
You begin by scouting out the kitchen
You commence your adventure with a little giant-watching
You start by securing a possible exit, looking for a power source
15.content:
You push your chair back from the table and pat your belly appreciatively. Not another bite. It's the most delicious, expensive food you've ever eaten, here in the city's exclusive, top restaurant, but having sampled most of their menu you're ready to exit.

A smile to the waiter for him to bring the bill, and then you rise smoothly, heading toward the restroom. You've spent more money than you've had in your account all year, yet you smile. The staff and customers may have looked askance at your relatively slovenly attire, but you're wearing it for reasons other than looking good while eating. Why, those snooty upper class hogs are probably whispering about you right now, accusing you of trying to skip out on the bill by climbing through a window!

They're half right.

With your belly full of high quality food, your foray into shrunken adventure should be well supplied for at least a day. You'll have enough strength to acquire more, and from there the ultimate challenge will be yours to conquer!

Closing a cubicle door behind yourself, you adjust the device in your pocket, and feel the intensity of it warming up. You pause to lay a small bag on the ground by your feet, then allow the sensation to overwhelm you.

Your eyes open to a world where you are a mere quarter of an inch tall, standing before a grotesque idol to bodily functions, the stains and smells that a normally diligent cleaner would miss all too apparent. Choking back disgust, you pick up the rucksack that you took the precaution of shrinking earlier; it would have looked very odd to enter the restaurant carrying a bundle of survival gear!

Hefting it onto your shoulder, you take stock of the situation. The toilets are not the place you want to set up any sort of camp. Hygiene is one concern, as is the possibility of predatory insects that wouldn't think twice about eating you. Then there's the real possibility of a giant waiter coming in to see why you haven't returned to settle your debt! No, you need to get out of here as soon as possible.

Venturing under the yawning archway of the door,you marvel at the gleaming white chamber beyond, almost a marble temple to the gods. Almost. There will be much better sights once you're free of this stench hole!

The trek to the exit will take a few minutes, plenty of time to ponder a destination. Somewhere to sleep, or maybe staking out a hunting/gathering ground for supplies? Those can always come later though; being well fed, perhaps a little sight seeing, taking in the giants in their native habitat? All involve danger. It may be best to recharge the device - emptied by that last shrinking - so that you'll be able to restore yourself when you wish, although that would involve locating a suitable power source...
15.title: Restaurant

choices: One of the parents
Teenage daughter
One of the kids
152.content:
It was still quite a few hours till closing time. If you could find a spot to set up camp for the night, then you can grow back to normal size when the place is empty and take whatever food and cash you want home.

You slip underneath the door into the family side of the restaurant. You jog underneath a table where a family of five was seated. A mother, father, teenage daughter, and two children, boy and girl. While underneath the table, you notice that this table belonged to a booth, so you scan the booths for any holes that you can enter. You spot one behind the mothers sandaled foot, so you walk past her foot and enter the hole.

It looked like there was nothing else in there with you, so you decide this is the spot. Now to find your way to the safe or the kitchen. You were pondering a way to get over there when you hear footsteps approaching the table. You turn around and see a massive pair of denim clad legs standing by the table.

"Here you go guys. Sorry it took so long. I had to get these menu's from the back.", the waitress said.

The father says its okay then the waitress tells them she'll be back when they are ready to order. You think to yourself that if you can get on that waitress, she can take you to where you want to go. But you needed to get ontop of the table first. You decide the best way to get up there would be to climb one of the giants.

Who do you climb?
152.title: You endeavour to find a new home first

choices: Into the Waitress
Take a Menu of a chance
Enter the jungle to reach your goal
1521.content: The closet Parent was the Mother. she was the size of a literal mountain, she had a long grey dress which was perfect, it had enough grooves for you to hold on. with backpack in hand you race to her and begin the climb. Those endurance work out routines you did where put to excellent use and you could here the waitress talk about special's. The youngest kid kept swinging his legs almost hitting you a few times. so far the climb wasn't terrible and you've been rather lucky. "Good I should make it up to the table soon-" before You could finish as you where on the mothers titanic hand she began to reach the menu back to the waitress, this is it you got three choices ahead of you now: Jump onto the menu and slide into the waitress's apron, decide to stay on the giant mom and jump into the small corner of the high plants and walk through the "jungle" or jump into the monolith of the waitress's hand she has stretched out.
1521.title: The Mom-tain

choices: The waitress' leg intercepts you
The boy's foot swings out and kicks you
Nothing stops you hitting the floor
15212.content:
Clinging tight to the rough, warm surface of the woman's skin, you take the chance of jumping to the menu as it changes hands between customer and staff. To stay too close to humans is to invite annihilation; ideally you want to stay at arm's length!

You realise your mistake all too soon: the menu is coated in a glossy, non-stick surface, ideal for wiping clean after any spillages. Even to someone of your diminished scale, it is frighteningly smooth, with no handholds and no hope.

You plunge, all hopes of survival scattering below you like shards of your life. You are unsure whether you will be able to survive this plunge, and commit your life to fate -
15212.title: Hand-Off

choices: You're eventually scooped up and carried into the young woman's mouth.
She spills a bit of her soup (and you) as she eats.
"Waiter!  There's a Fly in my Soup!"
152122.content:
BAM!!

You saw stars as a titanic sneaker slammed into you. If it weren't for the softness of its leather exterior, your body would've been dashed into a tiny splotch of red. You were launched, careening through the air like a fly without wings. Wind whistled in your ears as hurtled in a slightly concussed daze.

As you tumbled head over heels, a bizarre landing spot began to fill your vision. A huge, white lake. You were quickly overwhelmed by a creamy aroma. Too disoriented to put together where you were headed, you plummeted half-conscious toward the body of liquid.

Plop!

You landed softly in the swamp. It was just thick enough to keep you above the surface, your lower half submerged in the hot sludge. You looked up at walls looming in the distance, easily containing whatever you’d tumbled into. Higher still was the underside of a chin and nose you recognized. Your waiter? The ceiling blurred above his head as he carried the delicious-smelling sea you were in.

You paled with the realization of where you were. A soup. More specifically, a soup that was about to be served. Small islands of chicken and dumplings floated nearby, all dwarfing your quarter inch frame. The broth was too heavy to swim to them. Shreds of spinach were scattered like seaweed. Like you, they didn't even break the surface tension of the aromatic muck. Suddenly, everything pitched as the waiter stopped.

“Alright, who had the Chicken Gnocchi?” He asked over a multitude of chattering voices.

“That's mine, thanks.” A booming, distinctly female voice said eagerly.

At this, point you were struggling desperately. The device's battery was drained. You were hopelessly tiny and covered in soup. Everything shifted as the waiter lifted the bowl off what you assumed to be a much larger platter. Your stomach dropped as he lowered it rapidly until it landed with a thunderous “Clink!” on the table. As he began passing out the other dishes, you peered skyward to see whose dinner you were stranded in.

“God, I’m starving.” The enormous girl rumbled. She looked to be in her early 20’s. Her lidded, blue eyes stared down hungrily. They contrasted quite nicely with dark brown hair and lightly tanned skin. Minimal contouring enhanced what was an already pretty, albeit obscenely humongous, face. Red lipstick drew your gaze to her mouth. The plump lips parted, allowing a glistening tongue to push out. It left them glossed with saliva as it swept over quickly. The spaghetti straps of her white dress left her shoulders mostly uncovered. Her neckline wasn't any more modest. It swept far below her collarbones, displaying a smooth expanse of sunkissed flesh.

Her arm swung overhead, prepped with a gleaming spoon. You waved and shouted at the top of your lungs from the mire of her meal. It was pointless. You might as well have been a stray hunk of chicken. The stainless-steel tower she held descended toward your spot in the bowl, ready to collect a pool's worth of soup.
152122.title: Punted and Served

choices: Everything goes dark as you're pushed into her mouth.
She's a bit of a messy eater; you wind up on her lower lip.
She is knocked from behind and spills her food.
1521221.content:
You could only watch in horror as the spoon plunged through the surface of the creamy bog. Its basin disappeared just a few yards away from where you were trapped. The gorgeous titan above put on an awesome display of power, dragging it immediately back up. The soup shuddered around you as her now full spoon breached like submarine. It rocketed past her immense cleavage and neck, growing smaller until it reached her distant face. In a single, chilling motion, she guided the soup into her massive mouth.

She chewed slowly, savoring a shed-sized piece of grilled chicken. You couldn’t look away as her mighty jaws and cheeks churned. It was surreal to watch at such a minute scale. The muscles in her neck visibly plunged inward as she swallowed with a wet gulp.

Her spoon angled down again, this time aimed directly at you. You tried to fight through the cement-like soup as it impacted just to your left. With a mighty hand, she guided it into the deep. You began to panic as you felt it lurking below your position. In a desperate mix of clawing and and swimming, you tried fruitlessly to get away. You felt it before you saw it; the spoon was rising.

With disorienting speed, you were carried up to the girl’s stunning face. You felt like a speck as you took in her enormity. From a distance she was huge but up close, she was world-filling. Wide stretches of tan skin were dusted with makeup. The beauty of her sharp features was drastically magnified. She wasn't an attractive girl but a breathtaking monolith.

Dread and muggy breath washed over you as her lips parted. Full and pouty, you probably would've found them hot if they weren't about to devour you. Ropes of saliva stretched between her palate and the fearsome tongue beneath. The giant maw before you seemed to yawn open in slow-motion, revealing revealing rows of impeccable teeth. The spoon lurched as she shoveled the soup and you toward the slick cavern.
1521221.title: Fine Dining

choices: Press on, heedless of danger
Climb the skirting board until the cleaning is done
Use the cleaner as a means of transport
153.content:
Of course, the toilets and the kitchen are pretty far apart in this restaurant. 'Pretty far' to a normal-scaled person translates as an 'incalculable distance' to quarter-inch tall you. You roll over in your head the many obstacles that could become apparent as you trek there.

The restaurant is open and doing business, and staff and customers will be walking about almost constantly - the risk of being trodden into the carpet is all too real!

As you finally reach the door of the toilets, a giant strides over you with earth-shaking power, an awesome reminder of your precise place in the world now. Each of his footsteps crashes deafeningly against the tiles, your insect-like patter inaudible in comparison.

You make the change from tile to carpet with a little trepidation; the fibres are thick and tall, and while they're closely packed enough that walking atop them is possible, there are worn areas where even your trim weight topples them.

It's slow going, and the distance is incredible. In the distance you can make out the heaven-piercing forms of tables and chairs, and skies rumbling with the conversation of seated, hungry gods. In the interests of safety, you hug the skirting board, well clear of any idle feet.

You inch along, every step a triumph as you hum to yourself, freezing each time a shoe slams down beside you. You even recognise the giant that passed you in the toilets, already done with his business and you no more than a foot or two closer to the kitchens!

Still, your belly is full, so there's no rush to get to your destination. You have the luxury of being able to take regular rests across your trek, and know that the place will still be there once this restaurant closes up for the night.

In fact, you're no more than halfway across the floor by the time the last customers depart, a young couple arm in gigantic arm complimenting the staff as they stride out of the building.

Now comes a time you had feared - the potential clean-up after hours, where a staff member may well vacuum you up as they go about their job!
153.title: If You Can't Stand the Heat

info.brief_description: You decide to shrink yourself super tiny and survive, nobody aware of your existence.
info.description:
You are you.

Always being a fan of shrinking, survival shows, survival stories/scenarios, being a huge environmental conservationist and you being tired of the world. You decide to put all of your money into shrinking yourself and surviving off your surroundings. You told your family and anyone else who care for you in your life that you are traveling the world and will be banning the use of any phones but will leave emails. These emails that you are sending are already made and being automated to send regularly so no one will worry about you.

Now you just need to decide what environment you want to shrink yourself in and consider it's dangers and advantages...

Backyard survival: You will shrink yourself in your parents' and neighbors' backyard. It will be a grassy jungle where you will truly have to fend for yourself for the most part. In your backyard is the danger of your two parents and 2 younger sisters, in the other backyard is your 47 year old single woman who loves to garden. You will have to watch out for the occasional lawnmower from your dad and be very wary of being in the neighbor's garden for too long. Some miscellaneous dangers with humans but your biggest threat will be insects and the occasional animal. You will almost exclusively be on your own and have to use the maximum of your survival skills as leftover food from humans may be scarce.

Indoor survival: Quite the opposite as you shrink yourself in the neighbor's home (Neighbors before you moved out for your life change). A strange environment that ranges from a weird jungle of carpet strands to a desert of hardfloor, sources of food and drink can be available in abundance for great risk and limited time. The 39 year olds Rachel and Dan are parents still well into their sexual peak to an 18 year old girl and two younger children. You will have to be careful for the whims of humans that will be like gods to you. The occasional bug may be a threat but the family is by far the greatest. There is also the safety blanket of them finding you in case things get bad.

Urban survival: Shrunk in the city. You will be in a bumpy mess of concrete, living almost exclusively off of the giants above. The environment will consist of dark corridors to massive amounts of hard ground where giants commute. The danger is being super tiny while thousands of people, rich and poor walk to their destinations, not giving a care for the tiny person they may almost step on. Food will be of abundance but competition with insects and animals may force quick acquisition of weapons and craftiness.

Beach survival: Shrunk at the beach, you stare at one horizon being blue and one being tan. The environment will be either a hot desert speckled with various people depending on the day or a deceptively dangerous sea filled with some waves over thousands of feet tall. Food will be available in the form of human leftovers or sea creatures. Humans are always a threat but the sea life and animals have a new member of their foodchain, depending on how smart and strong you get.

Restaurant survival: Surviving at the burger fast food place should've been easy but you wonder just how easy it is. Your environment will be a hard floor with many different weird shaped buildings that are actually seats. Be careful the giant customers and workers. Leftover food will only be available for limited time due to the worker's cleaning and eating fresh food is a huge risk. How long can you survive in this death trap?

Rules: The only rule is no underage sexual scenes, kids can be in the story for realistic situations but please no sexual tones with them.

More on the unaware side with this story but you can be found. Try to stick with the survival environment but if you are found and taken elsewhere, well these things happen although with a creative mind you can always find a way to end up getting stuck back to surviving but it's up to you.

Thanks to 4Eva for creating this world, and for the trust and honour I feel at having it transferred into my care. This wouldn;t be here without them.
